The game has a two player mode where the second player controls a gun along the bottom of the screen and the lemons appear from the top moving downwards.
title: Ludwig's Lemon Lasers

description: Pak Bomber is a variant of the arcade game Avalanche. A character similar to a ghost from Pac-Man drops bombs from the top of the screen and it's up to the player to catch them so they do not detonate. To do so a basket is used and the controls are limited to moving it left and right. The game is divided into rounds where a number of bombs are dropped in a specific pattern. If all bombs are caught the game moves on to the next round. The player has three lives and one is lost when a bomb is missed. An extra life is given after 20,000 points.
title: Pak Bomber

description: Space Rescue is a variant of the arcade game Lunar Rescue. A crew has been stranded on a remote planet and it is up to the player to rescue them. This is done with a shuttle craft that is dropped from a mothership at the top of the screen. The player has to steer the craft through a stream of meteors and reach one of three landing pads at the surface. There are four crew members and for each landing two enters the craft. The player then has to guide the craft back to the mothership. A gun can be used to destroy meteors but the ammo is limited. Unlike the arcade game, shooting can be done in both directions but this version does not have a thrust mechanic. There are four shuttles available and after crashing with all four, the game is over.
title: Space Rescue

description: Zipper is a fixed screen shoot 'em up. It plays similarly to other games of its kind but instead of vicious aliens the enemies here are ordinary objects such as flowers, apples and umbrellas. Each wave have different enemies and they move back and forth across the screen while firing their projectiles at the player who controls a spaceship along the bottom of the screen. The ship has a limited amount of gas but it can be refuelled by shooting gas canisters that at times fall from the sky. Lives are lost when gas runs out, or when hit by either enemy fire or a falling gas canister. The player has five lives when starting out.
title: Zipper

description: Moons of Jupiter is a variant of the arcade game Asteroids. The player is in command of a fleet of destroyers and the task is to blast a passage through Jupiter's moons. One destroyer is in action at a time and the player controls it like in any other game of its kind, with one key being used for thrust and two additional being used to rotate the craft. The moons move around the screen and have to be shot before they collide with the space ship and will then split into smaller ones. The player has five lives and an extra one is awarded upon clearing the screen. In addition to the moons there are UFOs and the indestructible gologs to watch out for.
title: Moons of Jupiter

description: A-maz-ing is a Pac-Man variant with features largely identical to other versions. Set in a maze inhabited by four mean ghosts, the player's gobbler has to attempt to eat the dots that are littered around the corridors while avoiding the ghosts that kill the gobbler upon contact. Four large power dots are located in the corners of the maze and by eating them the gobbler can go after and kill the ghosts for a short while. The objective is simply to eat all the dots but a level is in fact completed when only a few dots are left.
title: A-maz-ing

description: Amoeba is a single screen game where giant amoebas have landed and are trying to take over the world. The amoebas appear on the screen in pods, each containing six of them. The player's task is to remove them by moving a laser probe over them which automatically kills them. It's necessary to be very quick about it though because with time they will start to multiply. After that has happened the amoebas cannot be removed since any contact with them will lead to instant destruction of the probe and the game will be over. Amoebas that multiply stay on the screen throughout the game making it harder for the player to move around.

sample_screenshots.caption: Game over after hitting a multiplied amoeba
More and more of the screen gets occupied by amoebas
Take to long and the amoebas will multiply

title: Amoeba

description:
Submariner is a graphical text based adventure game played from a first person perspective. The game takes place aboard an abandoned submarine where the player is on a secret mission to obtain pictures of a weapon that is being developed on a remote island. The player's objectives are to find a camera, surface the submarine and leave it by climbing the exit ladder.

The player moves around the submarine with three commands: move forward (f), rotate right (r) and rotate left (l). Four commands can be used to interact with the environment: get, drop, open hatch, turn valve and climb. Get is used to pick up items and drop is used to remove them from the inventory since it only has space for two items. Opening a hatch requires having a crowbar in the inventory while moving in dark rooms requires a torch. Turning a valve requires a wrench and raises the submarine by 49 fathoms. To fully surface two valves have to be turned.

sample_screenshots.caption: In front of a valve but a wrench is needed to turn it
Using get command to take camera

title: Submariner

description:
In Wacky Waiters you control a waiter that has to get from one end of the screen to the other to deliver drinks to the beckoning customers waiting there. Each level consists of platforms and elevators and you have to use the elevators to move across the level and up/down platforms.

If you drop into one of the elevator shafts or if the time runs out you are fired. Get fired three times and it's Game Over.

sample_screenshots.caption: In the lift. Interior design of this bar is wacky.
What a shame to fall in front of the boss.

title: Wacky Waiters

description: The evil magician Mordread has cast you into the haunted dungeon beneath his castle. He has turned you, once a mighty wizard, into a magical key. You start out as a black key and the job at hand is to open the doors of the level by changing the colour of the key to the colour of the door. Unlocking a door can either reveal a dead end or a passage behind that leads to a new part of the maze. The dungeon is occupied with ghosts that will chase you down and take one of your five lives if they manage to catch you.

sample_screenshots.caption: About to be grabbed by a ghost.
Taking the green key to the first green lock.
The dark blue key won't help me here, I'll have to go back and get a different color key.

title: Bewitched

description: Fred is an orphan that has been captured and locked in a cage in the Mega Vault of the evil Doctor Zorklef. You play the role of Fred's pet Megaboopa and the objective is to find the key to let Fred free. Along the way, you have to pick up food to maintain your energy levels and avoid the moving Mega Mines and Ultron lasers. Once you pick up the key, you have to return to the cage and let Fred out.
title: Mega Vault

description: The Perils of Willy is a cut-down VIC-20 version of Manic Miner. The premise is that Willy is returning home from the party and while walking through the park he needs to skip lightly over the ducks and catch notes of music that seem to hang in the air. It includes 33 levels of platforming where pixel perfect jumps will allow him to reach hard to reach places and avoid nasties that are after him. Platforms below can crumble and conveyor belts take him closer to his destination or doom.
title: The Perils of Willy

description: In this game, a horde of mosquitos attacks you and your only weapon is a chemical spray. One bite from a mosquito and you are dead. You are in a maze visible from the top. The game consists of four screens. To go to the next screen, you have to find a key. The maze sometimes goes black to harden your challenge. Find the keys to replenish your spray and hope for the best.
title: Mosquito

description: Mission Mercury is a clone of the arcade game Lunar Rescue, in which you have to rescue scientists stranded on the planet Mercury. As soon as you press the fire button to release the lander from the mothership, you have to steer very carefully through an asteroid belt to land on three pads so that the scientist can get on board. You then have to make your way back to the mothership while dodging the asteroids again. You can press the fire button to increase speed on the way back. Getting hit by one of the asteroids or touching the edges of the mothership will send you crashing to the surface and you lose one of your three lives. Run out of them and the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of the asteroids caused the lander to crash into the surface
A scientist is making its way toward the lander
The scientist went on board the mothership

title: Mission Mercury

description: Use the joystick or keyboard to steer your ship at the bottom center of the screen while shooting meteors that home in on you. Other spaceships, UFOs, and tanker ships will occasionally appear and you must shoot these as well. Every time you are hit, the screen will flash white to indicate that your shield energy is depleted. Get hit enough times and the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: A tanker ship is homing on you

title: Meteor Blaster

description: Bolder Dan is a Boulder Dash clone for the VIC-20. Dig around in the dirt, collect diamonds, and avoid the falling rocks and moving creatures. The game also features difficulty settings.

sample_screenshots.caption: Remote cousin of Rockfort from Bouder Dash?

title: Bolder Dan

description:
A vertically scrolling shootemup for the VIC-20, including parallax effects. Raid the starships to find 3 power units and avoid the turrets and space bats.

Some playfield blocks can be destroyed, but also respawn after a while. Once the units are collected, you have to turn back and go through the exit which appears right at the starting point.

sample_screenshots.caption: The title screen shakes in sync with the music

title: Super Starship Space Attack

description: In this side-scrolling platform game, you are a constantly bouncing ball called Bertie, and you have the urge to collect magic items, for some reason. The game is comparable to Cauldron II. Your health is monitored with the magic meter, and drops when encountering hazards.
title: Bertie the Ball

description: In this isometric puzzle-solving action platformer, you wake up and you cannot remember where you are. Turns out, you are a prisoner of the grim castle of Pentagorat. This situation calls for some adventuring! Avoid hazards, collect items, and solve puzzles to regain your freedom.
title: Pentagorat

description: Horizontal space shoot-em-up, inspired by games such as Gradius. You control a drone in space, defending yourself from some hostile aliens. There are many useful power-ups and you must blast your way through various levels.
title: Pulse

description: This title is a first person maze game using the same engine as an unofficial DOOM recreation for the VIC-20. Find the keys while adventuring throughout 256 levels, before your oil lamp expires.
title: The Keep

description: Torg is a variant of the arcade game Targ. Like the original game, it is a shoot 'em up set in a grid-like maze where the player starts out in the bottom right corner and ten enemies start from the top row. The objective of the game is simply to shoot down all the enemies while avoiding crashing into them. Crashes lead to one of three lives being lost. Once a level has been cleared the game moves on the next one and as the player progresses through the game it gets harder with more enemies.
title: Torg

description: Skier is an alpine skiing game. The game is played from a top perspective of the hill and the game scrolls from top to bottom. The skier automatically moves down the hill and the player has to steer left and right while trying to hit as many flags as possible. Double points are awarded when managing to knock a flag over and bonus points are given for reaching the finish line. Hitting a tree will lead to death for the skier while touching an ice path will cause it to skid. After losing a skier the player gets two more attempts at completing the race.
title: Skier

description: Spiders of Mars is a side scrolling shoot 'em up where the player controls a fly. Similar to Defender it is possible to move both left and right but here the objective is simply to destroy a number of creatures in each level. There are four different creatures with different behaviour but all lead to death upon contact: bats, dragonflies, wasps and spiders of Mars. Bats flutter about without shooting while dragonflies leave trails of deadly dust bombs which home in on the player. The wasps appear from the right and fire stings swiftly at the player. The spiders descend from the top and spin webs that prevent the player from moving. If they reach the ground they will start firing new webs upwards. The player has three lives and gets an extra one upon reaching 10,000 points.
title: Spiders of Mars

description: Tank Wars is an action game played from a top down perspective on a single screen. It's a one on one game where the player controls a tank and has to defeat an AI controlled tank. Movement is possible in four directions and the tank will move forward until direction is changed. On the screen are trees, mines and a lake that act as obstacles in different ways. Trees stop the tank and cannot be fired through while lakes only stop the tank but can still be fired over. Mines will blow up the tank if moved over. The player has five tanks and when they have all been destroyed, the game ends.
title: Tank Wars

description: Hoppit is a Frogger variant which mostly resembles the river section of the arcade game. The player has to help a frog over a road in rush hour traffic but rather than avoiding vehicles they have to be jumped onto. The frog starts out at the bottom and has to reach the top of the screen by jumping between traffic islands, grass verges and trams that move across the screen. Falling onto the road leads to the frog instantly being killed by invisible vehicles that pass by and one out of three lives is lost. The player has one and a half minutes to reach safety and will then move on to the next road.
title: Hoppit

description: Mickey the Bricky is a Donkey Kong inspired platform game The objective is to pick up his lost tools on the building site and get to the top of the screen via ladders, avoiding rolling barrels along the way. Five different level layouts are available as the player advances through the game.
title: Mickey the Bricky

description: Snake Bite is a variation of the Snake type of games. The player controls a snake like object moving about the screen gobbling up randomly located objects along the way. Every object consumed increases the snake's length, one unit for each fruit and two for each bug. The perimeter is surrounded by a fence and mushrooms are strewn around the screen, both of which are to be avoided, resulting in a loss of life when hit. Once all crops have been consumed it is on to the next level. There are three difficulty levels, determining the speed the snake moves around the screen.
title: Snake Bite

alternate_titles.title: Martian Raider: An arcade-style game for the VIC-20

description: This is a Scramble clone where the object is fly your craft over several terrain, bombing alien cities. You also have to avoid or shoot at enemies that approach your craft, including rockets, UFOs, and meteorites with your equipped photon lasers. Fill up on fuel before it runs empty to increase flying time. The game is over when all of your three lives are lost.
title: Martian Raider

description:
Mind Twisters is a collection of four puzzle games that pitts you against the VIC.

Blackjack is a card game where the object is to reach 21 on your first two cards, or reach a score higher than the dealer without exceeding that number. You start the game with £1000, and you break the bank if you reach £20,000.

Decipher is a version of Mastermind. Five colored squares, representing yellow, green, purple, and blue, and you are trying to break the hidden code by pressing the keys Y, G, P, and B. If a solid circle is displayed, it means that you have the correct color in the correct position. If a solid circle is displayed, it means that you have the correct color in the wrong position.

In Four Thought, you are playing against the VIC in an attempt to align four of your counters in a diagonal, horizontal, or vertical line before it does.

In Teaser, the object is to pick three of the nine boxes that make up a total of 15. The VIC is doing the same thing. If all the boxes are taken, it is a draw.

sample_screenshots.caption: Four Thought - A game in progress

title: Mind Twisters

description: A clone of Space Invaders for the VIC-20, the object is to destroy four rows of invaders to proceed to the next wave. The invaders will fire shots at you, but you can protect yourself by hiding behind the three barriers that eventually get dismantled by the shots. You have three bases, and once all your bases are destroyed, the game ends. Unique features of the games are its fast speed and the ability to choose the difficulty level.
title: VIC Invaders

description: You are a spider whose aim is to eat flies in a maze of bushes, but stopping you from doing this is a creature known as the Weasel, who will follow you around, even going so far as passing through the bushes. Once you eat all the flies on screen, you must enter one of the bushes to complete the level and move onto the next one where there will be more flies to eat. Although you deal with only one Weasel in the game, the further you progress the faster it moves. If the Weasel makes contact with you, the game will end.
title: Fly Snatcher

description: Reversi is an ancient board game for two players, where the object is to get more pieces than your opponents. This is the computer version for the VIC-20 has you pitted against the computer. Pieces can be put down horizontally, vertically, or diagonally, and is done by entering a grid reference (from A1 to H8). Any of your opponent pieces that lie between your target spot and the previous one will be yours. People who are unfamiliar with the game will be able to view some instructions as well as a demonstration.

sample_screenshots.caption: The red X indicates that the computer has made its move
The computer giving you a demonstration

title: Reversi

description: In this ancient game, you are playing against the computer, and the object is to take turns removing one or more matchsticks from any of the five rows. Whoever takes the last match wins the game. Before the game starts, players can watch a demonstration (by allowing the computer to play itself) if they are unfamiliar with the game's concept.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can choose who goes first, or let the computer play itself

title: Nim

description: Masterwits is a version of Mastermind for the VIC-20 home computer. The object is to guess a random combination of four colors determined by the computer out of six, and the player must use the keys 1 through 6 corresponding to each color listed at the bottom of the keys. Once the player makes their selection, one of two arrows will appear. A black up arrow indicates the correct color in the correct position, while a white up arrow indicates the correct color, but in the wrong position. When the player has four black arrows, they will win the game.
title: Masterwits

description: Wall Street is a text-based stock market simulation, where the object is to buy or sell shares in an attempt to make your first million. You can watch the plot of the day's trading within 30 days. During that time period, pressing a key on the keyboard brings up an option screen where you can buy or sell shares, or review your history. At the end of the 30 days, you can either keep going or continue beyond that.

sample_screenshots.caption: Watch that line graph being created

title: Wall Street

description: UMI's take on the popular board game Checkers is for one player only, with the other player being the computer itself. Both of you start out with 12 counters each and you are trying to move all your pieces to the other side of the board while capturing your opponent's pieces. You initially can go forward across the board until one of your pieces land on the other side. When it does, that piece becomes king, meaning that the piece can go forward or backward. You win the game when you have totally dominated the board.

sample_screenshots.caption: A lot less of my opponent's counters are on the board
The computer made its first move

title: Kiddie Checkers

description: Using the joystick or keyboard, you must shoot the invaders that fall down from the sky before they touch the ground. There can be a maximum of four invaders on screen at once, and as you progress through the game, the invaders get faster. Occasionally, a UFO appears and tries to shoot your ship, and shooting it before it does awards you with bonus points. The game ends when a UFO manages to kill you or one of the invaders touches the ground.
title: Invader Fall

description:
This compilation for the VIC-20 features three games which can be played with the joystick or keyboard:

* Vic Trap - The game features two snakes: one controlled by you, and the other controlled by the VIC itself. The object is to make your opponent crash, while the VIC does the same thing. The two of you will leave a trail behind, making it impossible to pass through. The game will gradually speed up the longer you survive without crashing.

* Sea Wolf - Not to be confused with Commodore's version, you are a submarine trying to destroy as enemy ships as it can within sixty seconds. The ships discharge mines occasionally, and these get in your way and also must be destroyed. Points vary depending on what part of the screen the ship is on. Scoring 800 points awards you with another 30 seconds of play.

* Bounce Out - In this Breakout clone, you are trying to clear six rows of bricks at the top of the playfield. This is done by moving your bat left or right and using it to ricochet the ball either off walls or other bricks. Once the playfield is cleared, you move onto the next one. You have ten lives, so use them wisely, because the game ends when all lives are lost.

sample_screenshots.caption: Bounce Out - The Game Over screen is similar to the title screen, except that your score and your highest scores are displayed.
Bounce Out - The title screen also allows you to choose the paddle size. Selecting the longest paddle (2) makes the game easier
Vic Trap - A game in progress
Bounce Out - One brick to go

title: Action Games

description: You take control of a ship piloting through space, destroying asteroids that appear in random places. This is accomplished by moving your crosshair over them and pressing the fire button. When you have destroyed enough asteroids without losing a life, they gradually move faster. Lives take the form of a damage meter at the bottom-right, and when this meter fills up red, the game ends.

sample_screenshots.caption: An asteroid can be seen in the horizon

title: Space Storm

description: Simple Simon is an interpretation of Ralph Baer's classic "touch" game of the '80s, where the player needs to memorize a sequence of colors and tones and then press one of four function keys that are associated with that color and tone. As the player gets sequences correct, these sequences will become longer. The game ends if the player gets it wrong.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game has started, and the player is told to press the yellow key

title: Simple Simon

description: Your rocket ship is preparing for launch and you must answer 20 simple division questions prior to takeoff. A number is written below the ship, which decreases by one every time you answer correctly. Get an answer wrong and you have to try again. Answer all 20 questions correct and the ship takes off, traveling so many miles into space. Distance into space is dependent on total of correct answers. The game starts over once the ship has traveled for long enough.

sample_screenshots.caption: When you answered all questions correctly, you see the rocket take off...
The screen will go berzerk if you answered a problem correctly
As you answer more questions correctly, the two status bars change

title: Space Division

description: Addition or subtraction problems involving decimals are written in the sky by two radar dishes, and it is your job to enter in the correct answer. Unlike many education programs that involve solving sums, Sky Math does not determine whether or not you gave an incorrect answer after you entered it in full. Instead, if the first digit you enter is wrong, a UFO appears and disintegrates that digit. A correct digit will allow you to proceed with the rest of the sum. Once you completed the sum, the radar dishes will give you another one to complete. Pressing the [Return] key takes you back to the menu where you can select what type of sums you want.

sample_screenshots.caption: All of the problems involve decimals
The UFO arrives to disintegrate the wrong answer.
The correct answer sets in the background
The satellite on the left is beaming out the first number

title: Sky Math

description: This is an update of Invader Fall, with the addition of terrain and a few gameplay tweaks. The object is to move your ship left or right, dodging invaders as they fall from the sky. A UFO will occasionally pass by, and if you don't move while it is on the screen, it will zero in on your ship and blast it. The invaders move faster as you progress through the game. Initially, the game ends when either you let an invader touch the surface or the UFO shoots you dead, but when you acquire enough shots you are given another chance.

sample_screenshots.caption: As the game progresses, all the enemies take on different appearances

title: Kosmic Kamikaze

description: You are trapped in a maze along with four aliens, which need to be destroyed by digging holes around the maze so that they can fall through them. Once an alien has fallen through one of these holes, you have a limited amount of time to seal it back up before the alien escapes. Once you have killed all aliens, you proceed to the next maze. You will be eaten by the aliens if you come into contact with them. Lose all your lives and the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Dug several holes for the aliens to fall through

title: The Alien

description:
Squeeze is an arcade game for the VIC-20.

Your fields are dry, and you need to dig a series of ditches to irrigate them. Unfortunately, the bulls don't take kindly to human folks in their territory, and they'll try to chase you down.

Played initially on a large empty field, the character can only move in the dry portions of the field in the 4 cardinal directions. As the player moves, they create a ditch behind them, which can be used to water portions of the field by connecting two points of a dry section together. The smaller of the two sections will always be filled. 3 bulls, who move randomly about the lines previously laid down, pose a danger to the character. A level is completed by watering the entirety of the field, and the player progresses to a new level with faster moving enemies. The goal is to achieve maximum score. The player has a total of 3 lives, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Squeeze

description:
Astro Patrol is an science-fiction themed arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a spaceship which moves in the 4 cardinal directions. The player's ship has a laser gun which shoots to the right of the screen. Alien vessels stream from the right. Every alien vessel that bypasses the player awards points to the aliens, while the player receives points for shooting down alien vessels. At 1000 points, the player starts wave 2, which has alien vessels moving in more complex patterns, and the player is accompanied by a second vessel.

The game ends at 2100 points, where the final score is the difference between the player's and aliens' scores.
title: Astro Patrol

description:
Flip N Match is a 1 or 2-player tile-matching game the VIC-20.

Contains 2 difficulty levels, a standard 100-tile matching puzzle with 50 different pieces each containing a single match, or a simpler version called Flip N Match Jr., where there are a total of 25 tiles with 12 pairs and a single wild card. Game play allows for 2-player versus mode or single-player timed games where the goal is to match all tiles before a timer runs out.
title: Flip N Match

description: A two-player game set in outer space, where one player controls their Astro Fighter with the joystick, while the other controls theirs with the keyboard. The object is to eliminate the other as many times as you can before time expires. Obstacles such as Proton Stars, hostile planets, and other space debris also need to be avoided. A time limit (between 1-9 minutes) is set before the game.
title: Astro Fighters

description: In this educational game for one player, the object is to count the number of acrobats on the rope. There is a maximum of seven acrobats that can be on the rope. If you answer enough questions correctly, you are treated to a performance where the last set of acrobats will jump off the rope, onto the trampoline, and land on the ground. Getting an answer wrong results in the question being repeated. The game ends when two groups of acrobats are on the ground. The difficulty can be adjusted before the game starts, with higher ones having you count the acrobats that land on the ground as well.

sample_screenshots.caption: An acrobat jump onto the trampoline...
If you get the answer wrong, the question will be repeated

title: At the Circus

description: Using the joystick or keyboard, you fly a helicopter over fixed terrain bombing enemies including tanks, missile launchers, and convoys who will try to destroy you mid-air. From time to time, a rocket homes in on your location and you must destroy this rocket before it reaches you. You start out with five lives. Lose all of them and the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Launching a bomb at the enemy below

title: Chopper

description: A Depthcharge clone where the object is to wipe out as many enemy submarines as you can before time runs out. Wiping out submarines awards you with points, but the number of points you earn depends on where in the water they are. For instance, wiping out a submarine on the bottom level awards you with the most points than the one closest to you. While shooting at the submarines, you also need to protect yourself from both their harpoons and the airplane dropping bombs as it passes by, because if you come into contact with any of these you will lose one of your lives. Lose them all and the game ends.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of the submarines killed me
Awarded four points for that one
A plane flies overhead, dropping bombs

title: Destroyer

description: You take control of a tank surrounded by a shield. On opposite sides of it are bushes which various types of enemies emerge from. These enemies not only shoot at you, but they are also capable of destroying the shield and have the ability to call in reinforcements if their numbers are low. Your object, then, is to wipe out any enemies that appear as soon as you can before more appear. Your tank can block their shots and can also destroy any bushes. You proceed to the next level once there are no more enemies on the screen. The game can be played with two players, but not simultaneously.

sample_screenshots.caption: I killed an enemy while part of my shield was damaged

title: Galactic Crossfire

description: A golf game from Audiogenic for up to two players, where you are presented with a 3rd-person view of a golf course. To make a shot, you have to select the angle of the ball, as well as the type of club for each obstacle. Up to four wood clubs and up to seven iron clubs can be used, each one capable of going a certain distance. You are penalized for going out of bounds.
title: Golf

description: Two players control cowboys on opposite sides of the screen. Their object is to kill each other, but they cannot move towards each other but are restricted to an up-down movement. Separating the cowboys are cacti and a moving wagon that will block their shots upon contact. The first player that reaches five kills wins the match.

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying to shoot at the wagon, only to miss

title: Gunfight

description: Two cowboys wage war on each other somewhere in a desert for a period of time chosen by the player at the start of the game. Whoever kills their opponent scores a point, but watch out: shots can ricochet off rocks and cacti, killing anyone in their line of sight. One- to two-player game where one player controls their cowboy with the joystick, the other with the keyboard. You can choose to play against the computer as well.

sample_screenshots.caption: I have shot my opponent, and now he is dying

title: Gunfight

description: A clone of Frogger where you must guide your frog across a busy highway to the city in the middle of the screen, then across the river to one of five safety homes at the top of the screen. Once all five homes are filled, you proceed to the next level where you do it all over again. Colliding with logs, buildings, or traffic results in a loss of lives, and the game ends when all of them are lost.

sample_screenshots.caption: Got into two homes so far

title: Hopper

description:
A variant of Lunar Rescue where your task is to rescue several astronauts stranded on the moon's surface. This is done by ejecting your LEM (Lunar Excursion Module) from the mothership, navigating an asteroid field, and landing on one of the designated areas on the moon's surface. If done properly, one of the astronauts will then enter the LEM, and you must then take off, get through the asteroid field again (you can shoot the asteroids to make it easy), and dock with the mothership in order for the rescue to be successful. Only one astronaut can be on board, so return trips will be necessary. If you miss a designated area, hit an asteroid, or fail to dock with the mothership, you lose one of your three LEMs. The game ends when you run out of these.

What sets Rabbit's version from other variants of the time are the number of variations:

  • Two players can join in on the action, with both players alternating between turns.
  • With the player's consent, the asteroids can turn into ships that fire at you while you are making your way back.
  • Several docking methods are available, including one in which the mothership will line up with the LEM's location rather than going back and forth across the screen.
  • The speed of the asteroids can be set, but this can be changed during the game.
  • The mothership can automatically eject the LEM, or it can be ejected by pressing [A] on the keyboard.
  • Up to ten sets of terrain can be chosen, or they can be randomly selected. If the player chooses to have random terrain, it changes after all the astronauts are rescued.

sample_screenshots.caption: The asteroids mysteriously transformed into ships
The ship making its way to the moon service

title: Lunar Rescue

description: In this modified take on Space Invaders, you have to get through six waves of aliens that have different attack formations, and dodge their projectiles by moving left or right. Your only line of defense is your built-in cannon capable of firing three shots at once. Pay attention to the energy meter next to your score, because if it is too low, your firepower will be restricted. If you are hit by any of the projectiles, you lose one of your three lives. Once you have completed all six waves, you are placed in a bonus wave where the object is to navigate a road that moves in a zig-zag pattern. After that is completed, the game restarts on wave one, but with a higher difficulty setting. The game ends when you run out of lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: After completing the sixth wave, the game restarts with higher difficulty
Firing a shot at the enemies above

title: Multitron

description: Nightcrawler is a clone of Centipede where you have to fight the titular creature in a garden at night. The object is to shoot the centipede fragment by fragment as it makes its way down toward you. Once the centipede has been wiped out, you proceed to the next wave. You must also deal with spiders and other pests that prevent you from achieving your goal, and new pests are introduced as you get further through the game. If you are attacked by centipede or pest, you will lose one of your lives. The game ends when these run out. Before the game, you can select the difficulty level which determines how fast the game runs.

sample_screenshots.caption: Shooting the spider awards you with points
The red thing that needs to be avoided

title: Nightcrawler

description: In this variation of Money Wars, you control a handyman who must collect sacks of gold and bring them back home, while dodging acid rain. The more sacks of gold you bring back, the harder it will be to do so. There are three brick walls above the handyman, which serve to protect him from the rain. However, all three will deteriorate as drops hit them. When any of the drops hit the handyman, he will lose a life. When all three lives are lost, the game is over.
title: Pit

description: Yet another VIC-20 clone of Scramble, this time from LiveWire Software UK, you must fly your spacecraft through several caverns, either dodging or shooting missiles and other airborne enemies that come straight at you. In the meantime, your fuel is running out and you must stock up on some more by dropping bombs on the fuel tanks at the bottom of the cavern. You can also bomb factories and enemy bases for extra points. You start the game with three lives, and being hit by an enemy or running out of fuel results in the loss of one life. The game ends when you run out of lives. Joystick or keyboard can be used to play the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: Dropping a bomb on the fuel tank

title: Skramble

description: You are flying through space when suddenly a giant vessel uses its tractor beam on your little starship. You are sent to isolation along with your starship, but then you watch with your own eyes as crew members disassemble it piece by piece and scatter them around the vessel. Your object, then, is to search every room for the missing pieces, bring them back to isolation, and successfully rebuild your starship to escape. You are equipped with a blaster that carries infinite ammo, which you can use to deal with the different enemies you encounter. You can also find K9 to distract the enemies from you. If an enemy touches you, you are taken back to isolation.

sample_screenshots.caption: You have entered a room with a droid in it
Your presence has alerted the guard...
Memorize your ship before it is taken away piece by piece
Leave your starting point and say hello to K9

title: Starship Escape

description: You are the commander of the giant spaceship "Swordfish" sent to disrupt federation spacelanes, cutting off their arms supply. Your job is to hunt down freighters, cruisers, sweepers, and carriers while in subspace, while only surfacing in realspace to shoot down these enemy warships. The Swordfish is equipped with ten torpedoes to do this. Fail to deal with the warships at the right time, and you must dive back into subspace to avoid being taken out. The game ends when you killed all the warships or you are taken out.

sample_screenshots.caption: Another one of the ships you need to destroy
Radar shows a ship is approaching

title: Subspace Striker

description: In this Combat variant for the VIC-20, up to two players (blue tank for player one, red for player two) battle it out against each other in a field consisting of walls and other barriers. Each tank can move straight as well as diagonally. If one of the tanks are shot at, that tank will reappear at a random position on the field. There is no time limit, so whoever reaches ten points wins the game. In a one-player game, the computer takes control of the second tank.

sample_screenshots.caption: Enemy hides himself in the corner

title: Tank War

description: In this Galaxian variant for the VIC-20, you control a ship that moves left and right, and must shoot a group of aliens at the top of the screen, some of them swoop in on you at different intervals. The aliens have different classes, starting from the bottom row, and you score extra points if you manage to hit an alien in the top row. When you have cleared the screen of aliens, you proceed to the next wave. You initially start the game with three lives. Lose all of them and the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of the aliens is doing a kamikaze attack

title: Triad

description: R.W. Stevens' VIC-20 game is slightly different to the version he released for the Commodore 64, in which the playfield has been restricted to a certain area and the time limit has been reduced. The object is go along the boundaries of each square to color them in without coming into contact with an enemy, but in this version of the game the "Chaser" is waiting for you to get close to him. Once you do, he will follow you. Be careful not to make contact or you will lose one of your lives. As usual, you can create a hole to deter him from chasing you, but only one hole can be created at a time. Once you filled all the squares, you proceed to the next grid where more Chasers are waiting for you. The game ends when you run out of lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Chaser is waiting to pounce on you
Created a hole to delay the chaser

title: Gridder

description: Realms of Quest V is a role-playing game influenced by classic 1980s RPGs such as Ultima, The Bard’s Tale and Phantasie. Your goal is to assemble a party of up to ten adventurers, and search for pieces of the Tablet of Uthar so that it may be reassembled and used to protect the land of Rivaria. Adventurers may be of sixteen different races, sixteen different classes, and three alignments. In addition, up to ten different monsters can be summoned to aid the party in combat. The expansive world offers forty different towns and cities, and another twenty dungeons to explore, offering over 100 hours of gameplay.
title: Realms of Quest V

description: Fire is an arcade game for the VIC-20, where you are a firefighter. Every day brings a new mission to complete, and each mission has three stages. First, you must drive from the fire hall across the city to the neighborhood of the burning building. Next, make your way through local traffic to reach the building itself. Finally, rescue the people jumping or falling from the building as it burns. With each completed mission, the game gets faster and more difficult, reaching its maximum after 65 missions.
title: Fire

description: A Country Garden is a clone of Centipede, where you are placed in a garden full of mushrooms. You are dealing with a "crawler", aptly named because it crawls its way through the garden in an attempt to reach the bottom of the screen where you are. Before it does, you must shoot your laser at its fragments before it is completely destroyed; and once you do, you proceed to the next wave. Other nasty pests including snails and spiders also need to be killed. Besides going left and right, you can also go further up into the garden to make your task easier. If you come into contact with any enemies, you will lose a life. Lose all your lives, and the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: A spider falls down through the garden

title: A Country Garden

description: Alphoids is a throw-back to popular arcade games of old, such as Centipede and Space Invaders. You control a ship stranded on the surface of Alpha Centuri 1, unable to dock with the mothership hovering above you due to jet failure. Various aliens of different shapes and sizes are attacking you from above, and you must fight them off to survive. You have to keep an eye out on the two gauges located on both sides of the screen since they determine the health of your ship's laser. If you get hit by one of the aliens or run out of energy, you lose a life. The game ends when all your lives are lost.
title: Alphoids

description: You control a ship at the bottom of the screen whose object is to kill the three rows of insects that move horizontally across the top of the screen. Stopping you from getting to the insects are eight ships arranged in groups of four, as well as four heat-seekers that follow you whenever you go. Furthermore, the insects are capable of defending themselves by throwing bombs down at you, so you need to be careful not to hover below any of them. If you come into contact with any ships, heat-seekers, or insects, you will lose a life. Lose all your lives, and it is game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: The change of color indicates that you have entered a new level

title: Plague

description: Reach the end of the road without running out of lives. The road gradually gets narrower, and there are obstacles which you must avoid. Each level has a longer road to run along, with more obstacles to avoid. Every step you take earns you a point; every completed road earns 100 points.
title: Runner

description: Fly through and escape the maze-like cave in your yellow spaceship, while avoiding the walls and the enemy. To escape, you must pick up the keycards scattered about the cave in order to unlock the portal at the end of each level. Each level is faster-paced. Moving around earns you a point, picking up a keycard earns you 50, and exiting a level earns you 100.
title: Escape

description:
Defenda is an early Defender clone by Jeff Minter, later improved upon by Andes Attack.

You are in your ship out to rescue the humans that are under attack by the aliens. The player patrols the two-way scrolling landscape in his ship, preventing the marauding aliens from abducting the humans. If the aliens manage to get a human to the top of the screen, it mutates into an alien horror that will come after you resulting in a fatal collision if not killed. Each surviving human gives you a bonus at the end of each stage.

You start out with three lives. Each time you get hit by an enemy projectile you lose a live, once all lives are spent the game is over.
title: Defenda

description: This is a compilation of three Masterware Entertainment games: Fire, Escape, and Runner. This compilation was available both in physical (diskette) and download formats at release, with the download format later released for free during the 2020 coronavirus pandemic.
title: Fire

description:
Ratman! is on pest control duty and his task is to swat as many rats as possible while moving left and right. He is equipped with a hammer which he uses to whop the descending rats, while avoiding them and flights of arrows that rain from the heavens.

If a rat makes it to ground level it can go through a hole in the ground to appear under Ratman and poke him with its devil spear. When a life is lost, the hand of god descends from the heavens and pulls you up towards him.

sample_screenshots.caption: The hand of God takes me away
I get hit by a rat

title: Ratman!

description:
Sold together as a bundle for the unexpanded VIC-20, Deflex and ROX are a continuation of some the earliest games written by Jeff Minter, originally on the Commodore PET.

Deflex is a Deflection clone with a twist, also released on the Sinclair ZX81. Instead of static mirrors, the deflectors or bats flip as they are hit by the ball. You place deflectors in the location the ball is at the time of placement and the ball immediately changes direction. The aim is to hit 15 targets (1 to F) in the least amount of time and there are 20 difficulty levels, with the option of moving targets.

In ROX the objective is to protect your moon base on the planet's surface in the lower center of the screen from falling meteors or "ROX" from space. Your base has a three way laser to defend itself and if the surface is penetrated through by the meteors, the game is lost.
title: Deflex / ROX

description:
Double Sider: Bomber Run / Supavaders is a compilation of two titles. It contains:

  • Bomber Run: a Scramble clone where you have to fly your ship across a landscape, shooting enemies that approach you. The ship runs on a never-ending fuel supply.
  • Supavaders: aliens appear from the right side of the screen, and your job is to shoot them down before they take over the city. Your ship can move left and right, and can shoot in three directions.

sample_screenshots.caption: Supavaders: The aliens are eating away the city

title: Double Sider: Bomber Run / Supavaders

description: Boss is a two-player chess game, played on a 8x8 checkerboard. The aim of the game is to capture all your opponent's pieces before it does the same, and moves are made by inputting two sets of grid references. There are ten levels of play, giving response times from one second to nine hours. Boss's unique feature is the ability to predict its own moves. It is also capable of castling, queening, and ‘en passant' and operates on standard chess nomenclature.

sample_screenshots.caption: Now it is my opponent's turn
Moved one of my knights to a different location

title: Boss

description: In Pedes & Mutants you are tasked with stopping centipedes and mutants who have invaded the outer regions of space. The gameplay consists of two screens. In the first screen, rocks make their way toward your ship at the top of the screen. Your ship is equipped with a laser which is used to kill aliens, fleas, and centipedes. When you kill six centipedes, you proceed to the next screen where you must prevent mutants from reaching the top of the screen. You have infinite lives here, but if you fail, you are returned to the first screen and must try again. You start the game with five lives, and a bonus life is awarded every 10,000 points. A life is lost when you are hit with any of the lifeforms, and the game is over when you run out.

sample_screenshots.caption: Press a button to begin the game
Another mutant is on the loose

title: Pedes & Mutants

description:
This bundle includes two games written in BASIC for expanded VIC-20 machines:

  • 3D Labyrinth is a simple first-person maze game where the objective is to exit the maze as quickly as possible. There are 18 predefined mazes and the option to randomly generate one. You are told in which direction you are facing and navigate the maze by pressing keys for each direction. An in-game map can be invoked to show the position in the maze.
  • ROX III is an expansion to an earlier VIC-20 game ROX / ROX II with a similar version also released on the ZX Spectrum with improved graphics and the addition of "panics" (essentially smart-bombs).
title: 3D Labyrinth / ROX III

description: Vic-Men is a clone of the arcade classic Pac-Man. The aim is to go around the maze and collect all the dots scattered around it, while avoiding the ghosts that haunt you. Eating a power pill makes the ghosts vulnerable, allowing you to turn the tides and eat them. Once a maze is cleared of all dots, it resets and repeats at an increased difficulty.
title: Vic-Men

description:
Ten Superb 3.5 Programs is a collection of games and utilities written for the unexpanded Commodore VIC-20. Amongst the ten included programs are five games, some of which are the first commercial releases programmed by Jeff Minter: Breakout*: a simple Breakout clone.

  • Mastermind uses colour and sound to the full.
  • Space Zap: a satellite in the center of the screen shoots incoming aliens by rotating its gun, perhaps the first appearance of a llama in a Minter game
  • Tanx: a tank battle for two players.
  • Word Games: an unusual and challenging game for 2 or more players.
title: Ten Superb 3.5 Programs

description:
Mutant Herd starts like an usual arcade game: a powerhouse in the middle screen, monsters which want to destroy it and two laser beams (one horizontally and one vertically) at the player's disposal. Those laser beams act more like moveable walls because they don't destroy monsters, but push them back. They disappear for good when they are pushed outside the screen, but retaliation swiftly comes from the other side. The end goal is to destroy the monster queen's burrow to stop the attacks.

Besides monsters, there is also a friendly creature on the screen: the monster slayer. It must be guided towards the burrow entrances with the laser beams. Then the screen changes to a side view: a big ladder which leads to eight horizontal levels. The player controls the monster slayer directly towards the lower floor and needs to plant a bomb to destroy five monster eggs while avoiding falling rocks and the monster queen which moves around the levels. After detonating the bomb on the highest floor, the next round on the surface begins.

Now there are holes in the laser beams and less burrow entrances. During the side-view part, the slayer needs to move closer to the queen because five or the fifteen eggs are already destroyed. The whole sequence is repeated until no eggs are left and the queen herself is bombed. There are ten monster slayers available; a new one appears after dying underground or being pushed off the screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: The monster slayer must now reach the queen's lair
They are heading towards the generator
But he has failed in his quest
Back to screen one again, this time with gaps in the lasers

title: Mutant Herd

description:
Star Defence is a Defender variant for the VIC-20, in which you commandeer a spaceship negotiating a landscape. Scattered about are aliens that threaten to abduct humanoids on the surface, and you must shoot at them with your laser fire. A humanoid is destroyed if an alien carries it to the top of the screen, you shoot at it, or it falls back down to the surface after you kill its captor. If one of them is carried off to the top of the screen, it will get destroyed and replaced by another alien that homes in on your location and tries to shoot you down.

Throughout the landscape are stargates which take you to another part of it where an abduction can be witnessed. A limited supply of smart bombs can be used if the heat gets too much. Once you have killed all of the aliens, you proceed to the next wave. A radar can be activated by holding down [F3] and you can become temporarily invisible by pressing [Right Shift]. Hyperspace can be used if you press [Space].

You have a limited number of lives, and one is lost when you are hit by an alien or come into contact with their projectiles. Use all of your lives up and the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: If you fail to rescue a humanoid, this deadly alien appears
Carrying a humanoid down to the surface
An alien has captured one of the purple humanoids

title: Star Defence

description: Pinball Wizard consists of a single pinball table made up of three flippers, bumpers, rollovers, slingshots and a jackpot bonus. The player can also nudge the table and trigger the tilt effect. The player begins with five balls and must try to achieve the highest score.
title: Pinball Wizard

description: Chess Wars is a chess game that incorporates nine difficulty levels for the CPU. The system is able to foresee any standard and special moves the player can make.
title: Chess Wars

description: Chocabloc is a clone of Pengo, in which you control a penguin who is put into a maze of ice blocks. Gold eggs appear and hatch into a Chocbee that will roam around the maze at their will. Your job is to slam ice blocks onto them to destroy them. Once you have killed enough Chocbeez, you will proceed to the next level. As well as crushing enemies, you can align three choc-bars in a row for a bonus score. Coming into contact with a Chocbee will result in a loss of life, and lose all your lives and the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Came into contact with a Chocbee

title: Chocabloc

description: Meter Mania is a game that plays similar to Pac-Man. As Mr. Trick, your job is to go around a set maze gathering coins until a picture of a coin appears at the top-left of the screen. Stopping you from doing this will be four meter maids that roam around the maze. Coming into contact with any one of them results in a loss of life. When the last meter maid has left the coffee room, a parking meter will take her place. You need to hurry and put your coin in the meter before time runs out. When all the coins around the maze have been collected, the coins will be replenished. The game records your high score; if your current score outranks this, part of the French national anthem is played.

sample_screenshots.caption: Mr. Trick has been appreciated by a meter maid.
Once all four meter maids have come out of their hideout, the parking meter is present.

title: Meter Mania

description:
The Golden Apples of Zeus is a text adventure in the same vein as Scott Adams' Adventure series released on a multitude of formats.

The aim of the game is to steal the Golden Apples from the dog Cerberus. To do this, players must enter two-word commands in the "verb-noun" format. Directions can be abbreviated as N for north, S for south, etc. When players enter a new location, they are presented with a description of that location, visible objects, and exits. The game allows them to save their progress, and there are instructions on the cassette tape, introducing them to the world of text adventures.
title: The Golden Apples of Zeus

description: Cheese and Onion is a classic retro platformer, in which the player guides Dr. Tynehaul through the levels collecting onions. The game can played on the Easy or Hard difficulties or the Adventure mode can be selected.
title: Cheese and Onion

description: Carrier Attack is an arcade action game where the player controls two anti-aircraft guns on a large ship as enemy bombers sweep the decks from both sides. The game is played from a side view and uses a fixed-screen perspective.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of the planes launched a bomb at you

title: Carrier Attack

description: In this adventure game presented entirely in text, you need to find and kill the mage who has depopulated your village. You are presented with a description of each scene, and you are required to input commands in the "verb-noun" format. Instead of typing the whole command out, however, you can simply abbreviate each command (ie: N for north, S for south, L for look). A save option is available.
title: Sword of Hrakel

description:
In Zorgon's Kingdom, you are trying to reach the lair of the mighty Zorgon; and to do this, you need to negotiate five screens full of dangers that can be avoided or jumped over. Coming into contact with any of these dangers will result in a loss of life. (The game asks you how many lives you want before the game begins.) Run out of lives and the game ends. Depending on what screen you are on, the fire button is used to jump, dig, or shoot.

Screen one: Similar to Donkey Kong, reach the top of the screen while negotiating a set of ladders, avoiding the one barrel that rolls down toward you. While you are making your way to the top of the screen, the platforms will begin to collapse, so you need to finish this screen quickly. Unlike the others, this screen needs to be done twice.

Screen two: Your aim is to enter four elevators that go from left to right and vice versa, making sure not to fall onto the spikes. The last of these leads to a rope ladder in which you climb up to face falling aliens similar to the ones from The Pit. Get past these in a timely manner so that you can reach the boat swimming across some spikes and get to the bottom of the screen where you meet two aliens, which change their appearance occasionally and have their legs pointing up. Make contact with them in this state more than once, and you will be able to get to...

Screen three: After crossing two sets of electrical wires and jumping over the rockets that approach you, get past the two groups of moving pillars that move in different directions without being crushed. Once done, cross the unstable platform and climb down the final ladder.

Screen four: Get past the one alien ricocheting off the sides of the green tunnel, and then make your way around the rotating elevator to reach the lattice-like area and avoid the deadly alien serpent.

Screen five: Dig holes for the incoming Robots of Death to fall through, making it easier for you to reach the bottom of the screen. Travel down the final elevator to meet Zorgon who will attempt to get you. Shoot your laser multiple times in his direction to defeat him.
title: Zorgon's Kingdom

description: Cosmiads is a Galaxian variant where you must defeat waves of swooping alien attackers with a spaceship that moves back and forwards across the bottom of the screen. When in formation, the attacking ships are coloured and worth 10 points each. When they swoop down to attack, they turn white and are worth 100 points each. After all of the regular ships are shot down, two larger shielded vessels begin to attack, and these take multiple hits to destroy. Once these are dispatched, the next level starts with a slightly higher speed.

sample_screenshots.caption: The last two shielded vessels require multiple hits.

title: Cosmiads

description:
Number Crunch is a 1-player educational game for the Commodore Vic-20.

The player controls the Counterpillar, who attempts to eat numbers and math symbols while avoiding bombs. The goal is to complete the math equations displayed at the bottom of the screen. The player can be hit by 3 bombs before it's game over.
title: Number Crunch

description:
Cave In is a 1-player arcade game for the Commodore VIC-20.

After many years of searching, you have finally discovered the lost kingdom of Meese. The player moves in the compass directions on a grid, trying to gather various treasures. The Meese-kites also gobble diamonds and gather points as they travel. The player can cause a cave in, which causes more items to appear and removes their trail. The player can exit each room, and go to a different room to further search for treasure. The player loses a life if caught by a Meese-kite, or if they move onto a previously explored square.

There are 6 levels of difficulty, and the player starts with 3 lives.
title: Cave In

description:
Orbis is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a target, and tries to shoot down the alien bombardment from above. The alien balls move rapidly horizontally at the top of the screen, and are randomly dropped towards the bases. The player has 5 bases that they must try to protect from alien attack, and if all are destroyed, it's game over. At the end of every round, the bases are restored.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of my Bases Are Destroyed

title: Orbis

description:
Baldor's Castle is an early roleplaying game for the VIC-20.

The player explores the halls of Baldor's Castle from a top-down perspective, while collecting gold and defeating monsters. The character can fight with their sword or use arrows against a variety of monsters, and a map is available to help guide the player. The player has limited life and power. Power constantly replenishes, and is used to perform attacks. The player gains skill points for monsters defeated. Monsters drop gold and potions, the latter can be used to heal the player.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Defeat a Map and Receive a Map

title: Baldor's Castle

description:
Cricket is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Similar to the game Frogger, the player must move a small cricket vertically across the screen from a field of horizontally moving dangers. The player must first cross a busy road, and then cross a river on top of logs, frogs, alligators, turtles, and leaves. Any position in the other bank leads to safety. The player starts with 3 lives, and one is lost if they hit a danger.
title: Cricket

description:
Chase is a 2-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Two players move about a small maze. Player 2 tries to catch Player 1, and the game records how long it takes to successfully catch them.
title: Chase

description:
Snakeout is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player moves a snake with an increasingly elongating tail, while avoiding spiders and picking up bonus points. If the player hits a spider, the edge of the screen, or their own tail, it's game over. Simultaneous 2-player games for points, or a 2-player game where the goal is to trap the opponent is also available.
title: Snakeout

description:
Cattle Roundup is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player tries to corral 1 - 8 cows in a maze, and bring them back to the pen in the top left corner of the screen. Cattle can be pushed or coaxed to get them to move. The player has a limited amount of time and coaxes to gather as many cows as possible.
title: Cattle Roundup

description:
Artillery is a 2-player game for the VIC-20.

Each player controls a cannon on either side of the screen with a mountain in between. Players take turns setting the direction and power of their cannon fire to try to hit their opponent. Changing wind conditions lend challenge to the game. The game tracks score over several rounds.
title: Artillery

description:
Video Vermin is a 1-player Centipede clone for the VIC-20.

Your once-peaceful garden is being invaded by a horde of hungry vermin. Shoot them and their fallen bodies sprout a barricade of mushrooms to conceal more swarming raiders. Snails oil a path on which the vermin slither erratically toward you. Dropping butterflies leave a trail of mushrooms in their wake, and pouncing spiders, ants, beetles, and fleas infest the area. One vigilant gardener strikes first. If he's destroyed by the fatal touch of the invaders, two more defenders lie in wait to take his place. If the third gardener succumbs and you have 10,000 points, another gardener will emerge to help you save the garden from devastation.
title: Video Vermin

description:
Satellites and Meteorites! is a 1-player Asteroids clone for the VIC-20.

Hordes of meteorites and satellites lace the sky. As you fly through, you must try and shoot down as many as you can. Each satellite has its own special characteristics that you must deal with as you approach. When the black hole appears, sucking everything into the abyss, you must break free from its grasp to continue your quest.

The player controls a small spaceship that can rotate 360 degrees, and fire and accelerate directly forwards. They have 3 vessels, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Satellites and Meteorites!

description:
Fun With Music is a 1-player music composition and arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player can review or create their own music selection by setting tempo, value, and notes on a music graph. After they've created their musical composition, they can enter a game where they move a conductor vertically, as they try to follow the horizontally scrolling notes on the screen. If they miss too many notes, or are caught by a chasing dog, they lose a life.
title: Fun With Music

description:
Superslot is a 1-player slot machine game for the VIC-20.

A slot machine simulation with graphics and sound. The player inserts 1 - 5 coins, which determine the number of possible lines when they spin the slot machine.
title: Superslot

description:
Predator is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls an eagle, which can move left, right, flap its wings to fly into the sky, and can shoot directly forwards. The player moves on a level with 2 trees of varying height each round. The player tries to shoot all enemy birds, and receives bonus points for leaves remaining on the trees when the level is finished. Some of the enemy birds can drop eggs which hatch even more birds, and there are also worms along the bottom of the screen which can injure the player. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: Predator

description:
The Sky is Falling is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Help Chicken Little catch all the pieces of the sky in your baskets. How many balloons can you catch before you run out of baskets? The player controls a horizontally moving basket on the bottom of the screen, while pieces fall from the screen above. The goal is to catch them in the basket, and it's game over after 3 items are missed. The player gets an additional basket after 10,000 points. When all items are caught, the player moves to a more difficult level.
title: The Sky is Falling

description:
Titan is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small spaceship that moves in the cardinal directions within a maze. The player can fire vertically forwards, and can shoot enemy ships. They must try to collect all the pellets within a maze to advance to a more difficult challenge. The player starts with 5 ships, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Titan

description:
Meteor Run is a 1-player side-scrolling game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small spaceship which can move in all directions, and fires horizontally to the right. The player must shoot incoming purple alien ships while avoiding red asteroids. A small map shows the location of incoming vessels. The player starts with 3 vessels.
title: Meteor Run

description:
Sub Chase is a 1 -player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a warship at the top of the screen, which the player moves slowly horizontally. The ship drops depth charges to destroy submarines moving horizontally in the water. The player must avoid torpedoes from the submarines. Three ships destroyed, and it's game over.
title: Sub Chase

description:
Super Amok is a 1-player Berzerk clone, and an updated version of Amok.

Demented robots are running amok in Space Station Alpha. You must destroy them all.

The player controls a small character who can move and fire in 8 directions. The player moves through a number of rooms, each with 3 exits, trying to destroy enemy robots. If the player spends too much time in a room, aggressive new enemies flood the area. Touching walls or enemies, or getting shot causes loss of life. Bonus points are awarded for destroying all robots in a section. The player starts with 3 lives, and is awarded a new life every 20,000 points.
title: Super Amok

description:
Super Smash is a 1 - 2 player Breakout game for the VIC-20.

The World Championship is at stake! As a finalist, do you have the cat-like reflexes to return the speeding ball and take the crown? On your toes, this is racquetball at its toughest!

The player controls a small paddle that moves horizontally on the bottom on the screen, trying to bounce a ball to break the blocks above. There are options for special blocks and having more rows of blocks progressively appear. The player can miss the ball 3 times before game over. The player advances to the next level when all blocks are broken.
title: Super Smash

description:
Raid on Fort Knox is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Make your way through the treacherous corridors of Fort Knox, patrolled by deadly panthers. How much gold can you sneak back to your hideout before time runs out?

The player maneuvers through a maze, avoiding the panthers that wander randomly about. The player mush gather gold bars 1 at a time from the storage area and bring them back to the starting point. The player has a limited time to escape the maze each time they pick up a gold bar, or the gold is lost. A life is lost if they touch a panther, and each level has 1 more row of gold bars to collect and 1 more panther patrolling the hallways.
title: Raid on Fort Knox

description:
R.I.P.: The Game is a 1-player horror-themed arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small character who shoots arrows and moves in the cardinal directions. The player moves between rooms, fighting other monsters who shoot arrows. The goal is to collect keys and destroy monsters. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: R.I.P.: The Game

description:
Doodle Bug is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Your planet has been invaded, and each peace loving country has been pillaged of its resources. All other nations have unwillingly succumbed to the tyranny of their invaders. You are determined to fight for liberty. You hold siege, but all water and food supplies have ceased. Unrest begins to stir among the people of your cities, you must find food for the starving. You steal into the night to scavenge food from the vast quantities held by your enemies.

The player navigates an alien depot trying to scavenge food while avoiding alien patrols. Turnstiles allow the player to pass through several walls which the aliens can not travel. If all food is gathered, the player moves to an additional level with 1 more alien devil. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: Doodle Bug

description:
Space Scramble is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Your mission - to pilot your one man fighter over a hostile alien landscape, shooting down enemy missiles, bombing enemy installations, and avoiding natural hazards. Your ultimate goal is total destruction of the alien headquarters. Can you survive?

The player controls a small ship that can move in the 4 cardinal directions as alien terrain scrolls from the right. The player can shoot lasers straight ahead, or drop bombs that lob towards the ground. The player has 5 lives and limited fuel to destroy as many alien installations as possible.
title: Space Scramble

description:
Psycho Shopper is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Arthur travels through 4 levels collecting money to shop in the local grocery store. The player controls a character who moves in the 4 cardinal directions, and must avoid other shoppers and vehicles. There are 4 levels: The Pedestrian Crossing, The Main Road, The Railway, and The Supermarket. On the first 3 levels, players must gather coins, and avoid horizontally moving vehicles and other pedestrians as they move towards the exit sign. All coins must be collected before exiting. In the final level, the player must avoid other shoppers and collect all groceries before exiting the level. There is limited time to complete all levels, and the player has 5 lives.
title: Psycho Shopper

description:
Crazy Cavey is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Crazy Cavey has been trapped within a network of underground caverns. In each cave are keys, all of which must be collected to let you pass through the exit to the next level. You will encounter various types of deadly creatures, avoid these at all costs, and patches of sticky glue which slow you down and make it difficult to jump. Unstable platforms fall when the player stands on them. Each cave has a time limit, and whatever time is left is added to the score as a bonus. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Crazy Cavey

description:
New York Blitz is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You are flying over the city, watching the landscape below when suddenly you find you are out of fuel. Your plane starts to descend towards the skyscrapers below and you realize you are not going to reach an airfield in time. Now it seems that the only way you and your crew are going to land safely is to flatten the city. Will you be successful? Will you be promoted?

A plane flies across a single-screen city at a steady pace. When it reaches the edge of the screen, it wraps to the other side at a lower altitude. The player drops bombs from the plane, with only 1 bomb on the screen at a time. Each bomb removes one building if it hits. As the plane descends, it risks colliding with remaining buildings. The level is complete when all buildings are destroyed. The player receives a higher rank with each city destroyed.
title: New York Blitz

description:
Phantom Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Phantoms are swarming to attack you. Watch them closely as they build up their strength to explode above you. Their missiles move fast, so avoid them at all costs. To kill a phantom you must blast it with your proton beam. The phantom will shrink and finally disappear into oblivion forever. The player controls a character at the bottom of the screen which moves horizontally and fires rapidly vertically. When the player destroys all phantoms on the screen, they advance to the next level.
title: Phantom Attack

description:
Undermine is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a bat within a small cavern. To the north are the wide plains of Xylon, to the south lies the open sea, protected by a storm wall. A ball bounces about inside the cavern, and the player tries to direct the ball to break away the wall to the north while trying not to hit the wall to the south. The player determines game speed and the thickness of the sea wall, and if the storm wall breaks, the cavern floods and it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting with a Thin Storm Wall

title: Undermine

description:
Hangman-Hangmath are two educational games for the VIC-20.

In both games, the player must solve a word or math equation before a stick figure walks to the gallows and is hung. In Hangmath, the player must select columns 1 - 5, and guess a number from 0 - 9 that fits the position. All equations are 3 digit x 2 digit multiplication questions. Hangman is similar, but the player guesses letters to spell words.
title: Hangman-Hangmath

description:
Seahunt is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a submarine in the bottom center of the screen, which attempts to shoot ships as they pass by horizontally. There are 3 rows of ships, and the further smaller vessels are worth more points. Blue buoys drift across the field, and block the player's shots. The player has 60 seconds to maximize score. There are 2 levels of difficulty, which affect boat speed.
title: Seahunt

description:
Black Hole is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Your spaceship has been caught in the gravitational pull of a black hole. You can rotate 360 degrees, fly forwards and fire your cannons, but the black hole gravitational pull will continue to pull you towards the screen center and death. The player gets points for shooting space rocks that float onto the screen. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Black Hole

description: Chicken Challenge is a clone of Frogger, in which you control a chicken trying to get into its five homes across a river. However, your task is made difficult by enemies such as cars and ducks, not to mention the fox that suddenly appears in a home. You need to get to a home as soon as possible as you have a time limit, but getting to a home before time expires will reset it. You can get the egg that appears for bonus points. You have six chickens to play with, and one is lost when either time runs out before you reach a home or you touch an enemy. Lose all of them and the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: Get the egg for bonus points
A fox appears in one of the homes

title: Chicken Challenge

description: Conqueror is a game for up to fifteen players. Each player becomes king, and to hang on to power, you have to feed your people and make sure they have enough money to survive.
