The overall objective is to conquer neighboring countries by any means necessary; and to help you achieve your goal, you can hire soldiers and a supply of swords. Each year has three seasons in which you can make plough-shares, tax your own people, or wage war. If your people leave or die, you lose the game.
title: Conqueror

description: In Dam Busta, you control a scuba-diver armed with a harpoon, and your task is to blow up a dam. To do so, you need to get through two screens full of enemies that try to stop you from doing this. On the first screen, make your way to the entrance near the bottom-right, avoiding a swarm of barracuda that moves left and right in the water. In the second screen, kill the guardians who fire at you until you get a clear shot of a rocket. You are running out of air, and need to replenish your supply by swimming up to the surface, but a helicopter will stop you from doing this by dropping a depth-charge at you. If you manage to shoot the rocket, the guardians will be disabled, allowing you to place a bomb at the base of the dam. You must then return to the spot where you started and the bomb will be detonated. Do this three times and the dam will be destroyed. If you run out of air or get hit either a depth-charge or a guardian projectile, you lose a life and restart from screen one. Run out of lives and the game ends.

sample_screenshots.caption: Shoot the guardians of the dam
Placed a bomb at the base of the dam
A helicopter drops a bomb on you

title: Dam Busta

description: In Orbits, three motherships are above water, and a craft of different shapes is ejected from one of them. The water is moving landing pads across the screen, and you need to fit the craft that has the corresponding shape. Three difficulty levels are available. The game ends when there are six attempts, and a summary of your performance appears.

sample_screenshots.caption: Find somewhere in the water this piece goes

title: Orbits

description: In Knight's Move, the object is to fill all the squares of a chess board, starting at the marked corner, using the knight's move. You travel around the board using the numbered keys 1-8. At any time during the game, you can give up and view the solution.

sample_screenshots.caption: Fill all the squares of the chess board

title: Knight's Move

description: Graphic Twister is a game for the unexpanded VIC-20 in which the player is presented with a picture and three empty squares. The object is to rearrange the squares so they match the picture above. The player can press the function keys to flip the squares top to bottom, side to side, and even twist left to right. If they are sure the square contains the correct picture, then they can press Space to move onto the next one. The game is supplied with a clock that works against them.
title: Graphic Twister

description: In Rainbows, the player is presented with three letters in a sequence and the start of a rainbow below. It is up to them to guess the next three. If the player has guessed correctly, the rainbow continues to build up until all six letters are displayed. If the player guesses incorrectly, then they are given clues ("cool" and "warm"). The game ends when either the rainbow is complete or the number of goes have been exceeded, which is four or six depending on the difficulty level they selected.

sample_screenshots.caption: But if you guess the three letters correctly, you are rewarded with a nice animation
When the number of goes have been exceeded, bad weather will destroy the rainbow
Too far away from the correct letter

title: Rainbows

description: In Slide Puzzle, the player is given the chance to memorize a pattern set by the computer, then rearrange the squares so that it matches that pattern. Movement is achieved by pressing the numbers one to four. Two difficulty settings are available; in the "Hard" setting, the symbols are replaced with letters.
title: Slide Puzzle

description: Digits is a game for the unexpanded VIC-20 in which players move from number to number using the function keys, making sure they don't cross their path. Question marks indicate mystery values. The player needs to plan their route carefully in order to achieve the highest possible score. They can have twenty-five goes before the game ends, after which point they can have the opportunity to play again and beat their previous score.
title: Digits

description: You are in an abandoned mine shaft, trying to collect gold and treasure chests and bringing them back to your store. Both of these are found in passages accessible by lifts. You can carry up to two sacks of gold at a time. If you decide to carry a treasure chest, remember that this will be too much for the lifts and you have to take a different route up to the top. The game sets a target score; if you manage to reach this before time is up, you proceed to the next mine. The first mine shaft you enter may be easy with no enemies, but later ones introduce enemies and obstacles such as monsters and falling rocks. Any contact with these will result in a loss of life (not shown in the game). Running out of time or getting crushed by a lift will also result in a loss of life.

sample_screenshots.caption: Fallen down one of the shafts
What's a pretty girl like you doing in a place like this?

title: Mine Madness

description:
Mosquito Infestation is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player moves a can of bug spray on the screen, and tries to kill mosquitoes before they reach their arm. If a mosquito makes it to the arm, the player's blood pressure begins to drop. The player has limited bug spray in their can, and must refill from the tube in the center of the screen. If the blood pressure drops too low, it's game over.
title: Mosquito Infestation

description:
A World at War is a 1-player strategy game for the VIC-20.

You rule one of two superpowers, a peace-loving people whose biggest wish is to live in freedom and safety. The other superpower is controlled by a cold-hearted, scheming computer without emotion, programmed to keep its subjects in an iron grip and annihilate all resistance and every attempt at opposition both within and outside the country.

Based upon mutual suspicion between neighbors, hostility is growing between the two countries.

Each turn, the player can build a land base, spy on their neighbor, or activate a base to launch a nuclear missile. Game play starts in phase 1, Cold War, where the player must strategically place missile bases, while the enemy also places missile bases at unknown locations, although they can be discovered through espionage. War is inevitable, either started by the computer or player, at which point each side will take turns throwing nuclear missiles at each other until one side has either no inhabitants or no bases remaining.
title: A World at War

description:
Rescue from Nufon is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player must explore an alien installation that has over 100 rooms spread over 5 floors. The player moves between small rooms looking to rescue 30 humans and transport back to the mother ship. The player starts with limited energy, which is drained by movement or running into enemies. The player must avoid the 4 species of aliens occupying the building.
title: Rescue from Nufon

description:
Krazy Kong is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The crazy gorilla has taken three fair maidens up to the top of the giant stairway and you (being the valiant hero that you are) will attempt to rescue them at the risk of your own life.

The player controls a small character who can move left, right, and jump forwards. A large gorilla at the top of the screen throws barrels that roll down the screen, and the player tries to jump over these to make their way to the top of the staircase. If the player is hit by a barrel, they restart the game.
title: Krazy Kong

description:
Defender on Tri is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You and your Defender style ship "Skyes Limited", are the only hope for the advance exploration party that has discovered and become trapped within an ancient planetoid-sized alien vessel trapped irretrievably in the gravity well of our sun.

The player tries to navigate 4 maze levels. Each level has a number of traps including moving doors and platforms. The player has limited fuel and time to finish their mission, and fuel can be picked up as the player explores. Numerous treasures can be picked up for bonus points, and the goal on each level is to reach the base or exit point.
title: Defender on Tri

description:
Journey is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player rapidly travels vertically down a tube, and can move left and right. The player has limited fuel, and must pick up more as they travel, while avoiding hitting walls. The goal is to travel as far as possible. It's game over after running out of fuel or hitting an object.
title: Journey

description:
Vicross / VIC-2048 includes two games: Vicross* is a picross game. Using the numbers on the top and side of the grid, determine which spaces should be filled in. The finished puzzle will form a small pixel art picture.

  • VIC-2048 is a clone of Threes! Combine like tiles to form the next higher tile. Get the 2048 tile and you've won the game.
title: Vicross / VIC-2048

description: Minitron is a one-player game in which you have to kill robots that are in constant pursuit of you. While navigating the game's maze, you must also be on the lookout for any mines that are in your path. You can also rescue humans trapped in the maze with you. If you touch any mines or the walls, or bump into any robots, you lose a life. Lose all your lives, and the game ends.

sample_screenshots.caption: There are five humans I need to rescue
These robots are ganging up on me

title: Minitron

description:
Alien Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small spaceship that moves laterally and fires forwards. Each level is divided into 3 stages. In the first stage, the player tries to blast as many alien ships as possible as they fly past in straight lines. In the second stage, the player must destroy the alien mothership before it reaches the bottom of the screen by shooting out pieces of the ship and hitting the aliens inside the ship. When all aliens are hit, the ship explodes. In the final level, the player can only dodge, and must avoid all incoming asteroids. The player starts with 3 lives, and each level becomes progressively faster.
title: Alien Attack

description:
Alien Plague is a 1-player arcade game for the Commodore VIC-20.

The greedy aliens have launched a surprise attack against Earth. You must protect the Earth's remaining energy cells as best you can.

The player controls a small ship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically. Alien vessels attempt to swoop down and grab the energy cells and pull them to the top of the screen. If an alien is shot, the energy cell returns to the bottom of the screen. Large centipede-like creatures leave long lines of barricades on the screen that must be destroyed. It's game over when all energy cells are stolen.
title: Alien Plague

description:
Asteroids is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small space ship that can rotate 360 degrees, accelerate, and fires directly forwards. The player must destroy incoming spaceships and rogue asteroids. Asteroids break into 2 smaller pieces, which break into 2 smaller pieces before being destroyed. When all asteroids are destroyed, the player enters a new stage with more wandering asteroids.
title: Asteroids

description:
Asteroyds is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small ship that can rotate 360 degrees, accelerate, and fire directly forwards. The player attempts to destroy large wandering asteroids. When these are hit, they break into 4 smaller pieces which must be destroyed. The player loses a life if they're hit by an asteroid, and starts with 3 lives.
title: Asteroyds

description:
Astro-Command is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Alien rocks and space ships descend upon the cities at the bottom of the screen. The player controls a crosshair, and tries to shoot these attackers with the missiles from the left of the screen before they smash the cities below. If an alien ship reaches the bottom, all cities are immediately destroyed. The player can only shoot a limited number of missiles at each level of the screen. One city is rebuilt and the missiles are replenished at the end of each level. It's game over when all cities are destroyed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Fewer Missiles Available at Higher Levels

title: Astro-Command

description:
Asteroiders is a 1 - player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You are the captain of a moon based cruiser responsible for the defence of Lunar Base 1. A meteor shower is threatening the security of the colony. Your task is to knock out the meteors as they rain on you.

The player controls a small ship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically. The player has a total of 5 ships, and tries to shoot incoming alien spaceships and asteroids that approach in a variety of attack patterns.
title: Asteroiders

description:
Battlefield is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small ship at the bottom of the screen that moves vertically and fires horizontally to the left. Enemy vehicles slowly approach towards the player's side of the screen, and they require multiple hits to destroy. Enemy vessels only fire horizontally, and the vehicle that directly targets the player always fires. The player must destroy all enemy vehicles before they reach the right of the screen. The player starts with barriers to protect from enemy fire, but these are removed after 4 enemy hits. The player starts with 9 vessels, but can gain more by shooting energy tanks.
title: Battlefield

description:
Beast of Eden is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Set in the Garden of Eden, the devil is chasing Herbet, a harmless herbivore. Herbet can move in the cardinal directions, while the devil can also move on angles. The player must evade the devil while trying to eat all the fruits and vegetables in the meadow. Mushrooms appear for a short time before disappearing. Once all food is consumed, a black exit gate will appear, allowing the player to advance to the next level. There are 9 levels of difficulty.
title: Beast of Eden

description:
Blockade is a 1 player versus computer strategy game for the VIC-20.

Played on a 9 x 9 board, players take turns placing markers on a board. The first person to achieve 5 in a row is the winner. There are 6 levels of computer difficulty.
title: Blockade

description:
Block Buster is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

While exploring an alien planet in your multi-terrain vehicle, you have fallen into a labyrinth of ice rocks. As these rocks melt, ice monsters hatch from them and track you down. Your only defense is to push a block of ice rock, sending it crashing into the monsters. The monsters can also push and break through ice rocks, and ice rocks can be destroyed by hitting them against another rock or against the side of the labyrinth.

The vehicle has limited fuel, and a buzzer will ring when the machine is low. The truck can be refueled by crushing a diamond ore rock. The player has a total of 3 lives, and there are always 2 enemies per stage. There are 8 levels of difficulty.
title: Block Buster

description:
Bobs Blunder is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls Bob, as he tries to reach the burning fuse before time runs out on each level. The player can move in the cardinal directions and throw a pick axe horizontally to defeat the monsters in their way.
title: Bobs Blunder

description:
Bomber Mission is a flight simulation for the VIC-20.

The player takes control of a bomber with the mission to destroy 1 of 3 targets, and can choose from 2 of 3 weapon systems to aid in their mission. The player starts on the runway, and must quickly take off before being destroyed by enemy ground fire. The player can use their antiaircraft guns to shoot down attacking enemy planes once airborne. From the cockpit, the pilot has control of their flaps, wheels, and can monitor their altitude, attitude, bearing, remaining fuel, and speed..
title: Bomber Mission

description:
Cannibal is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a character that tries to consume all of the dots in a maze. The maze is divided into 2 sections, a top section that is an open feel with a red skull that chases the player, and a bottom maze-like section that contains randomly moving cannibals. As the player moves between sections, the enemies only move if the player is in that area. Crosses in the maze-like section make the cannibals temporarily vulnerable, and bonus items can also appear in that area. The player starts with 5 lives, and the goal is to eat all dots to advance to a more difficult identical level.
title: Cannibal

description:
VIC 21: Casino-Style Blackjack is a 1 - 2 player card game for the VIC-20.

The player competes against another human or computer opponent. The player starts with $1000, and can bet $5 - $500 each hand. Players draw cards 1 at a time, and the player who gets the closest to 21 without going over is the winner.
title: VIC 21: Casino-Style Blackjack

description:
Castlemath is an educational game for the VIC-20.

The player explores the many twisty passageways of Math Castle. The player encounters a number of quiz masters who test the player on addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
title: Castlemath

description:
Caves of Annod is a role-playing game for the VIC-20.

Thrown into the Caves of Annod, the player must gather sufficient gold to bribe their way out of imprisonment. Played from an overhead perspective, the player can pick up weapons and other magic items. The player has limited strength which is lost in battles.
title: Caves of Annod

description:
Chariot Race is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Step back in time 2 millennia when crowds of 250,000 flocked to Circus Maximus to witness the great chariot races. Amid the noise and dust, the four teams of Red, White, Green, and Blue, thunder around the course in a perilous bid for fame and fortune.

Each player controls a chariot that can accelerate, decelerate, or move left and right. Each player is awarded points for how fast and far they travel. Other chariots block the track, and these can be pushed sideways into barricades at the edges. The player's chariot can be destroyed by running into the back of another chariot or into the barricades at the edge of the screen. If the player travels too slowly, fireballs begin to rain down onto the track.
title: Chariot Race

description:
Cobra is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

With your help, the giant cobra wanders around the garden. He must clear it of all the other beasties that keep appearing for a quiet life and a full stomach. He scores 5 points for each small black snake he eats. 10 points for each purple bug, and 15 points for each blue spider. There are dangers though. The cobra must not eat the poisoned green apples or cross his own tail or bump into the garden walls.

The player starts with 3 lives, and clears each level after gathering a certain number of points. New beasts keep appearing, and the cobra's tail progressively elongates.
title: Cobra

description:
Code Maker is a single-player strategy game for the VIC-20.

The computer creates a 4-digit code consisting of the colors red, cyan, blue, green, yellow, and purple. The player inserts a code, and is told how many colors are correct and are in the correct position. The player had 5 - 9 guesses to solve the puzzle.
title: Code Maker

description:
Colonel's House is a text adventure for the VIC-20.

The player attempts to obtain the first of the seven Knives of Eternity from the Colonel's house in the year 1990. The house is full of advanced electronic surveillance, and the player must safely leave the house by 10:00 PM when the Colonel returns home.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save/restore feature
title: Colonel's House

description:
Compendium.1 contains two arcade games for the VIC-20.

  • Hydro Blast: the player tries to protect a dam from incoming enemy vehicles. The player moves a turret vertically and fires horizontally to the right. A point is gained for each vehicle destroyed, and a piece of the dam is destroyed every time it is hit. If the dam springs a leak, it's game over.

  • Laser Bike: a light cycle game, where the player and computer control a vehicle that leaves a colored tail. If the player hits their own or their opponent's tail the opponent gains a point.
title: Compendium.1

description:
Compendium.2 is a series of two arcade games for the VIC-20.

  • Gobbler: The player controls a character that attempts to gather all the dots in a maze. The player is chased by an enemy that moves about, and if it sees the player, will chase them incessantly until caught. The player receives a score based upon the number of dots gobbled before being caught.
  • Laser Blast: The player controls a spaceship that moves laterally and fires on enemy artillery at a 45 degree angle. The player must avoid return enemy fire from the bottom of the screen.
title: Compendium.2

description:
Compusport Baseball is a 1-player baseball game for the VIC-20.

The player and computer engage in 9 innings of computer baseball. The player chooses from 4 famous historical teams for themselves and their opponent. The player and computer take turns pitching, and can only pitch straight down the plate. The player chooses when to swing, and scores a hit if they don't hit any of the computer's players on the field. Otherwise, if they get 3 strikes or caught by one of the other players on the field, they're out.
title: Compusport Baseball

description:
Cosmic Battle is a single-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player must fly their spaceship from a 1st person perspective to destroy as many enemy vessels as possible. The goal is to line up enemy vessels with the crosshair in the middle of the screen. The player starts with 1000 energy units, and can gain more by shooting yellow tanker ships. The player can attack with lasers or photon torpedoes, both of which drain energy. Shields also cost energy, but protect from enemy attacks.
title: Cosmic Battle

description:
Cosmic Fire Birds are a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

As captain of a star ship lost in deep space, you encounter a miraculous force of winged creatures known to the galaxy as the Cosmic Fire Birds.

The player controls a ship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically forwards. The player battles a steady stream of alien baddies, including: swarmers, leaders, bombers, and hawks. There are 100 levels of difficulty, and the player starts with 5 ships. An extra ship is awarded at 5,000 points.
title: Cosmic Fire Birds

description:
Creepers is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a ship that moves vertically along the left hand side of the screen and fires to the right. Aliens try to transfer blocks from the bottom to the top of the screen. Each alien travels in a vertical path, and if an alien does not find any blocks, it turns into a deadly mutant that streaks towards the player. The goal is to shoot all aliens before they can fill their stores. If this happens, the player loses a life. Every harder level, more aliens move at the same time.
title: Creepers

description:
Critters is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player tries to protect their apples on the bottom of the screen from a bunch of flying critters who try to eat them. The player can move left or right, duck, fire straight up, or at 45 and 90 degree angles. If the player shoots a critter, they turn black and fall to the ground. Critters swoop down and attempt to grab apples, hauling them off the top of the screen. If a critter with an apple is shot, the apple falls back to the ground. When all critters in a wave are destroyed, a new wave appears with more creatures.

sample_screenshots.caption: Dead Critters Fall to the Ground

title: Critters

description:
Deflect is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player tries to hit targets with a bouncing ball for points. The bouncing ball will move continuously in one direction until it hits a bat, which will change the direction by 90 degrees depending on bat direction. Targets 1 - F appear sequentially, and a new one appears when the active target is hit. A bat can be placed at any time at the location of the ball, and persists throughout the game. The goal is to eliminate all 15 targets in minimal time. A penalty is assessed for too many bats placed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Trying to Hit Target 2 with 3 Bats Placed

title: Deflect

description:
Dodo Lair is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the VIC-20.

The Dodo army is of enormous dimensions, and soon its attack on mankind will commence. Exploring the outer regions of a weird landscape, your second hand 'ground skimmer' has only a single laser in its armoury.

The player controls a space ship at the right of the screen that moves vertically and fires horizontally to the left. The player encounters a number of enemies, including: Henpek, Mult, B.B., Prong, Pole, Builda, Wally, and Rada. Enemies approach from the left, and the player must dodge or blast their way through obstacles. Game play is divided into 9 waves, and the player starts a harder challenge if they pass a section. The player starts with 5 lives, and a new life is gained every 10,000 points or upon completing a wave. .
title: Dodo Lair

description:
Dot Man is a single-player Pac-Man clone for the VIC-20.

The player controls Dot Man, as he moves about a maze eating dots. Four ghosts move randomly about, and will cost the player a life if they catch Dot Man. Four power pills in the corners of the map make ghosts temporarily vulnerable. After eating all the dots, the player moves to a level with faster moving ghosts. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Dot Man

description:
Plague / Alien Demon is a combination of 2 arcade games on 1 cassette for the VIC-20.

In Alien Demon, the player explores a maze trying to keep ahead of an attacking alien. The player moves in the cardinal directions, and travels through a number of rooms with exits. A map at the top left of the screen shows nearby rooms. The player tries to avoid smaller aliens as they travel. If the alien catches the player, it's game over.

In Plague, the player controls a ship at the bottom of the screen trying to kill the three rows of insects that move horizontally across the top of the screen. Stopping the player from getting to the insects are eight ships arranged in groups of four, as well as four heat-seekers that follow the player. The insects are capable of defending themselves by throwing bombs at the player. If the player comes into contact with any ships, heat-seekers, or insects, they lose a life.
title: Plague / Alien Demon

description:
Dracula is a 1-player game for the VIC-20.

Count Dracula's castle gates are shut with a warning to one and all, "Keep Out". Only the very brave and adventurous dare enter the castle.

The player moves their character through different rooms trying to solve puzzles. The player can pick up shovels to dig graves, keys to unlock doors, and ladders to traverse pits. The count can be defeated with a stake. The player travels between rooms with the goal to end the Count.
title: Dracula

description:
Dragons & Treasure is a 1-player puzzle game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a warrior who moves through a series of randomly generated dungeon passages and chambers. The player can only see a small area around their current location. The player tries to avoid dragons while collecting treasure. If the player encounters a dragon, they become injured and will quickly pass away. There are 10 levels of difficulty.
title: Dragons & Treasure

description:
Junior Maths: Engineshed is an educational game for the VIC-20.

The player answers math questions to help drive a train engine into a shed. After 15 questions the engine arrives. The player can choose addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division.
title: Junior Maths: Engineshed

description:
Falcon Fighter is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player travels in a spaceship that move in all directions, while enemies and dangerous terrain scrolls from the right. The ship can drop bombs to destroy incoming dangers and land-based targets. There is limited ammunition and fuel, but these can be replenished by destroying the corresponding depots. As levels become more difficult, there are more approaching enemies, rockets begin to launch from the surface, and the player has to travel through tight tunnels. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Falcon Fighter

description:
Fantazia is an arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a large ship on the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically. The player tries to destroy waves of progressively more difficult enemy ships, five ships at a time, while avoiding enemy fire. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Fantazia

description:
Fatty Henry is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Thwitchy Thwilly the Octopus has been selected as the main course at an exclusive London restaurant. To avoid being cooked alive, you must collect the condensation dripping from the top of the oven and drop it on the flames. They must all be put out (except the flame on the very far left) before the temperature climbs to 100 degrees. The player must avoid a number of enemies including spinning food debris and Fatty 'Schizo' Henry, a very thick dog.

The octopus can move in all directions, and needs to grab the water from the top of the screen, move close to the flames at the bottom, and then release. Different levels have platforms which can stop the water drops. The dog continuously chases the player, while flames shoot from the bottom of the screen. If the player touches the flames, they lose a life, and start with 3 lives.
title: Fatty Henry

description:
Fire Trek is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a space ship that attempts to shoot enemy vessels. The ship can move in 4 directions, and the player can open their tactical map to see enemy locations. The distance to the enemy and remaining ship energy is displayed. The ship's energy is drained by time and enemy attack.
title: Fire Trek

description:
Forbidden Tower is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The Guardian of Forbidden Tower has turned you, Prince Harry, into a mutant, and imprisoned you in the chambers of his tower. Overcome the automatic defence system and collect all the jewels scattered around the tower to be restored to your former self and gain your freedom.

The player controls a small character who can move left, right, and jump, and moves through a number of different rooms. The player has 5 lives, and must avoid a number of dangers including spikes, monsters, and moving platforms.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting Room with Swings and Ladders

title: Forbidden Tower

description:
Frog Chase is a 1-player Frogger clone for the VIC-20.

The player attempts to navigate a frog across a busy highway and a river while avoiding being hit by cars or falling into the water. The player starts with 3 lives, and on each level has 30 seconds to avoid horizontally moving cars and walk across floating logs. If all 3 zones at the top of the screen are filled, the player advances to a more difficult level.
title: Frog Chase

description:
Frog is a 1-player Frogger clone for the VIC-20.

The player attempts to navigate a frog across a busy highway and a river while avoiding being hit by cars or falling into the water. The player starts with 3 lives, and moves in the cardinal directions. Cars and logs move horizontally across the screen, and turtles only stay on the surface a short period of time. If all 6 zones at the top of the screen are filled, the player advances to a more difficult level.
title: Frog

description:
Galaxy Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small ship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically upwards. Enemy ships move about at the top of the screen, and 2 or 3 at a time will descend towards the player firing. After destroying all enemy vessels, the player progresses to a faster moving level. The player starts with 3 lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: Straffed by Red ships on Level 3

title: Galaxy Attack

description:
Galaxzions is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small ship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically upwards. Enemy ships fire and descend towards the player. The player progresses to a faster moving level after all ships are destroyed.
title: Galaxzions

description:
Games Designer is a game package designed to help people create their own games for the VIC-20.

It comes complete with 3 example games: Kanga, Krazy Mazey, and Zyon.
title: Games Designer

description:
Gold Rush is a 1-player puzzle game for the VIC-20

It's 1848 in California, recently lost by Mexico to the U. S. A. after war. J. W. Marshall finds gold while building saw mill near John Sutter's Mill. By 1949, 1000's of men were making the long journey by ship or overland seeking their fortune, fighting Indians, hunger, and the most deadly killer cholera.

During the adventure, the player travels by ship and rowboat to reach California, and then the search for gold on land begins. The player must contend with flagmen signalling clues, ducks to shoot for lunch, and pots of gold to find en route. There are a total of 3 groups of 3 challenges that lead to the final challenge.

A monetary reward was awarded to the first player to find the word hidden in the puzzle.
title: Gold Rush

description:
Great Adventure is a 1-player adventure game for the VIC-20.

The player creates a new character that excels in strength or persuasion. The player explores a single map containing forest, mountains, and a lake. As they explore, they can encounter vipers, trolls, caves, dragons, and other dangers. Monsters can be engaged in combat or bargained with. The goal is to find a special item which can be given to the wizard who lives on a lake.
title: Great Adventure

description:
Gunslinger is a 1- 2 player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Two players face off on either side of a cactus-strewn field. Each player can move vertically and fires horizontally. Cactus and the occasional chuckwagon block players' shots. When a player is hit, they're carried off on a stretcher. The first player to score 5 hits is the winner.
title: Gunslinger

description:
Harvester / Brainstorm is a combination of two puzzle games for the VIC-20.

Harvester: A 1 - 4 player game where players attempt to gather all tokens on a 16 x 22 grid using 4 movable craft. Players choose which craft, and which of 8 directions, to move. The craft will move in that direction until it reaches the edge of the grid gathering all tokens along the way. If the player makes a move that does not align with tokens, the game is over. That player will lose their points for the round, while the other 3 players will hold onto their points for the next round.

Brainstorm: The Psions are friendly enough to Terrans, but their telepathic emissions are dangerous to the human brain. So, humans must never be in the vicinity of a greater number of Psions. The goal is to transport 3 Terrans and 3 Psions across a river using a single raft. If there are ever more Psions than Terrans on the side of the river, then it's game over. All Terrans can row the boat, but only one of the Psions is strong enough. The boat can only hold 1 Psion and 1 Terran at a time. The goal is to get all 6 across the river without a deadly brainstorm.
title: Harvester / Brainstorm

description:
Hopping Mad is a Frogger clone for the VIC-20.

Once again our amorous green friend has been sampling the delights of the town. But his nocturnal fun has turned into danger as he returns home in the morning. With both the rush hour traffic and the river to cross, can you get him home safely?
title: Hopping Mad

description:
Insector is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You are the commander of the surface patrol fleet. Defend the humanoids on the planet's surface against the insect creatures of Terron. The player has a fleet of 6 ships that can be sent in 1 at a time. The Insectors try to kidnap humans on the surface of the planet. Some of these are hidden in underground bunker. If captured, the humans are pulled to the surface by alien ships. If the loaded ships are blasted, the kidnapped human will float slowly back to the surface. The player cannot reach the top of the level where alien motherships are stationed. The player can move in all directions, but only fires directly forwards.

sample_screenshots.caption: Many bad guys as I Hide Underground

title: Insector

description:
Invaders Subtraction is an educational game for the VIC-20.

The player has to defend earth from an alien invasion by doing math. The player controls a gun at the bottom of the screen. From the top, alien saucers will appear and move towards the player. On the saucer is a subtraction problem that the player must solve. The alien is shot down with a correct answer and another appears. Input the wrong number, and the alien will continue towards the player. It's game over when the alien reaches the player. The player wins if they defend earth for two minutes. In harder difficulties the aliens move faster and the problems are harder.
title: Invaders Subtraction

description:
Jigsaw is a 1-player puzzle game for the VIC-20.

The player tries to combine 12 shapes into a rectangle by moving them about on the screen.
title: Jigsaw

description:
Johnnie Jumpjet is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player tries to reach their home at the top left of the screen from the bottom left of the screen. The player can move horizontally, and can jump horizontally or vertically a short distance. Deadly monsters drop continuously from 2 doors at the top of the screen, which then move about the level until they fall into the spikes at the bottom of the level. The player must contend with disappearing platforms, and have limited time to reach their goal. The player starts with 3 lives, and it's game over when all are lost. When the level is complete, the player plays the same level once again.
title: Johnnie Jumpjet

description:
Ape Escape is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small character who moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically upwards. A large gorilla sits atop a tall building in the center of the screen. The gorilla throws bricks off the roof at the same time helicopters drop bombs and steal bricks from the sides of the tower. The player starts with 3 lives, and loses a life if hit by building debris or helicopter fire. As bricks are stolen, the tower begins to fall. If the tower falls too much the gorilla will hop off and pummel the player. If the player gets hit by debris 3 times, it's game over.
title: Ape Escape

description:
Bridge is a 1-player card game for the VIC-20

All cards are graphically displayed on the screen as the player competes against computer opponents. Follows basic rules of bridge and tracks score over multiple hands.
title: Bridge

description:
Starquest / Encounter are two games released together for the VIC-20.

Starquest: With Earth's natural resources approaching depletion, you are perched on the edge of adventure. The massive interstellar exploration ship "Starquest" has been built with a new Hyperspace Transitional Drive. The player must choose locations from a navigation chart, and upon arriving there perform a sensor scan of planetary systems present. Upon arrival on the planet the player controls a excursion shuttle craft where they must avoid contact with meteors.

Encounter: A simulation of first contact with an extraterrestrial species. From a moonlight stroll on a lonely hillside you are enticed into a waiting starship. In a state of semi-consciousness, you are probed mentally and physically to test your intelligence and cultural development. The player must solve a number of logic puzzles that are presented to them. If successful, this may lead to a positive first contact with the alien race.
title: Starquest / Encounter

description:
Logic is a 1 - 2 player strategy game for the VIC-20.

Played against another human or a computer opponent, each player takes turns selecting numbers from an 8 x 8 board. Each square is randomly assigned a number from 15 to -10. Player 1 can only choose a piece in the row of the active location, and player 2 can only choose a piece in the column of the active location. The player with the highest score when no moves remain is the winner.
title: Logic

description:
Log Run is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small character who moves horizontally, jumps a short distance vertically, and can climb ladders. The player tries to climb a series of platforms while avoiding barrels thrown by a large gorilla at the top of the screen. The player starts with 3 lives, with one lost if hit by a barrel. After reaching the top of the level the player restarts once again.
title: Log Run

description:
Mars Mission is a 1-player arcade game for hte VIC-20.

The player descends a long Martian chasm to try to reach the inner caverns of the planet. The player's ship can move laterally and fire to the right while it slowly descends. As it goes down, the player must avoid mines and incoming rockets. After reaching the bottom of the chasm, the player navigates a series of tight tunnels to destroy the underground Martian reactor.
title: Mars Mission

description:
Martians is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

A small player-controlled ship moves laterally at the top of the screen from one side to the other, and can fire towards the bottom of the screen. The player can reverse the direction of the ship at any point, but it continually moves. Stationary enemy ships appear at the bottom of the screen that slowly scroll upwards. Enemy ships can only be destroyed by shooting their center, and the ship's flanks persist on the screen, blocking player fire. It's game over if the space ship hits an alien vessel.
title: Martians

description:
Super Star Trek is a 1-player strategy game for the VIC-20.

The player takes control of the U.S.S. Enterprise, and warps between quadrants trying to destroy all the Klingon vessels. Each game has a set time limit and a difficulty of 1 - 9. Hyperspace can be engaged to warp to different sectors. The player can fire torpedoes or use their phasers. For each attack the player must specify direction of fire. The ship's computer assists with navigation, tracks previously explored sectors, and can be used to evaluate ship status. The ship has limited energy, which can be use to power shields or the phasers. The ship can take damage and enact repairs, as well as visit star bases for repairs and recharges.
title: Super Star Trek

description:
Max is a 1-player Q*Bert clone for the VIC-20.

Max, a sweet little furry creature has been abducted by Zognaar, the wicked witch. She has forced him to play on her pyramid. This three dimensional pyramid is constructed from squares. Her ultimate creation Coily, a slimy evil snake travels up and down the pyramid after him. His bite is deadly.

Max has nine lives to paint as many pyramids as he can. Each time he finishes painting the pyramid, the witch makes the next one a bit more difficult to paint.

On the first level each square becomes permanently uncolored when jumped on. On proceeding levels the squares will reverse color every time they're jumped on. The player loses a life every time they're caught by Coily.
title: Max

description:
Key Quest is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small character in a maze who can move in the cardinal directions but only fires horizontally. A spawn point on each level causes an unending stream of monsters which move randomly about the level. Teleporters allow players to rapidly move across the level. The player must gather a number of treasure items, at which point a key appears. After collecting the key, the player can unlock the door to the right of the screen to escape to the next level. There is a time limit for each level and bonus points are awarded for time remaining. There are a total of 4 levels that loop and become progressively harder. The player starts with 5 lives and gains a new life every 10,000 points.
title: Key Quest

description:
Medieval Joust is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Two armored riders race towards each other with their lances draw. The distance until contact is displayed at the top of the screen. As the riders approach, the opponents appear larger in the displays at bottom of the screen. The player controls their lance, represented by a target on the opponent's screen, while the opponent tracks them with their shield. The goal is to reposition the target to an undefended part of their opponent's body at the time of contact, scoring higher points for a better hit. The computer also scores points for hits on the player. At higher levels the lance target becomes less responsive. The first player to reach 100 points is the victor. The player receives a Vile Varlet score for the number of opponents defeated in a row.

sample_screenshots.caption: Preparing to Joust with Sir Guy

title: Medieval Joust

description:
Number Nabber / Shape Grabber are two educational games for the VIC 20.

The player controls a small character with a long prehensile tongue that burrows about underground trying to grab numbers or shapes. The goal is to complete mathematical formulas or create similar shapes as shown at the top of the screen. Each number, shape, or operation caught is individually placed in a slot at the top of the screen. Once the two sides balance, the player eats an 'equals' sign to complete the problem. A small monster moves about the screen that will send the player back to the center of the screen if it catches the player. Both Number Nabber and Shape Grabber have four levels of difficulty.
title: Number Nabber / Shape Grabber

description:
Robot Panic is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Challenge 20 difficult levels of space combat against the Grydlocks. The player controls a large spaceship that moves in all directions and fires vertically. The player can activate their shield 5 times per game which makes their ship temporarily invulnerable. A number of progressively difficult alien attack waves approach as soon as the prior one is almost defeated. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: Robot Panic

description:
Space Snake is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

After the first colonial ships arrived at the edge of the first galaxy, people on Earth received news of ships disappearing forever. So the "Mastercontrol" sent out a body of scouts to investigate the matter. Soon they received the message, that this part of the galaxy was covered with swarms of meteorites and spacebirds. Some of them just floated, but others moved at a very high speed. Androids were programmed to discover a safe route through this ferocious field. But the task was far too difficult. One ship after another exploded almost immediately and some after a few minutes. No one was able to reach the final gateway on the planet Clusio, which would bring the fleet into a new galaxy. In despair, "Mastercontrol" asked the entire nation for help. They looked for volunteers, who could discover a safe passage to guide the national fleet into the galaxy beyond.

To make this task easier a very sophisticated Space Snake was developed. A quick maneuverable machine, which could dive into this treacherous space and outwit its dangerous entities. You could become this hero, if you are able to find a safe passage for the entire fleet.

The player controls a snake that moves laterally, and must wind their way through a field of rapidly moving dangers. Dangers approach faster as the game progresses, and it's game over if the player hits an object.
title: Space Snake

description:
Mini Kong is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Kong has abducted a young maiden and has trapped her at the top of his lair.

The player controls Mario, who can move laterally and jump a short distance. The player must navigate ladders and lifts while jumping over incoming barrels. Each level is timed, and bonus points are based upon time remaining. Purses can be picked up for bonus points. The player starts with 3 lives, and upon completing a level moves to a faster moving challenge. A new life is awarded every 10,000 points.
title: Mini Kong

description:
Moby Dick / Diver are two arcade games released together for the VIC-20.

In Moby Dick, the player controls the titular white whale as he tries to gobble fish in the ocean. The player must avoid large icebergs and boats which shoot harpoons towards the whale. The player gains points by eating fish, and can destroy whaling vessels by ramming directly into their bow. Bonus points can be earned by moving into lagoons when they appear. The player starts with 3 lives.

In Diver, the player controls an underwater diver who tries to gather all the items on the screen while avoiding jellyfish, weeds, rocks, and other underwater dangers. The player has limited oxygen to complete their task, and touching anything will result in loss of a life. There are 2 levels of game speed, and the player starts with 5 lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: Moby Dick: Whale in the Ocean
Diver: Going for the Last Chain

title: Moby Dick / Diver

description:
Witch Way is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player tries to rescue and win the love of their sweetheart over 4 separate levels. The player controls a small character who moves laterally and can jump a short distance. The player must navigate a series of platforms, ladders, and gaps to reach the top of each level. All the while, they must jump over or avoid a stream of barrels that roll down through the levels, as well as witches who fly across the screen on a broomstick. On the first stage, the player must rescue their sweetheart from a dangerous fire by pouring on water. Later, they must reach their sweetheart for a kiss, and later on level 3 reach a diamond ring for her. Finally, the player must reach their sweetheart for their wedding.
title: Witch Way

description:
Mower Mania is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player tries to mow a number of large yards with a push lawn mower. The player receives money for the amount of lawn mowed, but loses money depending on fuel used or when they damage the lawn mower by running over small obstacles. If the player hits a wall or a tree the lawn mower can be damaged or even destroyed. White and black rabbits hop about the lawn. Black rabbits cause the grass to grow back, and they can be safely run over with the mower. If a white rabbit is run down, a gravestone appears on the screen, and the player loses money. When a lawn is entirely mowed, the player moves to a new lawn.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Hit a Tree and Lost my Mower

title: Mower Mania

description:
Muncher is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The enchanted flower garden is the lair of the honey hungry munchers. Only three defender bees stand between an onslaught of the dreaded munchers and the royal honey.

The player controls the bee at the bottom of the screen that can move laterally and fire vertically. Large munchers zigzag to the bottom of the screen, and the player tries to shoot them with their stinger before they reach the bottom. When a muncher reaches the bottom of the screen, a part of the royal honey's guard barrier is destroyed. If a muncher reaches the honey horde it's game over. The player loses a life if hit by a muncher, and starts with 3 lives.
title: Muncher

description:
Super Games Pack 1 is a compilation of 4 games for the VIC-20.

  • African Beads: a 1 - 2 player variant on the bead game Mancala. Multiple levels of computer difficulty.

  • Chinamen: a 1 - 2 player board game. Played on a 6 x 6 board, each player takes turns moving 1 of 6 pieces on a board to capture opponents. Each turn the player rolls 1 - 6, and can move a piece that many moves in a single direction. A piece is removed from the board if it's surrounded by 3 opponents. The first player to take 3 pieces is the winner.

  • Ghost Driver: a top-down 2D-scrolling arcade driving game. The player avoids incoming vehicles by moving laterally. The player sets game speed and car density

  • Panzer Duel: a 2-player artillery duel game where players enter angle and velocity of fire to try to destroy their opponent's tank.
title: Super Games Pack 1

description:
Super Games Pack 2 is a compilation of 4 games for the VIC-20.

  • Blokit: a 1-player game versus computer where players take turns placing pieces on a board. First to get 5-in-a-row is the winner.

  • Cannonade: an artillery duel game where players try to shoot through a hole in a wall by inputting the power and direction of fire.

  • Road Rally: a top-down 2D scrolling driving game. The player chooses the width of track.

  • Skittles: a bowling game where the player has to choose the correct time to release a moving ball on the left to hit pins at the right of the screen.
title: Super Games Pack 2

description:
Operation Ganymed is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Your lunar module is low on fuel and your mission is to unload badly needed supplies to a remote colony. The three landing sites lie among the caverns and cliffs of the Altai Mountains. Your mission is complete when all three sites have received supplies. With only three modules at your disposal, you must land accurately on each site at exactly the right rate of descent. Too fast or out of position and you will blow up on impact. Points are given for the amount of fuel and for low landing speeds. The player's spaceship is refilled with each successful landing. After landing on all 3 sites gravity is increased.
title: Operation Ganymed

description:
Parachute is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player tries to lands a parachuter on a target at the bottom center of the screen. A plane flies across the top of the screen, and the player decides when to eject a parachuter. Wind blows the man about randomly as they float down to the ground. The player gets a point for every safe landing on the target. At higher difficulties the target also moves.
title: Parachute

description:
Penny Slot is a slot machine game for the VIC-20.

Play a 3 reel slot machine. The player can bid several pence at a time, and there are multiple winning combinations.
title: Penny Slot

description:
Pixie Pack is a series of graphical educational games for the VIC-20.

  • Pixie Add: add together pixies and receive a balloon for each correct answer.
  • Pixie Bump: count mushrooms, and then subtract or add them.
  • Pixie Count: count pixies to receive mushrooms.
  • Pixie Maze: try to quickly answer addition/subtraction questions to keep ahead of a chasing monster.
  • Pixie Steps: place blocks in correct order to go up or down a staircase to avoid an attacking monster.
  • Pixie Words: count objects and recognize the spelling of words.
title: Pixie Pack

description:
Pollywog is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a frog who moves in the cardinal direction, and tries to reach their lily pad on the other side of a river. The player tries to jump between turtles that cross the river in varying directions and speed, and the frog drowns if it falls in the water. If all 4 lily pads are filled the player moves to a more challenging level. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Pollywog

description:
Power Blaster is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The year is 2201. The universe has been ravaged by many wars. The Venusians seek peace with the Martians, and have summoned the Martian Overlord to peace talks. You are the commander of a Venusian Defence Force patrol ship. Your mission is to blast the remote control high power bombs which are being planted by the Martian Overlord's personal attack force just in case the negotiations break down. If they break down the Overlord will blast Venus to atoms after he has reached a safe distance from the planet. You must not shoot the Martians unless you have no choice.

The player can move in 8 directions on a maze with the goal to clear all bombs. Each time that the player shoots three Martians they get more frantic and lay the bombs faster. All bombs are replaced on the screen when this happens. The player can use hyperspace when surrounded by Martians to warp to a new area. It's game over if the player is hit by a Martian.
title: Power Blaster

description:
Puzzle Pack is a compilation of 6 puzzle games for the VIC-20.

Contains:

  • Digits
  • Graphic Twister
  • Knight's Move
  • Orbits
  • Rainbows
  • Slide Puzzles
title: Puzzle Pack

description:
Quasimodo is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The evil Count D'Arcy is preparing to hang Esmerelda, a pretty gypsy girl. But Quasimodo the ugly mute hunchback, guardian of the cathedral bells, loves Esmerelda and seeks to rescue her. You must make your way along the 15 castle wall to save her, avoiding the arrows and rocks. Quasimodo's goal on each level is to move from the left to the right to ring the bell, and must jump over incoming arrows and castle guards. If 5 bells are run in a row without losing a life the player receives a super bonus of 5000 points. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Quasimodo

description:
Race is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Played from a top down perspective, the player races a motorcycle down a busy straight road while trying to avoid hitting other cars or the curb. The distance travelled is displayed on the left of the screen. There are 4 levels of difficulty, and a final score is displayed at the end of the game.
title: Race

description:
Rapier Punch is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You are a brave knight who is searching for treasure in a darkened room. The knight can move in all directions, and can fire daggers a short distance horizontally to the left or right. Initially the room is darkened, but as the player explores they discover numerous enemies. On each level the player has 99 time units to find the treasure, and receives points based upon 100 x time remaining. There is also a tone that intermittently plays, and during this time the player can destroy monsters by running into them with their rapier. Enemies include spinning crosses, dragon eggs, and dragons. There are a total of 99 levels, and the player starts with 3 lives.
title: Rapier Punch

description:
Revenge of the Quadra is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small vessel that can move in all directions and fire directly forwards. The player tries to protect the pods at the bottom of the screen from descending alien vessels. As alien vessels grab pods they can be shot to drop the pods back to the ground again. Asteroids and alien fire comes from the side of the screen. If all pods are captured it's game over. The player starts with 5 lives, and after sufficient alien vessels are destroyed to player advances to a more difficult level.
title: Revenge of the Quadra

description:
Robot Mouse is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You are a mechanical mouse collecting atomic cheese from the floor of a space station avoiding a head on collision with the deadly malfunctioning robots. The mouse and a robot move around a series of 3 concentric rings in opposite directions. There are 4 spaces where the mouse and robot can move between rings. The mouse can move 2 rings at a time while the robot can move 1. The mouse tries to collect all pieces of cheese without being caught.

In the second phase, the mouse enters the Nuclear Power Chamber where they must eat more cheese while avoiding their radioactive footprints. The mouse moves in 4 directions, and leaves a series of footprints as they move. When a piece of cheese is collected a new one appears on the screen. When all cheese is collected, the player returns to the previous game sequence.

There are 9 levels of difficulty, and the player starts with 4 lives.
title: Robot Mouse

description:
Android Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

On a deep space flight your space ship encounters serious trouble and the order to "Abandon Ship" is called. You were quick enough to escape from the limping space ship and just as you cleared the danger zone you see your space ship blown to pieces. Your life capsule lands you safely on the nearest planet, which happens to be Jupiter, but it has unfortunately landed you in the Maze of Death patrolled by the deadly Androids.

The player moves about the maze while Androids rapidly move about. The player tries to gather dots for points, but the Androids will continuously replace these. The number of Androids in the maze steadily increases as time passes, and gameplay continues until an Android captures the player.

sample_screenshots.caption: Four Androids are Hard to Avoid

title: Android Attack

description:
Ant Raiders is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a character at the bottom of the screen that moves horizontally and fires vertically. Only a single slow moving shot appears on the screen at a time. Ants move laterally across the screen until they hit an obstacle, and then move down 1 row and reverse direction. When an ant is hit it's trapped, leaving a mark on the screen. If this mark is again hit, the ant escapes and starts moving again. Obstacles randomly appear on the screen blocking the player's shots. The player completes a level if all 10 ants are trapped before an ant reaches the bottom row. It's game over if an ant reaches the bottom.
title: Ant Raiders

description:
Astro Nell is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Help Astro Nell find all the objects scattered around the bizarre netherworld. Astro Nell can walk laterally and jump. Her goal is to collect a total of 88 objects within 9999 time units. Nell must jump between platforms while avoiding dangerous terrain and alien creatures. Multiple screens link together to create a large maze, and the player can move between sections. Nell starts with 5 lives to complete her adventure.
title: Astro Nell

description:
Battle of Britain is a 1-player strategy game for the VIC-20

You are the war minister for the United Kingdom. The country relies on steel, weapons, food, ball bearings, fuel, and aircraft which all affect morale. As you lose portions of each then your effectiveness as a fighting nation is reduced. This affects the number of aircraft that are built.

The player sets the number of German fighters and bombers that will attack Britain. Each turn, the player can use their radar to scan for incoming German aircraft. The player can check the status of 12 different British cities, and can build and convert new aircraft. The player can scramble or land their aircraft, change the height of their planes, and change aircraft readiness. The player needs to defend from incoming German ships and manage their resources.
title: Battle of Britain

description:
Bird of Prey is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Prince Rupert has inherited the throne of the mountain kingdom of Lauritania. Life in the kingdom is prosperous and happy. With man living in harmony with the birds and the beasts with their king the Great Eagle of the North. The Prince's cousin the evil Baron Von Fritz is planning to destroy the realm of Lauritania and turn it to ways of evil.

To aid him in his plans, the Baron has entered an alliance with the Demon of the Fire Pit. To seal the pact the Baron must sacrifice Prince Rupert to the Fire Demon. The Baron intends to do this by throwing Prince Rupert from the plane into the Fire Pit. But, the Eagle of the North is on hand to rescue Prince Rupert, and take him to safety of his aerie.

The player controls a large bird that flaps to gain altitude and moves laterally. Fire bombs fall from the top of the screen and then roll along the platforms on the screen. If the bombs strike the bottom center platform they explode into a temporary fire pit. The player tries to pick up Prince Rupert from the screen and bring him to the aerie at the top left of the screen. The player must avoid fire bombs, The Baron's airplane, and the fire pit, and it's game over with a single hit.
title: Bird of Prey

description:
Black Max is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small character who moves about a dungeon in the cardinal directions. The goal is to eat all 10 stationary dark blue monsters on the screen before time runs out. Light blue monsters can be eaten for bonus points and time. Eating red barricades costs time. If all dark blue creatures are eaten, the player begins a new round with a shorter time limit.

sample_screenshots.caption: Release date and publisher.  DELETE ME!

title: Black Max

description:
Brennball is a computerized version of the bat and ball game for the VIC-20.

Played by two teams of 3 players, the goal is to run around 5 bases or flags. The computer team pitches the ball, and the player must time their swing to hit it into the field between the bases. If the batter misses 3 times, they're out. The batter, after hitting the ball into the field, tries to run as many of the 5 bases as possible. The two outfielders must catch the ball and pass it to the pitcher who then tries to tag the runners. If a runner stops beside a flag they are safe, and can only be tagged out between bases. Any runner who is tagged is out for the remainder of the game making it more difficult to score further runs. Game play continues until all three batters are tagged out, and the player receives their final score.
title: Brennball

description:
Bricks is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small character who moves laterally at the bottom of the screen. Bricks continuously fall randomly from the top of the screen, and the player must avoid being crushed. The player can push single blocks laterally if there is nothing behind them, and can also jump to a higher block if only elevated one level. The player starts with 4 lives, and tries to reach the top of the screen for bonus points. There are a total of 6 levels, with the walls squeezing closer each level.
title: Bricks

description:
Bridge Man is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

This is it, your big opportunity. You've recently qualified as the youngest bridge builder in the country; and have just won your first major contract. The boss of a multi-national construction company has sub-contracted you to build a bridge for his latest project. The contract you signed was pretty strict, in fact, the penalty clause was absolutely frightening; if the bridge isn't completed on time you will be bankrupt, and that's no way to start off in business. On the other hand if everything goes according to plan your future is secure.

Yesterday, your supplier phoned to tell you that due to a nationwide shortage of materials the final delivery of sections will be delayed until tomorrow. The trouble is your time limit runs out this afternoon. You have six gaps in the bridge, and only one spare section. Here comes the Boss to inspect the bridge. Can you juggle the single section around quickly enough so that he won't notice the gaps?

The player selects 6 buttons to temporarily fill 1 of 6 gaps. The gaps are divided over 3 levels, and the boss will randomly try to walk across a platform from the right of the screen. The player must fill the correct gap before the boss walks across, or else he falls off the bridge. Each time the boss crosses he walks faster the next time. If the boss falls 3 times, it's game over.
title: Bridge Man

description:
Cannon Ball is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls 2 immobile cannons each with 12 shots that fire horizontally from the left. A skull approached from the right, which moves from the top to the bottom of the screen, and then approaches 1 row closer and repeats. The goal is to shoot as many skulls as possible. As skulls approach closer they are worth fewer points. If a skull reaches the cannons it's game over.
title: Cannon Ball

description:
Games 20 is a compilation of 20 games for the VIC-20.

Contains 20 video games including: Cargar, Chase, Convention, Crazy Balloon, Diamond Hunt, Frogs, Galactic Defender, Grand Prix, Horse Race, Ice, Laser Shoot, Maze Master, Metro Dome, Night Flyer, Rotate, Safe, Senorita, Space Birds, Star Fights, and Tanks.
title: Games 20

description:
City Bomber & Minefield are 2 releases for the VIC-20.

In City Bomber, the player flies a plane that moves laterally across the screen, and when it reaches the edge, moves down slightly, and repeats. The player drops bombs that partially destroy the skyscrapers vertically below the player. The goal is to destroy the city before colliding into an object.

In Minefield, the player tries to cross a 16 x 16 minefield. The player can move in 8 directions, and each section tells the player how many surrounding squares contain a mine.

sample_screenshots.caption: City Bomber: Crashing into a Building

title: City Bomber & Minefield

description:
Compusport Grand Prix is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player races through a multicolored racetrack. The vehicle moves rapidly to the left and right, and the player tries to keep the vehicle on the track. The vehicle is briefly slowed down if they hit an obstacle. There are 3 levels of difficulty.
title: Compusport Grand Prix

description:
Connect 4 is a 1 - 2 player variant of the classic board game.

Each player takes turns dropping their black or white piece into 1 of 8 vertical slots. The first player to play 4 in a row is the winner.
title: Connect 4

description:
Critical Path is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small vehicle that can move laterally, and tries to avoid incoming potholes. If the player hits a pothole they're temporarily slowed, with the goal is to reach the finish line in the minimum time.
title: Critical Path

description:
The Curse of the Werewolf is a text adventure for the VIC-20.

Arriving in the village of Kallowstein, the player's goal is to hunt and kill the werewolf that haunts the local castle. Dangers include evil green goblins, aggressive zombies, and the werewolf itself.

The player starts with a constitution of 30, and loses health with certain actions. Death occurs with a constitution of 0. There are a total of 30 points to be awarded during the adventure. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is no save/restore feature. A help feature offers clues at certain points in the game.
title: The Curse of the Werewolf

description:
Dam Bomber is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small airplane that continuously flies from the left to the right of the screen. The plane can move vertically to avoid incoming fire from a single anti-aircraft gun mounted atop a dam. The player drops bombs to attempt to destroy the dam, and when a complete row of the dam is destroyed, the anti-aircraft gun lowers. The goal is to avoid enemy fire while destroying the dam. The player starts with 4 lives.
title: Dam Bomber

description:
Damsel is a 1 - 4 player fantasy themed board game for the VIC-20.

Each player takes turns rolling an 8-sided dice to move through a spiral-shaped board to reach the damsel at the center. Depending on the color the player lands on, they can either roll again to move forwards or backwards, miss a turn, acquire a strength scroll, encounter a magic bridge, or encounter an enemy. Combat is random, and the player can opt to use a shield, and if defeated moves to the start of the board. At a magic bridge the player can choose to cross which leads to combat. If the player succeeds at a bridge combat they move far ahead. Victory in random combat gives the player another roll.
title: Damsel

description:
Death Star is a text adventure for the VIC-20.

The Rim War of 2685 has reached its final stage. The Jillyan super weapon, Death Star, nears Terra on its mission of final destruction. Terranian agents have hidden a super photon charge aboard. It is up to you to locate and activate it. The player must navigate the rooms of the space ship, gather items, solve puzzles, destroy the Death Star, and escape to safety.

All available directions are shown on a small map at the top left of the screen. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is no save/restore feature.
title: Death Star

description:
Grub & Defend are two arcade games for the VIC-20.

Defend is a Missile Command game. The player controls 5 artillery pieces at the bottom of the screen as they attempt to destroy incoming dangers. When all are destroyed, it's game over.

In Grub, the player controls a small mouth that repeatedly moves from the left to the right of the screen. Items begin to populate the screen, which includes: plums, apples, crosses, and sodas. The player can move the mouth up and down, and tries to eat apples for 10 points. Plums cost 1 point, and a cross costs a life. Soda bottles cause the level to reset. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Grub & Defend

description:
Delivery Alert is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The missiles fly overhead, screaming like banshees in the night. Their explosions reverbating amidst the cries of the wounded. The dusty smell of gun-fire is in the air, and smoke fills the skies, obliterating the war planes diving down to strafe the infantry. Communications have been severed, and you must deliver strategic plans from one command post to another, dodging snipers and machine gunners.

The game play area contains a 9 x 9 grid of trees. A cannon at the left of the screen continuously scrolls from the top to the bottom of the screen, and if the cannon aligns with the player, it will destroy them. The player can hide behind trees to avoid death. When all packages are delivered a new set of letters appears and the cannon speeds up. The player starts with 3 lives and receives a bonus man every 5000 points.
title: Delivery Alert

description:
Electra Sport Soccer is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20

The player controls a single soccer player that tries to push a soccer ball into a single net. The player moves in the cardinal directions, and the distance the soccer ball travels depends upon how fast the player pushes the ball. If the ball is pushed into a wall and bounces back to the player, the level is restarted. The player tries to score in the fewest possible kicks. There is only one level, and 4 levels of difficulty.
title: Electra Sport Soccer

description:
Emmet Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls the turret of an attack vessel that must defeat the incoming Emmet force. The screen scrolls laterally if the turret is moved off the edge of the screen. Spider-like Emmets move laterally across the screen starting at the horizon until they reach a mountain and hide. They then later appear slightly closer to the bottom of the screen, and repeat this pattern. The player must destroy 10 Emmets before they reach the bottom of the screen, and then advance to a level with faster moving creatures.
title: Emmet Attack

description:
Evasion is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a prisoner who starts inside a jail cell, with a much faster moving opponent on the outside. The player attempts to gather all the keys outside the cell while avoiding the opponent character. The doors to the cell temporarily open, and the player must exit through these to grab items, and then return to the cell before being either captured by their opponent or the walls of the jail close again leaving them trapped outside. The opponent rapidly chases the player, but will not enter the cell. After the keys are acquired, the player tries to safely navigate to the doors on the level to move to the next challenge.
title: Evasion

description:
Galactic Defender is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You must stop the Arkon Aliens from polluting our atmosphere with their deadly poisons. Placed on a series of 5 moving platforms, the player can move left, right, and jump or fall between levels. Aliens move downwards through the layers, and if they reach the bottom they pollute the atmosphere. The player touches an alien to destroy it, and if five aliens reach the bottom, it's game over. If the player falls to the bottom they lose a life. Four power pods are located at the top of the screen. When the player collects a pod the next alien is worth 4x as many points.
title: Galactic Defender

description:
Grand Prix / Nuclear Attack are two arcade games for the VIC-20.

Grand Prix: Drive a blue race car from a top down perspective on a scrolling track while trying to avoid moving red cars. The player can move left and right. The goal is to travel as far as possible in 60 seconds.

Nuclear Attack: Move a crosshair to shoot incoming missiles. Try to protect the cities at the bottom of the screen.
title: Grand Prix / Nuclear Attack

description:
Vic-torian Follies 2: The Great London to Paris Air Race is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You are about to participate in an epic 225 mile cross channel race from London to Paris. The player controls an airplane from a side view which can accelerate, decelerate, and fly up and down. The player flies over a number of terrain including fields, cities, and ocean. The player has to avoid buildings and other planes as they fly. As the plane accelerates it uses more fuel, and if it travels too fast it won't make it to the next fueling point. The player can land on airfields to refuel and then take off again. The player gets a single chance to make their flight.
title: Vic-torian Follies 2: The Great London to Paris Air Race

description:
Kings Ransom is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Set on a number of moving platforms with holes, the player controls a small character who tries to gather coins that fall from the top of the screen. The player can move and jump laterally, and can also jump a short distance vertically to move to higher platforms. Numerous blue monsters descend from the top of the screen, while red fireballs ascend through spaces from the bottom. The goal is to gather coins before they fall off the screen, while avoiding monsters and not falling into the lava at the bottom. The player starts with 4 lives, and each coin is worth 10 points.
title: Kings Ransom

description:
Kong is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Kong stands atop the Empire State Building throwing boulders and debris in all directions. The player controls a helicopter that moves in all directions, and tries to pick up the 7 stranded people, while avoiding being hit by Kong or other rubble. After the rescue the player must return to the launch pad. On progressive levels Kong throws rocks more frequently. A single hit and it's game over.
title: Kong

description:
Laser Blast is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.
