The enemy's robot fighters are hot after you, and if they detect you they'll shoot! The player controls a U.F.O. that can move in all directions and fires vertically downwards. Enemy planes approach from the left, and the player tries to shoot them without being hit. If the ship is moving the enemies are more likely to return fire. Every shot temporarily heats the vehicle, and if the ship overheats it can't fire for some time. Every shot also drains the ship's power causing it to lose altitude, and eventually crash into the ground. Each game starts with 3 ships.
title: Laser Blast

description:
Sub-Traction & Lighthouse are 2 educational games for the VIC-20.

In Lighthouse, the player must answer falling mathematical questions before they crash into the rocks below the animated lighthouse.

In Sub-Traction, ships appear on a 20 x 20 grid. The player must correctly answer the difference between the two numbers to destroy the enemy.
title: Sub-traction & Lighthouse

description:
Lunar Lander is a 1-player Lunar Lander clone for the VIC-20.

The player tries to land their spacecraft on the surface of the Moon. They have limited fuel and time, and can control the ship's horizontal and vertical thrust. Gravity constantly pulls the ship down. If the ship lands at the wrong location, too hard, or with horizontal movement it is destroyed.
title: Lunar Lander

description:
Luv Bug is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Set against a backdrop of a harbour on a late August evening, Luscious Lucy dances along the top of the harbour front from side to side blowing kisses down to ladies man Cuddly Dudley. Dudley must run and jump along the walkways and climb ladders in pursuit of the hearts that rain down from Lucy. Livid with the way she was spurned by Dudley, Bionic Bertha sets off in hot pursuit of Dudley. The player tries to collect 12 hearts while avoiding Bionic Bertha, and loses a life if caught. After collecting 12 hearts they move on to a more difficult level.
title: Luv Bug

description:
Man on the Run & Space Bomber are 2 arcade games for the VIC-20.

In Man on the Run, you have been captured by the Master who for his entertainment, and he subjects you to a time test by placing you in an arena surrounded by deadly aliens. You are armed with a charged photon blaster. The player controls a small character who can rotate in 4 directions, move in the direction he faces, and fire in that direction. Enemies activate at the peripheries of the level and move towards the player. The player must shoot the enemies without being hit. When all are destroyed, the player enters a new arena with more difficult aliens.

In Space Bomber, you are on a distant world in control of a laser cannon with the task of defending a Starfleet storage complex which houses the space warp fuel Xycron. Xycron is the key to the Federation's colonization of the galaxy, and a fleet of alien storm troopers are commencing to destroy the supplies at each outpost to prevent further Federation expansion. The player controls a large ship that moves horizontally at the bottom of the screen and fires forwards. Aliens approach from the edge of the screen and steal a single piece of fuel. Special aliens can steal all the fuel in a row. The plane approaches and can destroy all the fuel in a column, but fuel is replaced if the plane is destroyed. The player must destroy all aliens before all fuel is stolen. The player loses a life if hit by alien fire or if all fuel is stolen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Man on the Run: Final Score
Space Bomber: Alien Steal Fuel Row

title: Man on the Run & Space Bomber

description:
Junior Maths: Snowmen and Maths Maze is an educational game for the VIC-20.

In Maths Maze, the player must navigate through a small maze using the cardinal directions. There are several quiz points where the player must answer a math question. If correct they can move on, otherwise they must restart the maze.

Snowmen is a competitive math game where players must answer questions as quickly as possible. Each player chooses from 9 levels of difficulty, and can do addition or multiplication questions. As the player tries to answer questions a snowman slowly builds on their side of the screen. The first person to complete the snowman loses.

sample_screenshots.caption: Maths Maze: Back to the Start

title: Junior Maths: Snowmen and Maths Maze

description:
Maze Gold is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player tries to guide their man around a maze avoiding monsters and randomly placed pillars. On each level there are 5 gold pieces, and the player moves to the next level by collecting all gold or escaping out 1 of the 4 doors at the edge of the level. After every 3 levels, an additional monster will appear up to 6 monsters per stage. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: Maze Gold

description:
Sub Attack & Missile Command are two arcade games released for the VIC-20.

In Missile Command, the player combats bat-like mutants that have evolved from the effects of a nuclear war. The player controls a small vessel that moves in all directions and fires to the right. They must avoid or destroy incoming mutants, and are armed with 10 missiles at a time. Missiles can be restored by moving forwards. The player starts with 3 ships, and loses 1 if hit.

In Sub Attack, the goal is to destroy as many ships as possible from the safety of a submarine in the bottom of the screen. The sub shoots vertically, and can move left and right at the bottom of the ocean. A variety of boats sail across the ocean above, and each game is timed to 1 minute.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sub Attack: A Small Fast Vessel
Sub Attack: A Large Slow Vessel

title: Sub Attack & Missile Command

description:
Missile Panic is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player is continuously chased around a maze by a homing missile. The player tries to hit as many energy crosses as possible before being destroyed. The missile starts out slowly, but each cross gathered increases the missile's speed and tracking system. Each cross is worth more points than the previous.
title: Missile Panic

description:
Math Hurdler / Monster Maze are two games released together for the VIC-20.

In Math Hurdler the goal is to successfully jump 10 hurdles. The player must correctly answer a math question before reaching the hurdle to clear the jump. The player controls the difficulty level (1 - 3), the speed (1 - 5), and the type of math questions. The player's final score is based upon the challenge and number of hurdles cleared.

In Monster Maze the goal is to navigate through a maze while avoiding the monsters which infest it. The character moves in the 4 cardinal directions, and can only see the small portion of the maze surrounding them. The monsters always move towards the player, and can move through walls. The player starts in the top left and must navigate to the bottom right. Each level features an additional attacking monster.

sample_screenshots.caption: Monster Maze: I Reached the Exit

title: Math Hurdler / Monster Maze

description:
Munchmaid! is a 1-player Pac-Man clone for the VIC-20.

Navigate a disembodied woman's head through a maze while eating dots and avoiding monsters. Four power pellets in the corners of the level temporarily make the monsters vulnerable. The monsters move towards the player, and if all dots are eaten the player starts an identical level with slightly faster moving enemies. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Munchmaid!

description:
Treasure Hunt on Mystery Island is a text adventure for the VIC-20.

The player must find the treasures on Mystery Island and escape to freedom. They must contend with monkeys and other dangers. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. All directions are given by a location, and not the typical cardinal directions seen in text adventures. There is no save/restore feature.
title: Treasure Hunt on Mystery Island

description:
Naval Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a large boat that moves left and right, and can fire missiles one at a time towards the nearby coast. Small cars drive along the beach, and the player tries to shoot as many cars as they can in 200 time units. Each car is worth 10 points.
title: Naval Attack

description:
Night Flight is a flight simulator for the VIC-20.

The player attempts to land their 747 on a runway in complete darkness. The plane starts at 2500 feet altitude, and can control the speed, rate of climb/descent and bearing of their aircraft. An air traffic controller helps the player land safely. The plane will stall below 75 mph, and the landing speed of descent must be less than 10 feet/second. The plane has limited fuel to complete its landing.
title: Night Flight

description:
Olly is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player tries to gather all of the clams being held hostage by Olly the Octopus. A small character moves in the cardinal directions, and must avoid sharks that move laterally across the screen. Olly's tentacles flick rapidly back and forth, and the player must move between these to gather clams. The player has limited oxygen to gather clams, and has a total of 5 lives to try to rescue all of the clams. Each clam is worth 10 points.
title: Olly

description:
VIC Panic is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You are one of the many crew on board a transgalactic mineral freight carrier on a long journey through deep space transporting mineral ore from the outer arm of the galaxy back to Earth. Your job is to carry out maintenance of the super-structure of the ship. During one of these surveillance trips you find that the ship has been overrun by alien beings whose only aim appears to be to take over your ship, even if that means killing the crew.

The player walks along the many platforms of the ship's superstructure, and climbs ladders between levels. Aliens roam randomly about, and armed with a space shovel the player can dig holes in the levels to cause aliens to fall through. After falling through, the player must fill the holes back up to kill the alien. There are 3 levels of aliens, with the hardest having to fall through 3 levels of the freight carrier before they can be defeated. The player has limited oxygen to complete each level and starts with 3 lives.
title: VIC Panic

description:
Pilot Pursuit is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a crosshair and attempts to shoot down enemy planes. The enemy planes intermittently fires back at the player. Every 5 planes destroyed, the enemies move faster and are more difficult to hit. The points awarded for each hit depends on the level, and 4 points are deducted with each miss. It's game over after reaching 100 damage from enemy hits.
title: Pilot Pursuit

description:
Puckman is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a character who moves about a maze trying to gobble all the dots. They must avoid 4 ghosts that chase the player about the maze. Four power pellets located in the corners of the maze make ghosts temporarily vulnerable. After consuming all dots the player starts a new level with faster moving ghosts. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Puckman

description:
Q-Warrior is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The warnings were there three years before. We had sent out regular star fighter squadrons to scout out the signals. They never returned. As they came nearer we learned more and more about the skills and tactics they used. Finally we built the Q ships, designed to meet the menace head on.

You are a pilot, a Q Warrior, whose ship can move and fire in 8 separate directions. Enemy forces steadily climb up the screen, and the player must blast them before they reach their goal. Three deadly laser beams positioned at the edges of the screen set up a crossfire, and the player loses a life if caught in the crossfire. Neutron torpedo launchers appear at the edge of the screen and fire on the player. The player also loses a life if they receive 10 collisions or torpedo hits. The player starts with 5 ships.
title: Q-Warrior

description:
Rainbow Towers is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle for the VIC-20.

The game starts with 6 pegs and 3 towers. The player can start with towers from 2 to 6 discs in height. The goal is to move all 3 towers onto their opposing pegs, with only smaller discs allowed to be placed on larger ones.
title: Rainbow Towers

description:
Rifle Range is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a crosshair, and attempts to shoot a target that moves randomly about a small playing area. There are 4 levels of difficulty which affect target speed, and a point is scored each time the target is hit. The player can fire 25 bullets with the final score the number of targets hit.
title: Rifle Range

description:
Road Runner is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Set on the busiest highway in the universe, your objective is to cross the mass of molecular vehicles and collect as many points as possible by entering the highest scoring space lanes. The player can move in the cardinal directions, and must avoid cars that run back and forth in their lanes. The player scores points based upon the number they reach, but it's game over if they hit the black hole in the center of the left or are hit by a car. Every level completed leads to faster moving vehicles, and the points scored each round are the level x the number reached.
title: Road Runner

description:
Safe Cracker is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You are a country gentleman by day, but by night a cat burglar. A professional safe cracker, and tonight could be your crowning achievement in your long history of audacious and charming crimes. Tonight you are going to crack fifteen safes and retire at dawn a millionaire.

The player drives their car through a grid of buildings trying to gather all of the money bags. Police cars rapidly zoom from the edges of the screen trying to catch the player. These cars always appear on a street directly facing the player, and will stop moving if the player changes their road. Only one police car appears at a time, and these stationary cars stay on the map until another car on that street replaces them. If the player hits a stationary or moving police car it's game over. There are 4 levels of difficulty, and a level is completed when all money is collected.
title: Safe Cracker

description:
Scrambler is a 1-player Scramble clone for the VIC-20.

The player controls a ship that flies over the uneven scrolling terrain of Mars. The ship can drop bombs and fire straight ahead, and must avoid incoming rockets and asteroids. The player gains extra points for bombing fuel dumps. The goal is to survive as long as possible over 3 lives to maximize score.
title: Scrambler

description:
Search and Destroy is an electronic version of the board game Battleship.

Played on an 8 x 8 grid, the player and computer place 4 vessels. Each vessel only uses 1 square, and the location of the opponent's vessels are hidden. Each player takes turns firing, either missing or hitting enemy vessels. The first player to clear 4 enemy ships is the victor.
title: Search and Destroy

description:
Secret Mission is a text adventure with graphics for the VIC-20.

Your mission is to find and deactivate the central computer which is in control of the building. As you move around the rooms and corridors, you encounter numerous puzzles. An elevator and staircases provide movement between the 5 levels of the establishment you are trapped in.

There is a save/restore feature, and all commands are via VERB NOUN injury. The game provides hints for puzzles if the player makes several incorrect moves.
title: Secret Mission

description:
Senku is a Mastermind game for the VIC-20.

The player tries to solve a hidden code that can be 1 - 7 digits long. After each attempt the player is told how many numbers are correct and how many are in the correct position. The player can choose whether repeating digits are allowed.
title: Senku

description:
Shifty is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Control a gobbling ball, and try to eat all the dots in a maze. The ghosts will continuously chase the player. The maze contains a number of revolving doors which rotate 90 degrees when the player passes through, allowing the player to block ghost movement to escape their attack. When all dots in the maze are gobbled, the player advances to a level with an additional ghost. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Shifty

description:
Sir Hero is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player attempts to cross a long brick wall to reach the bell on the right side. Arrows approach from the left and fireballs come from the right. The player must avoid these while jumping over pits with spears and crossing drawbridges. After completing 5 levels the player can rescue the princess jailed in the dungeon. The player starts with 5 lives and gains an extra life every princess rescued.
title: Sir Hero

description:
Ski is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a downhill skier played from a top down perspective, who can turn left and right, always moving at a 45 degree angle down the hill. The player gains 100 points for moving through red poles, but loses 10 points for hitting a blue flag. If the player hits a green bump or the edge of the ski hill their run is over. There are 4 levels of difficulty that control the speed of movement down the hill.
title: Ski

description:
Ski-Run is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a downhill skier played from a top down perspective, who can turn left and right, always moving straight downhill. The player tries to navigate between flags to reach the end of the hill. There is a time penalty for each flag missed. There are 3 race types: slalom, giant slalom, and downhill. Downhill has a constant path of flags, while slalom and giant slalom have rare flags. If the player hits a tree or bump their run is over. There are 9 levels of difficulty for each run.
title: Ski-Run

description:
Slider is a sliding block puzzle for the VIC-20.

The player tries to slide blocks labelled A - O into alphabetical order on a 4 x 4 block puzzle with 1 square missing. The game records time and number of moves to solve the puzzle.
title: Slider

description:
Snowstorm is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player tries to knock out the pattern shown on the screen by moving a marker about. Snow rains down from above, and then positions itself on the screen. The player loses a life if they hit snow. The player starts with 5 lives. After completing a pattern, a new geometric pattern appears.

sample_screenshots.caption: Lots of Pattern in the Corners
Starting to Complete a New Pattern

title: Snowstorm

description:
Space Adventure is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Control a small ship that moves vertically and fires to the right to destroy all the incoming aliens. The player has 1 minute to kill as many aliens as possible. The player can speed up, which causes aliens to appear more quickly, but also causes them to rapidly disappear off the left of the screen. The faster the player is moving, the move more each destroyed alien is worth. The player loses 1/4 of their score if they hit an alien, and loses 100 points for each alien that passes them.
title: Space Adventure

description:
Space Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

As the pilot of an intergalactic battleship, you have to fight your way through wave after wave of various alien ships.

The player controls a small vessel at the bottom of the screen that moves horizontally and fires vertically. Numerous alien vessels approach from the top. These vessels move side to side, and fire angled and straight shots. The player gains 10, 20, 30, or 40 points depending on the ship destroyed. Progressively faster aliens appear as the game progresses. There are 3 skill levels, and the player has 3 vessels each game.
title: Space Attack

description:
Space Joust is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You are about to embark on a mission to destroy enemy spacecraft which are infiltrating your space zone. You have been chosen by the Commander-in-General of the Space Fleet to single handedly annihilate the entire enemy armada.

Similar to the game Joust, the player controls a green spaceship that can move in all directions, and the player must use thrust to prevent their ship from falling to the ground. Enemy ships can be destroyed by hitting them from above, but player ships can be destroyed the same way. Destroyed alien ships become escape pods which fall to the ground, and can be picked up for bonus points. The player must watch for the lava at the bottom of the screen, and faces a new wave of enemies when the screen is cleared.
title: Space Joust

description:
Space Mouse is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You, as an interstellar Space Mouse, find yourself trapped deep underground on an alien planet. You must weave your way upwards through the cracks in the rocks, avoiding the space cats that dig down. The Space Mouse can move left, right, and upwards through cracks. If the mouse collects a super cheese, they gain enough energy to burrow through solid rock for a short time. As the mouse moves higher, space cats approaches faster. The player starts with 7 lives, and has limited oxygen to travel as far as possible per life.

sample_screenshots.caption: Climbing to a More Difficult Area

title: Space Mouse

description:
Space Shuttle is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You are busy having an exciting game of ludo in a space station orbiting the moon, when suddenly you are informed that a bunch of psychopathic scientists have gotten themselves into a mess down on the lunar surface. It is your job to rescue them.

The player controls a shuttle that is launched from the space station at the top of the screen down to the lunar surface. The player must avoid the meteorite belt, large horizontally moving rocks, and safely land on the surface. A scientist is loaded onto the rescue ship, and the player must return to the station, once again avoiding meteors. After all scientists are collected, the player advances to a stage with faster moving space rocks. The player has 3 lives, and a life is lost every meteor hit.
title: Space Shuttle

description:
Spacesnake is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a space snake by moving it up and down, while satellites rapidly move towards the player. Game play is divided into 2 parts. First, the snake must navigate through a field of satellites, and loses a life if it hits one or navigates off the screen. After a short time, the snake reaches a grotto of tight twisty tunnels. The snake must avoid walls while collecting eggs an the base of the tunnel. After collecting 5 eggs, the player enters a new asteroid field.
title: Spacesnake

description:
Space Swarm is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a space ship that moves laterally and fires directly forwards. The player encounters a number of enemy vessel swarms, and must survive for 99 time unit to advance to the next stage. The player first encounters sky skaters, galags, and then dodgers, which fire towards the player while moving in circles towards the player. The player then encounters fireballs, which rapidly streak towards the player. Finally meteors are encountered, which streak across the screen at an angle. It's game over after losing 3 ships.
title: Space Swarm

description:
Space Travel is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Travelling through space, you are set on by hordes of space birds. Your mission is to destroy as many of these as you can. The player controls a large ship at the bottom of the screen that moves horizontally and fires vertically. Enemy ships move straight down and fire straight forwards and on 45 degree angles. If you survive and manage to travel 3,000 km you warp to a new sector, where more space birds faster than the others will attack. The player starts with 3 lives, and it's game over after 3 hits.
title: Space Travel

description:
Space Zap is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You are the gunner of a Federation laser satellite, which houses a very important alien ally in the galactic wars. Your satellite is now under attack by evil extraterrestrials, and you must defend its occupant to the death.

The player's satellite can fire in 8 directions, and must rapidly rotate the turret to fire in one direction. The player is also armed with a limited number of high energy superzappers, which can destroy all enemies on the screen. Superzappers require 200 units of energy per firing. Alien saucers fly onto the screen, and the player must blast them before the station is destroyed.
title: Space Zap

description:
Spectre is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Explore a haunted mansion to gather treasure while avoiding dangerous creatures. The player controls a small character who moves about the rooms of the mansion, and can move to higher or lower levels by using the staircases. Each move costs 1 energy unit, and moving between floors uses 100 energy units. A reenergizer found in the corner of the basement recharges the player's power. Each level has a candelabra worth £1000, and somewhere on the 4 levels is a goblet worth £5000 - 10,000. Caskets worth £500 are found randomly throughout the mansion. The player can safely leave the mansion after collection the goblet and all candelabras. Wells are found randomly throughout the 4 levels, and it's game over falling into one of these. The player loses a life if they touch a monster, and they start with 3 lives.
title: Spectre

description:
Splatman is a 1-player arcade game by the VIC-20.

The player controls a flying bridge that can move in the cardinal directions. Men attempt to cross a series of platforms with gaps, and the player must position their bridge into these gaps to allow safe passage. The men will fall to their death if no bridge is present. Ten points are awarded for each safe crossing, and it's game over after 10 deaths.
title: Splatman

description:
Star Command is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You're patrolling the Lake Erie grid with with your Laser Attack Car. Killer bow ties and dreaded monster tie clasps flash over the horizon at lightning speed. Only you stand between the idiotic-looking but evil invaders, and their prey; fragile, vulnerable Cleveland.

The player controls a vehicle that moves laterally across the bottom of the screen. The vehicle fires vertically, and a crosshair determines the distance of the laser blast. Bow ties swoop into the screen for a split second before disappearing, and the goal is to blast these out of the sky. The player scores 100 points per hit, and the goal is to score as many hits as possible during the timed game.
title: Star Command

description:
Star Wars is an arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player attempts to shoot a TIE fighter by maneuvering the enemy vessel to the center of the screen where it can be blasted with lasers. The player has 60 seconds to destroy as many enemy vessels as possible.
title: Star Wars

description:
Starbase is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

A team of scientists are working hard to prepare Planet XA2 for colonization. A strong alien force intent on capturing and enslaving these men has invaded the planet's atmosphere. As commander of the emergency force dispatched to the area, you must guard the scientists by patrolling each quadrant of the planet and destroying the attack waves of alien ships.

Sixteen scientists run about the bottom of the screen. Thirty two enemy ships appear from a distance, and when they get close, if they appear above a scientist, they will use a tractor beam to abduct the researcher. The player controls a crosshair that will destroy enemy ships if moved over the alien vessel. Gameplay occurs on a horizontally scrolling screen which incorporates 4 quadrants, and the location of scientists and enemy vessels are displayed. If the crosshair moves over a red deflector shield the player can not attack for several seconds. A level is cleared if all alien vessels are destroyed before all scientists are lost. Bonus points are awarded for remaining scientists.
title: Starbase

description:
Stop Thief is a 1-player memory game for the VIC-20.

You witnessed a robbery at the Westland Bank. You caught a glimpse of the robber, and must help the police. The player is briefly shown a picture of the culprit. The player must choose the correct facial features from a number of menus to correctly identify them. The player can choose to be shown additional clues as the puzzle progresses. There are 4 skill levels, which affect how long and often the robber is shown.
title: Stop Thief

description:
Strategic Advance is a simplified 1-player chess game.

Played on a 5 x 5 board, each player has 5 footmen and 2 horsemen. Footmen move similar to the pawns of chess, and can move 1 square forwards or 2 squares on their first move. They can take opponents on an angle. If they reach the far row they become a horseman, or if the player already has 2 horsemen, get a free move to anywhere on the board. Horsemen move like the knights in chess. Moves occur simultaneously, and 2 pieces of equal value are removed if they land on the same square. Otherwise, a horseman will remove a footman. The first player to take their opponent's footmen is the winner. There are 3 computer skill levels.
title: Strategic Advance

description:
Super Breakout is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a horizontally moving paddle at the bottom of the screen, and attempts to deflect a bouncing ball to break the layers of bricks at the top of the screen. If a ball is missed, the player loses a ball. On easier difficulty levels there are small barriers at the bottom of the screen which allow the player to sometimes safely miss a ball. Game speed increases as the game progresses, and there are 3 difficulty levels.
title: Super Breakout

description:
Super Worm is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player competes against the computer, where the opponents direct a snake with a steadily elongating tail. The goal is to trap their opponent in a position so they run into an obstacle. The worm can be directed left or right, and there can be hazards, segmented, or invisible tails. There are 9 levels of difficulty.
title: Super Worm

description:
Superchomper is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small chomping character that moves in the cardinal directions. As the chomper moves about, numbers, bricks, and other items appear on the screen. The chomper continuously moves faster as the level progresses. If the chomper hits a brick or a yellow key, it's game over. Numbers continuously get higher, and the final score is based upon how high of a number is consumed before hitting an object.
title: Superchomper

description:
Supertanker is a 1-player puzzle game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a supertanker that moves through a single screen water-filled maze from a top down perspective. Contained within are 3 flags and a number of fires. The goal is to reach all 3 flags in a minimal amount of time. Fires can be removed and broken spaces can be traversed by using the joystick button first.
title: Supertanker

description:
Tank Battle is a 2-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Each player controls a tank in a maze that can rotate left, right, move forwards, and fire. Players can shoot and destroy parts of the maze. Each player starts with 10 tanks, and the first to hit their opponent 10 times is the winner.
title: Tank Battle

description:
Ten Pins Bowl is a 1 - 2 player bowling game for the VIC-20.

A bowling ball at the left of the screen oscillates up and down, and the player must select the correct time to release it towards 10 pins at the right of the screen. If the player can knock out all 10 pins in 3 balls, they receive a strike and are awarded an additional 10 points. Game plays over 10 frames, and there are 3 levels of difficulty which control ball speed.
title: Ten Pins Bowl

description:
Terminal Invaders is an arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small ship that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires forwards. Alien invaders march back and forth, and each time they reach the end of the screen they drop one row closer to the bottom. Shoot them all to move to the next harder level. If any aliens reach the bottom of the screen it's game over. A flying saucer intermittently moves across the screen for bonus points. Three shields offer protection from alien fire, but also block the player's shots. The player begins with 3 lives.
title: Terminal Invaders

description:
The 'O' Level Caper is a 1-player arcade and text adventure combination for the VIC-20.

Contains two separate games spread over 2 cassettes with a text adventure and arcade component.

In the arcade component, the player controls a character who moves laterally, jumps, and climbs ladders between platforms. The player must avoid or jump over barrels thrown from above that roll along platforms and down ladders. The goal is to collect all items present on the platform while avoiding dangers. The player has 3 lives, and proceeds to a more difficult level when all items are collected. After completing the first level, the player receives a pass code needed to play the text adventure.

In the text adventure component, the player tries to invade the local university. Multiple rooms of the university offer puzzles for the player to solve. The player can pick up and use items, and has limited inventory. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save/restore feature.
title: The 'O' Level Caper

description: An alien race known as the Vortenians have taken a keen interest on Mars, specifically the ten atomic power plants on its surface, which they need to destroy the space/time continuum. As the commander of a fleet of destroyers, your job is to go along a horizontally-scrolling landscape and prevent this from happening. To make sure you don't succeed in your mission, they will release an army of followers, including Androids, Super-Androids, Spidercrafts, and Magnetrons. Each one of these aliens have their own attack pattern, and are gradually introduced throughout the game's five levels. A small radar is provided at the top of the screen to keep track of the aliens. If you make contact with any alien or its projectiles, you lose one of your three lives, and losing all of them means the game is over.
title: Time Destroyers

description:
Tornado is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The Red Planet slips beneath the ship's gleaming hull. Behind, dust is kicked into the thin air from which it falls at an unnaturally fast rate. The ship is Tornado, a craft specially designed for use over the Red Planet able to maneuver fast and effectively in the thin atmosphere. Since the start of the Colony Wars, ships such as these have been patrolling outlying areas and in some cases have had to destroy war-like clans which still held to the old ways of separation and destruction. Now the end of the Colony Wars is in sight, a final pocket of seething hate has been located, and is about to be eradicated,

The player controls a small ship that moves vertically, and fires horizontally to the right and drops bombs. Incoming Martian infrastructure and terrain scrolls from the right. The player must dodge incoming rockets while trying to destroy as much alien infrastructure as possible for bonus points. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Tornado

description:
Trains is a 1-player puzzle game for the VIC-20.

Played on a large track with multiple railroad switches, the object of the game is to have the train cover all of the track without striking the railroad shed at the bottom right of the screen or have the train pass over a switch that directs it off the track. Originally all track is red, but becomes highlighted green as the train passes over. Each level completed adds one more train to the track up to 10 trains at a time, and if 2 trains collide it's game over.
title: Trains

description:
Trap is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The foundations of a wall have been laid, and you are trapped on the wrong side on the brick work. There is only one gap left through which you can get away. As you hurry towards the opening, your escape is impeded by the bricks placed in your path. Your only hope is escape to the next frame or the salvation of one of the safety zones.

The player moves in the cardinal directions, and tries to quickly reach the exit point for the room. Random pieces of brickwork appear near the player, and if they're trapped on all 4 sides it's game over. The safety zones will temporarily remove all obstructing bricks. 200 points are awarded for reaching the exit, and 50 points for safety zones. Every 1000 points the game begins to fill faster. There are 5 levels of starting difficulty.
title: Trap

description:
Turbo Grid is a 1-player light cycle game for the VIC-20.

To celebrate the year 3000, the Universal Inter-Galactic Sports Federation has decided to hold an Inter-Stellar Olympics. All galaxies are allowed to put forward one person to represent them. You are selected by computer to represent the Milky Way. The Olympics are based on a knockout basis. The deciding event is the dreaded Turbo Grid, a highly electrified grid capable of disintegrating everything which strays off the non-electrified lines. Can you survive the final duel against the Andromidan Robot.

The player and computer both drive a light cycle on a grid, and can move in the cardinal directions leaving a light trail behind. Competitors can drive off the edge of the screen and appear on the opposite side, and the goal is to force the opponent into one of the trails left by the cycles. The first player to defeat their opponent 10 times is the winner. There are 3 levels of computer difficulty.
title: Turbo Grid

description:
Twister is a 1-player puzzle game for the VIC-20.

The player starts with columns of similar colored blocks, with the grid ranging from 3 x 3 - 10 x 10. The player can rotate 2 x 2 sections of the grid in a clockwise pattern. The goal is to ensure all columns and rows contain blocks of different color.
title: Twister

description:
Ultimate Tank is a 1- 2 player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The year is 1999. Earth is being overrun by mutant spiders and giant space eyes. In an attempt to confine the movement of these creatures, the Earth has been divided into battle zones which are enclosed in impenetrable force fields. Each battle zone is patrolled by 1 or 2 nuclear tanks. Their mission is to search out and destroy the aliens which invade their battle zone.

Each battle zone is a 22 x 22 grid enclosed by a boundary. The tank can rotate left and right, move or fire forwards, and can lay mines. The tank has limited energy, and may recharge by picking up energy cells if their energy is less than 40. The player must avoid atomic mines, craters, trees, and mountains. Points are awarded by destroying spiders and space eyes. Space eyes are created when spiders enter a square containing an energy cell.
title: Ultimate Tank

description:
VIC Attack! with Breakout are two arcade games for the VIC-20.

In VIC Attack! the player controls a small ship that moves vertically at the left side of the screen and fires to the right. Asteroids and enemy vessels approach, and the player must avoid or destroy them. Every 1000 points the player advances to a more difficult stage. The player starts with 3 lives.

Breakout is a VIC-20 variant of the arcade game, where the player controls a paddle and must bounce a ball to destroy blocks.

sample_screenshots.caption: My Barriers are Blown Away and Incoming Aliens

title: VIC Attack! with Breakout

description:
VIC Bowling is a 1-player bowling game for the VIC-20.

The numbers 1 - 7 are present in 2 columns at the left of the screen, and the player selects a 1st and 2nd number to set the start and direction of their bowling ball. The player has 2 balls per frame, and there are a total of 10 frames.
title: VIC Bowling

description:
VIC Rescue is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20

Your mission is to rescue the 6 stranded people on the planet's surface and return them to the orbital station. The orbital station moves slowly across the top of the screen, and the player must choose the correct time to release their landing module to try to sneak through a field of horizontally moving asteroids and land on one of the 2 flat landing pads below. These pads become smaller with each use. The player has limited fuel to slow their descent, which is used throughout all 6 rescue attempts.

After loading a victim, the player tries to return to the orbital station. At this time the asteroids become enemy ships. The player has the chance to shoot and destroy these, and must reach the opening of the orbital station. This sequence repeats until all rescues are complete or the player loses 3 ships.
title: VIC Rescue

description:
Vic Trek is a Star Trek variant for the VIC-20.

The player controls the U.S.S. Enterprise as it tries to rid the galaxy of Klingon vessels. The galaxy is divided into 5 x 8 quadrants each measuring 15 x 16. Interspersed within these areas are Klingon vessels, stars, planets, and bases. You as the player can use impulse or warp engines to move by providing the angle from 0 - 360 degrees and the power. The player is armed with a limited number of deadly torpedoes, and also phaser weapons which use up the overall ship energy. Hits from Klingon vessels can further reduce ship energy. Ship energy and torpedoes can be replenished at star bases. Activities cost time, and the goal is to end the Klingon menace at the lowest star date.
title: Vic Trek

description:
Vicvader is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small ship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires forwards. The goal is to earn points by shooting aliens before they reach the bottom of the screen. The aliens march back and forth, and each time they reach the edge of the screen they will drop one row closer to the bottom. Aliens intermittently return fire. Shoot them all to move to the next harder level. If any aliens reach the bottom of the screen it's game over. A flying saucer intermittently moves across the top of the screen for bonus points. Three shields offer protection from alien fire, but also block the player's shots. The player begins with 3 cannons.
title: Vicvader

description:
Victrek is a Star Trek variant for the VIC-20.

The player has a total of 20 minutes to destroy all dangerous Klingon vessels in the galaxy. The Enterprise is armed with a limited number of torpedoes and phasers which utilize the ship's energy. Enemy ships can only be fired upon when the Enterprise occupies the same location. The player can use their galactic map to scan distant sectors to locate Klingon ships and friendly bases. Short range scanners provide the location of objects within the sector. Hyperwarp allows transfer between sectors and impulse engines move the ship within sectors. Movement commands are given by submitting x and y coordinates. Star bases provide refueling and replenishment of torpedoes.
title: Victrek

description:
Vikman is a Pac-Man clone for the VIC-20.

The player moves about a maze trying to eat all the pellets. Ghosts chase the player who loses a life if caught. The player can choose from 1 - 3 ghosts. Power pellets in the corners of the maze make the ghosts temporarily vulnerable.
title: Vikman

description:
Villain is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Today's life of crime isn't all high living and a villa in Brazil you know. These days a crook has to be in top physical shape to escape from the fuzz, especially around Pinner Way where P. C. Plod has his beat. Recently, he's become a real pain. He always seems to be able to keep up with you, however fast you run. He's making a life of crime sheer hard work.

To escape P. C. Plod, the player must rapidly move their joystick left and right. The player can also jump, throw vacuums, or throw diamonds. At the start of each job, the player has a training session where they have 3 attempts to complete a 200 yard dash in the displayed time frame. This section can be skipped if deemed too difficult. During the actual theft, the player must stay ahead of P. C. Plod for 1000 yards. While doing this, they must jump over or use their vacuum on objects to clear their path. If the player hits an obstacle or is caught by P. C. Plod, they lose a life.

The player can jump to grab treasure. If they jump and grab a bomb, they are temporarily filled with adrenaline and can run faster and jump higher. If the player accidentally grabs an alarm bell, surveillance floaters known as Big Eyes appear. These can be removed by throwing diamonds. Master Big Eyes resistant to diamonds appear after level 10.

sample_screenshots.caption: Job 2 has Obstacles to Jump Over

title: Villain

description:
Whirlwind One Five is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Vital equipment is needed by your allies in order to stop the enemy missiles that are continually attacking your base. This equipment has to be loaded onto your helicopter in daylight and dropped over a target area. Game play is divided into 3 phases.

In Phase 1, the player must take off and defend their fuel lines from enemy missiles. The player takes off from the landing pad, and can move in the cardinal directions to shoot down incoming missiles from the left. Each missile that passes by the player costs 20 fuel. If the player is hit by a missile it's game over.

In Phase 2, the enemy begins to drop parachute mines directly onto your supply lines. The player controls a gun that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen. You must protect your helicopter's fueling by shooting the incoming mines. Each missed mine costs 5 fuel, and if all fuel is lost or the gun is hit by a mine it's game over.

In Phase 3, the player must successfully make the cargo drop with their helicopter while defending from enemy missiles, and return safely to base.
title: Whirlwind One Five

description:
Whodunnit? is a 1 - 6 player strategy game for the VIC-20.

It is 7:15 PM, and 12 guests have come together for drinks at Murder Manor. However, one of them has more than drinks on their mind. You are Inspector Hard of the Yard. Your task is to find the murderer of the victim who was discovered at Murder Manor last night.

The game contains a cast of 12 characters, and 1 - 6 players can be detectives. Each detective can have 200, 400, 600, or 800 action points to solve the mystery. Every question asked of witnesses costs 2 points. The detectives take turns interviewing the 11 remaining guests, and can ask where they were at a specific time, who they saw at that time, what weapons they may have seen, and ask about what motives different characters may have had for murder. When the player thinks they know the culprit they can try to solve the crime and come up with a guilty or innocent verdict.
title: Whodunnit?

description:
Wolfpack is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a submarine that tries to defend from another underwater vehicle as well as destroy a large surface vessel. There are 9 skill levels. The submarine can shoot in the cardinal directions. The underwater vessel moves continuously towards the player from the top left corner and must be repeatedly destroyed, but does not provide points. The large surface vessel releases depth charges deep into the ocean, and awards 200 points when destroyed. The player has 3 submarines per game.
title: Wolfpack

description:
Woodworm Whacker is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player and woodworms move through a series of passageways. The woodworms move about randomly and occasionally fire forwards. The player can fire forwards, and their shots continue to bounce back and forth until they hit an enemy. Only 2 friendly shots are allowed on the screen at a time, and the player can lose a life from enemy or friendly fire. When all enemies are defeated, the player moves to the next level containing an additional enemy. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Woodworm Whacker

description:
Xerus is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small vessel that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically upwards. Enemy space vessels move towards the bottom of the screen while zigzagging left and right, and firing at the player. When an enemy vessel hits the bottom of the screen it creates a bomb and explodes. If the player is hit by enemy fire or the resulting explosion they lose a life. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Xerus

description:
Zok's Kingdom is a 1-player adventure game with arcade elements.

Your starship is being piloted through an uncharted quadrant of the galaxy when it encounters a meteor storm. It is forced to crash land on the nearest planet. Zok, a cunning relative of Dracula, is a cunning and harsh ruler. On your travels, you stumble across Zok's castle. Tired and hungry, the open gates look inviting.

The player controls a character that moves in the cardinal directions, and navigates a number of rooms with transporters between them. The player must avoid enemies, and can pick up items including: keys, shields, or weapons. These items can be used at different locations. Signs and posters can provide clues for the player. Numerous dangers including: moats, electrical panels, and deep pits can cost the player their life. The goal is ultimately to defeat Zok.
title: Zok's Kingdom

description:
Zor is a 1-player strategy game for the VIC-20.

You are on this remote and barren planet to do battle with a Champion of Zor, to try to demonstrate Earth's supremacy in robotic war gaming. You and your opponent are equally energized for battle with 2500 megajoule units of energy. You are each armed with 2 proton missiles and 4 neutron shells which are self-energized, and can be used for long-range attacks. The player is also armed with short-range offensive weapon, including plasma bolts, laser cannons, and disruptor beams. These use energy from the starting power source.

When the player receives attack from the enemy, they must set a shield level from 0 - 9. If the attack penetrates the shield, a secondary shield activates to absorb the blow, but this shield uses considerable energy. When the player runs out of energy they will receive a fatal blow. The player and computer take turns firing in combat, while the enemy fires and approaches the player. Battle occurs until one player runs out of energy and is destroyed.
title: Zor

description:
Cosmic Snake is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a spaceship that moves in all directions at the bottom portion of the screen. The ship fires directly forwards, and tries to destroy the cosmic snakes that stream from the top of both sides of the play area. Snakes move horizontally, and when they hit an obstacle, they reverse direction and move down 1 row. They further break into smaller pieces when hit by player fire. A UFO intermittently moves across the top of the screen, and fires towards the player while leaving obstacles on the screen. These obstacles can be destroyed after receiving several hits from the player. The player must avoid another enemy that moves about the bottom of the screen. The player starts with 3 lives, and advances to a new level when all snake components are destroyed
title: Cosmic Snake

description:
Clear-Round is an arcade show jumping game for the VIC-20.

Played from a side perspective, the player tries to control their horse as they make 6 runs across a field of equestrian jumping obstacles. The player controls their horse to run faster or slower, and the player must have the correct speed to safely pass each obstacle, otherwise the horse will either falter or refuse to jump. The game records the total time and number of faults required to complete the 6 runs.
title: Clear-Round

description:
Deathstar is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Many people have tried to destroy the huge Deathstar, but no one has yet managed to pass through the four waves of enemy forces.

The goal is to travel through a vertically scrolling field of enemy vessels by dodging left and right to avoid a collision with the enemies. There are 4 stages with progressively wider and more dangerous enemy vessels. The goal is to survive through the entire field, but if the player hits an enemy they must start from the beginning. The player has 3 lives to pass all 4 stages to reach and destroy the Deathstar.
title: Deathstar

description:
Defuze is a 1-player action game for the VIC-20.

Sitting behind the controls of your armoured tractor, you are faced with a daunting task. Defuse 9 unstable reactors in the correct sequence before your time runs out. The correct reactor will be seen blinking, and is defused by running over it. As a reactor is defused, the next one begins to blink. To further complicate matters, as you move you leave behind a trail of radioactive dust. Cross this, and your tractor is destroyed. The tractor is armed with a compressed air cannon which can be used to clear the dust in front of the tractor 3 times on each level. Each level has a shorter time limit than the next.
title: Defuze

description:
Griddion is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small character that moves about a maze trying to collect dots. They are chased by several monsters that move towards the player. There is a power dot in each of the 4 corners which temporarily make the monsters vulnerable. When all dots are collected the player moves to the next level with faster moving enemies.
title: Griddion

description:
Hangman is a word game for the VIC-20.

Each player takes turns submitting a word or phrase, while the other player tries to guess it by choosing individual letters. Each incorrect letter costs the player a piece of the hangman, and after 10 incorrect guesses they are hung. Previously used incorrect letters are displayed at the bottom of the screen, and there is no penalty for guessing previously used letters.
title: Hangman

description:
Hotline is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You have just landed a job as the switch-board operator at the busy offices of VICTAPE. In order to answer a call you merely need to press the number which corresponds to which of the 9 phones that has a pending call. Calls clear automatically when finished, and every successful call collects valuable revenue. Money is lost if the player takes too long to answer or connects to the wrong number. You're fired if your earnings are too low.
title: Hotline

description:
Hunter is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

In a galaxy far away, you are in command of a deep-space fighter. Your job is to destroy the advance scouts of the enemy attack fleet before they reach Earth's defences. You controls a crosshair, and attempt to line up a moving enemy vessel to shoot and destroy them. Your fighter has a limited fuel supply, but it is recharged from the plasma cloud which follows the destruction of an enemy ship. The quicker you can destroy enemy vessels the more enemy ships you can destroy.
title: Hunter

description:
Interlox is a computer board game based upon Noughts & Crosses.

Played on four interlocking squares simultaneously, the goal is to place pieces on a board to align 3-in-a-row either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally, while preventing the opponent from doing the same. Pieces are placed by pressing the button corresponding to the board position. In a 2-player game, the player with the most runs of 3 after all positions are filled is the winner. Versus the computer, the goal is to prevent them from getting a run of 3 while trying to maximize player runs of 3.
title: Interlox

description:
Lurker is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Deep in the dark, dank caves of Vicsyllvania , guarded by a fearsome Lurker lies the fabled Crock-o-Gold. Your mission is to try to wrest the gold from the Lurker's clammy clutches, and drop it into your loot box. Each successful trip increases the score by 10 points.

The lurker moves randomly about the dungeon, and can only see up, down, right, and left, but not diagonally or through walls. If the Lurker sees the player, it will pursue them relentlessly, and if he catches them it'll be the end of their life.
title: Lurker

description:
Morris and the Computer Factory is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Morris's goal in the computer factory is to reach the VIC-CPU at the top of the screen. Morris can move up and down, and must navigate the spaces between the items on multiple horizontally moving conveyor belts. Morris moves along with the items, and loses a life if moved onto an occupied space. The player gains 10 points every safe trip, and starts with 3 lives.
title: Morris and the Computer Factory

description:
Pennies from Heaven is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Have you ever thought who fills the crock of gold that can be found at the end of the rainbow? Well, it's said to be filled by a lone leprechaun who after the sun has set can change all the rain drops he catches into coins of gold. Well, it's almost dark, and they forecast rain.

The player controls the leprechaun with a wheelbarrow, and moves laterally at the bottom of the screen. Coins fall from the sky, and the goal is to position the wheelbarrow to catch each coin. Each coin gains a point, but each missed coin costs a point. If the player drops below 0 it's game over. Every 15 coins caught causes the rate of coin fall to increase. The final score is based upon the number of caught coins.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Lot of Coins to Catch

title: Pennies from Heaven

description:
Pontoon is a 1-player card game for the VIC-20.

Played against the computer, each player draws cards trying to be the closest to 21 without going over. The player always goes first, and starts with 2 cards. Each turn, the player can choose to stick or twist. Stick stays at the current card count, and twist draws an additional card. If the player reaches 21 or plays 5 cards they automatically win. Face cards are worth 10, and an ace can be 1 or 11. After the player sticks, the computer's first 2 cards are revealed, and the computer draws cards until they surpass the player, go over 21, or play a total of 5 cards. The game progresses until a player wins 10 hands.
title: Pontoon

description:
Pothole Pacer is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Theo D'Lite is a young county surveyor who got the job to map and plot the potholes of Malaya. All went well until one day he found himself lost and at the mercy of the Surveyor Slayer.

The player tries to navigate a maze to reach the pothole at the center of the maze that will take them to safety. The slayer moves continuously towards the player, including through walls, and it's game over if caught. The player receives point for every position moved, and if they reach the exit point.
title: Pothole Pacer

description:
The Sacred Crosses of Hell is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The devil has stolen some sacred crosses, and you must recover them. They are guarded by demons, and the walls are mined.

The player starts at the bottom of the screen, and must navigate a series of hallways patrolled by large demons. If the player touches a demon or a wall they lose a life. The goal is to reach the top of the screen 4 times to gather all 4 crosses. After which, the player starts a new level with faster moving demons. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: The Sacred Crosses of Hell

description:
Slalom is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a character who can move left, right, or straight, as they try to slalom between flags going down a hill. If the player hits a tree it's game over. The goal is to reach the finish line.
title: Slalom

description:
Spaze Battle is a 1-player side scrolling arcade game for the VIC-20.

The sequel to White Line Warrior, the evil forces of the Imperial Fleet are on their way to Earth with the avowed intent of subduing its people into slavery. You must ride your Spaze Chariot against the Imperial Fleet once again.

The player controls a small ship that rapidly flies towards the right through a tunnel, and can move up and down. The player encounters Axel Fighters and every 5th ship is a Mother Ship. The Axel fighters must be avoided, but the Mother Ships can be rammed for points. The player loses a life if they hit a wall or an Axel Fighter.
title: Spaze Battle

description:
Strim'Em is an adult-themed game for the VIC-20 for 1 - 4 player or teams.

Each player is represented by a cartoon character on the screen of the appropriate sex. Each player starts with 6 points, each of which corresponds to a piece of clothing. Each turn, each player is asked to bid 1 point to the maximum number of pieces of clothing they have remaining. One of the 4 players is randomly chosen, and the winning player receives that many points or pieces of clothing up to 6, while the other players lose their bid. If all clothes are lost, a forfeit must be paid.
title: Strip'Em

description:
Swarm is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20

The player controls a spider that moves in the cardinal directions. The goal is to eat the flies while avoiding getting struck my randomly moving bees. Every fly eaten increases the score by a point. Get stung 3 times it's game over.
title: Swarm

description:
Test Match is a 2-player cricket game for the VIC-20.

Each player creates a team name, but the computer always take the fielding side while the players control the batsmen. The keys F1-F7 control the strike made by the player from a defensive stroke to a wild slog. If the computer fails to press a button during the bowl they can be caught out behind. Defensive swings are unlikely to score points, and powerful swings may score more runs, but are more likely to get out. Each bowl and hit are graphically displayed on the screen. Each inning lasts 40 overs, and the score board can be viewed at the end of each over.
title: Test Match

description:
The Vegas Gambler is a slot machine game for the VIC-20.

Each play on the slot machine costs 1 coin, and the player starts with 25 coins. There are multiple ways to win, but only the central row can provide winners. If the player wins 1 coin, they can choose to collect or gamble a higher win, but risk losing everything. At internals, the player gets a second spin, and can chose to hold 1 or 2 of the columns. Game is over if the player loses all coins or breaks the bank.
title: The Vegas Gambler

description:
White Line Warrior is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You are Obi Wan Wyatt, and just received a message from Astroscan Intelligence that long range scanners detected a large fleet of Red Line Axel Fighters of the Imperial Fleet approaching. Computer analysis of their current course indicates their target is Earth. They will try to obtain the sub-atomic "Spaze" area at the Earth's core. Only the sub-atomic White Line Warriors can stop the invasion.

The player controls a small line on the screen that moves in the cardinal directions. The goal is to move the line as long as possible without hitting the edge of the screen or other lines. The longer the line grows, the more points the player scores. If the line grows long enough, the player advances to a new level with a faster moving line.
title: White Line Warrior

description:
Alien Vortex is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

It is the 23rd Century and, due to the tremendous advances made in robot technology, unemployment is running at 99.9%. To relieve the incredible boredom, the Interstellar Ruling Supreme Council has set up huge gambling arcades where fortunes can be won or lost and, due to 300% inflation, money has been replaced by credit discs.

From time to time, people run up an outstanding debt, and as a way of providing an alternative to concrete ankle socks, the State Cultural Protectors devised "The Game". Inhabitants with no means of repaying their huge debt are allowed to "gamble" their lives. They are transported to Launch Base 3, and sealed into a Zelton 3 Earth Defender and attacked by waves of mutant birds by crossing llama with pelicans.

The player controls a small vessel that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen, and fires vertically forwards. Waves of enemy vessels appear, and move rapidly about the screen to fire at the player. The player must destroy these vessels or allow them to fly off the bottom of the screen. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Alien Vortex

description:
Alien Hunter is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Eliminate all alien drones in your sector of space by blasting them with laser bolts fired from your ship. The player's ship can move in the cardinal directions, and has limited fuel to blast the green aliens that appear. Green aliens move to a new location on the field every few seconds, so must be destroyed quickly. The player must shoot or avoid the purple enemies that appear. The player starts with 500 fuel, and fuel rapidly depletes. The player restores 100 fuel every several green enemies shot. There are 9 levels of starting difficulty, which control fuel depletion and how long an enemy stays in one place.

The game ends when the player hits 3 enemies or runs out of fuel.
title: Alien Hunter

description:
Android Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You must defend your city from android attack. The player's ship can rotate left and right, and move and fire forwards. Allows up to 5 missiles on the screen at a time. Enemy androids move about at the top of the screen, and bombs drop towards the ground below. The goal is to shoot and destroy these dangers before they reach and demolish the city at the bottom of the screen. Retreating androids may drop bombs, and an android that reaches the city causes an indestructible bomb to be dropped from the android's giant star cruiser. The game is over when all buildings are destroyed. The player starts with 3 ships, and a new ship is awarded every 10,000 points.

sample_screenshots.caption: Many of my Buildings are on Fire

title: Android Attack

description:
Double Trouble is a 1- 2 player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Two human opponents or the player versus computer. Players must deflect their ball into fruit-like objects for points, while trying to avoid "Schizophrenic Spike" who roams the play area. As the player's ball is bounced around the screen, they can place bumpers that rotate the trajectory clockwise, counterclockwise, or 180 degrees to collect points. Spike places a number of dangers on the screen to be avoided.
title: Double Trouble

description:
Bugsy is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player moves about a large grid trying to collect all the yellow mines before 99 time units run out. Each time a yellow mine is collected another one appears on the screen, and each collected mine supplies about 10 more time units on the clock. Purple mines can be collected for bonus points and time. Each square becomes impassable after being moved on. A yellow bug moves randomly about the screen and can kill the player, but also restores some squares to passable. Red mines must be avoided. The player starts with 3 lives, and each level of difficulty requires more mines to collect.
title: Bugsy

description:
Diamond Hunt is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a character who moves in all directions, and tries to gather all the diamonds on a level and reach the exit hole. The player must avoid the monsters who continuously chase after the player. Each level the monsters move faster. The number of diamonds collected is displayed after each level is completed.
title: Diamond Hunt

description:
Mysterious Island is a series of arcade games for the VIC-20.

You have escaped from prison in a hot air balloon, which has descended to a small inhospitable island. Game play consists of numerous arcade segments, riddles, math puzzles, and exploring a large island.

The game starts with a balloon descent, where the player must try to gather energy modules and land on the small island at the bottom of the screen while avoiding dangerous birds and crashing into the ocean below. Any mistake leads to death and game over.

After arriving on the island, the player can move about and search for treasures. Each treasure chest presents the player with a math problem, where they must input the 5th digit in a sequence. Items and coins are awarded with successful completion of a puzzle. Some treasure chests contain a word puzzle which must be solved to receive the treasure. If the player is incorrect on the number sequence or the word puzzle, they're sent to The Hive, which is a series of dark tunnels that must be escaped to reach the exit.

While exploring the island, the player is engaged by giant crabs. In this arcade sequence, the player must reach the exit point while avoiding all of the slow moving crabs that move towards the player.

The player has limited energy, and when this runs low they enter an arcade sequence where they try to catch energy drops in a moving cup as it floats by at the top of the screen. The player dies if they fail to keep adequate energy. When entering caves, the player enters an arcade sequence of a mosaic floor where they try to find clues hidden under tiles.

The ultimate goal is to find the Nautilus and escape from the island. For this, the player must move through a maze of moving laser beams, and then answer a number of questions about the vessel. Finally, they can escape from the island via a series of tight passageways.

sample_screenshots.caption: Try to Collect all the Coins

title: Mysterious Island

description:
Omnitron is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The year is 2052, and man has created a race of indestructible robots. These omnitron robots are attempting to rule the world, and it is up to you to stop them.

The player and one or more omnitron drones move about the field looking to collect enertron crystals. If the omnitron drone contacts a crystal it electrifies the playing field, killing the player. If the player contacts a drone or a green nuclear explosive device, they also lose a life. These nuclear devices continue to appear on the screen, and the player must survive 45 seconds to advance to the next stage. If the player stays in one place too long, the omnitron sentinel appears, which chases the player and is very difficult to avoid. Each level has more or faster moving drones, and the player starts with 3 lives.
title: Omnitron

description:
Realms of Quest is a role playing game for the VIC-20.

The four pieces of the Infinity Amulet have been stolen by the evil archmage Nikaedor, and scattered them in the Dungeon of Doom. Your mission is to find the 4 pieces of the amulet and destroy the evil archmage.

Played from a top-down perspective, the player explores a number of dungeon passageways fighting monsters. The player roles a character at the beginning with random strength, dexterity, constitution, intelligence, wisdom, and charisma. The player can visit town to train their character, purchase swords, armor, shields, or scrolls, and save their game in progress.

The player engages in combat with monsters, and can use a variety of scrolls to assist with their quest and combat.
title: Realms of Quest

description:
Realms of Quest II is a role playing game for the VIC-20.

The sequel to the original Realms of Quest, the player once again must create a character and explore the fantasy world to defeat the wizard Nikaedor.

Characters are automatically created on a new game with a random roll of strength, dexterity, constitution, intelligence, wisdom, and charisma. Played from a top-down perspective, the player explores an overworld featuring a castle, dungeons, and forests. At the castle, the player can restore health, and gain a level if sufficiently experienced. Level gains bring higher hit points and mana points.

Random combats appear in and outside of dungeons, and the player can attack or run each turn. Monsters become more difficult further from the castle or deeper underground. The player can find healing potions and orbs to aid them on their quest.
title: Realms of Quest II

description:
Realms of Quest III is an RPG for the VIC-20.

It has been a thousand years since the great bards had written the epic poem telling the legend of a hero who had slain the demon wizard, Nikaedor. The hero, though mortally wounded, shouted a final cry of victory: “Hark! The Evil Wizard and his Eternal Orb no longer hold dominion over this land”.

And now, bandits, orcs, highwaymen and all sorts of vile creatures have gotten bolder. Where they roamed before as mere nuisance, they now dare more often, and even well armed escorts are no longer safe from their attacks. They wander from their wilderness and abandoned ruins of the Land of Rivar to threaten cities within its borders. Sanctuary can no longer be guaranteed. Even dragons have begun to appear, reducing whole villages to ash.

The King sent forth his finest on a scouting mission to the old ruins of Nikaedor's lair; warriors of unyielding strength and magic wielders of cunning sorcery. After the passing of several moons, their bodies floated in the moat of his great castle. A journal was retrieved from their watery grave. The final entry petrified those with ears to hear it, “Nikaedor has returned. Death to those who fail to pay tribute on this day and forever. Hail Nikaedor!”

The player creates a party of 6 characters in the village surrounding the King's castle. Each character randomly roles 6 attributes: strength, dexterity, intelligence, constitution, wisdom, and charisma, and can pick from 8 races, which allows the character to choose a class. Items and armour can be purchased at the local weapon shop, injured characters healed at the inn, and deceased characters resurrected at the temple.

The player can then explore the overland by foot or purchase a boat to sail the seas. As the party explores the land they also encounter enemy parties. The party can choose to fight, run from, or greet the enemies they meet, and if engaged in combat, each character chooses to fight or cast spells. Enemies are graphically displayed on the screen.

When entering dungeons, game play changes to a first person perspective, where the player must exploring twisting passageways and doors to gather treasure and items.
title: Realms of Quest III

description:
Realms of Quest IV is a role playing game for the VIC-20.

From the northern mountains came forth a sorcerer, a magician of such evil power as to tame all manners of men and beast. He bore the name Nikaedor, and no longer did men call out to the gods. For they now called out to only one master; the dark sorcerer of the high mountain, dwelling within his castle Rivaria. But many men were not content, and they gathered their strength and overturned their master, and all those who were under his will in turn were imprisoned in endless dungeons.

Time passed, and Nikaedor attempted many a times to rise, but was once again put to rest. The reign of the fairer creatures above the earth are endlessly threatened, and thus your quest is to battle the labyrinth below our feet, and ensure for yet another generation they can live in peace. In the dungeon, lay riches, glory, and the immortality of your name!

The player creates a party of 8 characters in the starting town. Each character randomly rolls 6 attributes: strength, dexterity, intelligence, constitution, wisdom, and charisma, and can pick from 10 races, which allows the character to choose a class. Items and armour can be purchased at the local weapon shop, injured characters healed at the inn, and deceased characters resurrected at the temple.

When entering the dungeons, game play changes to a first person perspective, where the player must exploring twisting passageways and doors to gather treasure and items. As the party explores the crypts they also encounter enemy parties. The party can choose to fight, run from, or greet the enemies they meet, and if engaged in combat, each character chooses to fight or cast spells. Enemies are graphically displayed on the screen.
title: Realms of Quest IV

description:
Ice Hockey is a 1-player sports game for the VIC-20.

The player and computer each control a single skater and a goalie on the ice. The opponents face off at the center of the screen, and one player receives the puck. The skaters can take the puck from each other, and the goal is to score on the net to get a point. Game play is divided into 3 periods.
title: Ice Hockey

description:
The Meteor Zone is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a spaceship that can rotate clockwise, counterclockwise, and can thrust and fire forwards. Hyperspace allows the ship to move randomly about the screen. Meteors move about the screen, which the player can fire upon and break into smaller pieces. UFOs move across the screen. The player moves to a new level after destroying all meteors on the screen. Each level starts with more meteors.
title: The Meteor Zone

description:
Monkey Kong is a 1-player Donkey Kong clone for the VIC-20.

Divided into two sections, the player must defeat the great ape. In the first section, the player must move up a number of platforms. The player must avoid barrels rolled by the ape, and can move left and right, climb ladders, and jump. The goal is to reach the girl at the top of the level. In the second section, the player must avoid flames that move laterally on platforms, while the player tries to step over the 8 platforms to drop the ape into the water below. After completing both sections, the player advances to more difficult stages. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Monkey Kong

description:
Pitfall! is a Pitfall! clone for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small character that can move laterally and jump over obstacles. The player's goal is to move to the right across a variety of screens with dangers including: pits, scorpions, alligators, rolling logs, poison, and swing ropes. Some screens have ladders, which allow the player to travel in caves at the bottom of the screen, or above ground. The player receives 100 points for each green token acquired. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Pitfall!

description:
Ringside Boxing is a 1-player boxing game for the VIC-20.

The player chooses from 64 historical boxers with individualized stats and the number of rounds of the fight from 1 - 20. The boxers move about the ring automatically during the fight, and the player can choose to punch or block. Each boxer's current energy is displayed at the bottom of the screen, and if this drops too low they can suffer a knockout. The final score is displayed at the end of the fight.
title: Ringside Boxing

description:
Ringside Wrestling is a 1-player wrestling game for the VIC-20.

Two wrestlers are stationary in the center of the ring, and can thrown a number of moves including: head kick, knee lift, body slam, airplane spin, suplex, atomic drop, and pile driver. After sufficiently damaging their opponent, they can go for the cover-up and win the match by reaching a count of 3.
title: Ringside Wrestling

description:
Star Wars II is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.
