The player tries to destroy as many alien ships as possible in 2 minutes. Ships appear 1 at a time, and the goal is to use the direction keys to position the enemy within a cross-hair at the center of the screen. Once positioned, they can be destroyed with laser fire. The ship starts with 300 energy, and each shot uses 10 energy. When a ship is destroyed, another takes its place. The game is over when energy is exhausted or 2 minutes have expired.
title: Star Wars II

description:
Vixel: Volume One is 3 programs containing 2 games for the VIC-20.

  • Fire: The player controls a water dropping helicopter that moves laterally at the top of the screen and tries to put out the spreading fire in three buildings. The helicopter can hold 1000 water, and each drop uses 50 water that can put out 2 pieces of fire. The helicopter can refuel at the top of the building at the right of the screen. If the fire is successfully put out the player wins, but if the fire spreads too far the game is lost.
  • Draw: A high-resolution drawing program makes it easy to create pictures on the screen, and then save them on tape.
  • Race: The player controls a car trying to earn points racing around a many lane circular track before the computer's car crashes into you. The player picks up points by passing over dots on the track and, after having passed fifty dots, the computer's car starts laying down diamonds worth five points. The player loses a life if they hit the opponent's car.
title: Vixel: Volume One

description:
Contact is a 2-player variant of the board game Connect Four.

Players take turns dropping blue or white balls into a 7 x 8 grid, where the balls fall to the bottom free space of the grid. The first person to score 4 in a row horizontally, vertically, or diagonally is the winner.
title: Contact

description:
The Derby is a horse betting game for the VIC-20.

The player starts with £100, and can bet on 1 of 6 horses. The races is then shown by animated numbers crossing the screen, and the player doubles their money if they chose the correct horse. The goal is to reach £150. If they hit £1 it's game over.
title: The Derby

description:
Haunted Manor is a text adventure for the VIC-20.

The player must explore a haunted mansion looking for the 10 treasures. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and the player has 3 hours to complete their task or they'll turn into a bat. Numerous items and puzzles are hiding in the manor. An in game help system can guide the player through more difficult puzzles.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save/restore feature.
title: Haunted Manor

description:
Line Up is a computerized version of Connect 4 for the VIC-20.

Two human players take turns dropping a colored token into 8 columns. Token stacks on top of teach other, and the first player to score 4 in a row vertically, horizontally, or diagonally is the winner.
title: Line Up

description:
Moto Race is a vertically scrolling driving game for the VIC-20.

The player moves their car left and right, as they navigate a scrolling road from a top-down perspective that progressively has more cars on it. The player tries to drive as far as possible using their 5 lives.
title: Moto Race

description:
Nemesis is a text adventure for the VIC-20.

An agent of SAA6, your grim boss has just given you your newest assignment. Dr Katz and his daughter Cerra have been kidnapped and taken to Nemesis, located somewhere in the Amazon. Game play is divided into two parts, finding the entrance to Nemesis and then rescuing Cerra and her father. The player must solve a number of puzzles including defending from angry bears and repairing robots.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. A help option provides the player clues to solve puzzles.
title: Nemesis

description:
The Pools Collector is a 1-player strategy game for the VIC-20.

It is Friday night, and you have taken on the pools round of a 36 flat block. There are 6 floors with 6 flats on each. Not all tenants have the pools and few tenants have the right money. The pools have to be in by Saturday morning, so you have one hour to visit every flat. The player can take the elevator to the 6 separate floors, and individually visits doors. The player has a number of £50, 20, 10, 5, 2, and 1 notes, and must give appropriate change for those who don't have the right money.
title: The Pools Collector

description:
Chopper Raid is a 1 player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player flies over enemy territory in their chopper, and can move up and down while enemies approach from the right. The goal is to drop bombs on enemy ground installations and shoot incoming enemies with their horizontally firing laser. The player has limited fuel, and can pick up more by flying low onto fuel depots, but must avoid hitting other dangers. The player starts with 3 helicopters.
title: Chopper Raid

description:
Money Bags is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The aim of the game is to find as many of the 18 money bags as possible hidden in a 6 x 6 area. The player's vehicle can turn left or right, and move forwards. The vehicle can carry a maximum of 100 fuel, and can find a limited number of fuel depots that entirely refill the tank. If the player hits one of the moving oil slicks, the player loses 25 fuel and is sent back to the starting room. The game ends when fuel runs out.
title: Money Bags

description:
Quassy is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player can move laterally and jump. The goal is to carefully move the character from the starting room onto an elevator. If they move too soon or too late they lose a life. They then have to cross a platform and avoid an incoming spear to reach the end point. Each level is slightly faster. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: Quassy

description:
Red Balloons is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player moves in the cardinal directions on a board with a number of red balloons. Each balloon has a hidden letter which is revealed when the player bumps into it. The goal is to collect all the balloons in alphabetical order by remembering their position. The goal is to burst all the balloons in 60 seconds. On each level 1 more balloon is added.
title: Red Balloons

description:
Signal Box is a puzzle game for the VIC-20.

The goal is to place 10 trains into 10 different sidings by manipulating train switches. Trains start at the central track on the left, and switches are modified by pressing the corresponding number. Every 10 trains safely placed restarts the puzzle with faster moving trains. If two trains end up in the same siding it's game over.
title: Signal Box

description:
Assault from the Deep is an arcade game for the VIC-20.

The war of the universe has been long and hard fought. The terrible enemy was nearly driven from the heavens when suddenly a new outbreak of violence and death broke out on the second star of planet Cesta. Secret ocean bases launched the newest, most powerful explosives known.

The player controls a command base in the center of the screen that can fire in 8 directions. Enemy rockets and saucers blast towards the top of the screen, and the player tries to shoot them down. Miss 10 attacks and it's game over. Sometimes rockets blast towards the player, and they must be destroyed before they hit or it's immediate game over.
title: Assault from the Deep

description:
Asteroid Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a crosshair, and tries to shoot incoming asteroids. Asteroids approach one at a time, and the distance from the player's vessel is shown at the bottom left of the screen. Asteroids approach faster until the player is hit and takes damage. Each hit returns asteroid approach to starting speed. The game is over when the ship takes full damage.
title: Asteroid Attack

description:
Bomber Copter is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

A helicopter flies across a cityscape from left to right. Each crossing brings the helicopter slightly lower. The helicopter can drop up to 10 bombs, each of which will destroy the top most section of a building. The goal is to clear a landing section for the helicopter and then safely land in that clear section without crashing into a building.
title: Bomber Copter

description:
Breakout is a 1 player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small paddle that moves horizontally at the bottom on the screen, trying to bounce a ball to break the blocks above. The player can choose to move the paddle laterally either slowly or quickly. As the player's score gets higher the paddle gets smaller and the ball moves faster and may begin to zigzag. The player can miss 10 balls before game over.
title: Breakout

description:
Card Dealer is a card game for the VIC-20.

Four cards are placed face down on the screen, and after flipping the first card, the player must decide if the next card is higher or lower. If the player correctly guesses each card they double their bet. If the flipped card is identical to the prior the player loses. The player starts with £500.
title: Card Dealer

description:
Carom is an arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player tries to maneuver a bouncing ball to a target by placing angled boards that redirect the ball. Higher scores are achieved by using minimal boards and time to reach their goal.
title: Carom

description:
Cribbage is a 1-player graphical card game for the VIC-20.

The player competes against a computer opponent in a game of Cribbage. Each player receives 6 cards at the beginning of the game, 2 of which are discarded to the crib. Players play their 4 cards, 1 at a time, and score points for specific scores and runs. The final hand score is divided between cards in hand and the active card. One player receives the crib each hand.
title: Cribbage

description:
Cruncher is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a hammer that moves in all directions. Crabs move from left to right across the screen, often moving up and down. The goal is to position the hammer directly above the crab to smash it. If 5 crabs make it across the screen it's game over.
title: Cruncher

description:
Dare Devil Diver is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

A smaller character runs repeatedly across the top of the screen, with several small pools of water at the bottom. The player tries to time their character's jump so they dive into one of the pools of water below. The player receives 100 points for landing in a large pool and 300 points for a small pool. If the player misses a pool or runs across the top of the screen 60 times, it's game over.
title: Dare Devil Diver

description:
Feeding Time is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a hunter in the forest armed with a gun trying to protect themself from attacking wild animals. The animals approach from the cardinal directions, and the player can only turn and fire in these directions. Each hit kills an animal, but a new one takes its place approaching from the edge of the screen. Every 20 animals shot leads to a new level where the animals approach faster. The player starts with 3 lives, and a life is lost if an animal reaches the hunter.
title: Feeding Time

description:
Lost in the Dark is a puzzle game for the VIC-20.

The player's task is to retrieve the Mystical Chalice from the Dark Catacombs. This mystic goblet is locked in a vault, which is guarded by a giant evil spider. The game is divided into a large maze where the walls are blacked out. Intermittent flashes of lightning will temporarily illuminate the paths. The player must navigate to a weapon to kill the spider, and must find the key to unlock the vault to access the goblet.
title: Lost in the Dark

description:
Sorcerer's Gold is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player must navigate underground tunnels infested with goblins, sorcerers, and dragons. The player moves in the cardinal directions, and must avoid enemies while trying to obtain the key to unlock the vault where the gold is held. The sack must be obtained to hold the gold, and then all the gold must be brought to the exit of the labyrinth. The player has 6 minutes to complete this task as many times as possible.
title: Sorcerer's Gold

description:
Hunchy is a 1-player Hunchback clone for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small character that can move laterally and jump along the battlements of a castle. The game is divided into 10 stages, where the goal each stage is to cross the screen and ring the bell on the right in order to save princess Esmerelda on the 10th stage. The player must avoid or duck arrows and fireballs, jump over pits or spearmen, and swing from ropes. Each level has a limited time to reach the bell, and the player receives a score based upon remaining time. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Hunchy

description:
Konkey Kong is a 1-player Donkey Kong clone for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small character who moves laterally and jumps, and tries to reach their girlfriend at the top of the screen. There are 7 platforms with ladders between the levels. Enemies move laterally on each platform, but do not climb ladders. The player starts with 3 lives, and receives points each time they reach their girlfriend. After reaching their girlfriend, they start the same level once again.
title: Konkey Kong

description:
Launch 2031AD is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player launches a spaceship from the bottom of the screen, which tries to navigate between horizontally moving asteroids to reach the top. Green asteroids move particularly facst, while some asteroids have holes that allow the spaceship to pass through. The player starts with 10 lives, and after 10 passes the game speed increases.
title: Launch 2031AD

description:
Mad Painter! is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player attempts to paint the entirety of a canvas. Fast, hungry creatures are after the player and their paintbrush. A devious invisible stomper will walk all over the player's wet paint.
title: Mad Painter!

description:
It's a Living is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player has taken a job working on the production line unloading boxes at an atomic bomb company. The player is positioned in the center of the screen while 4 conveyor belts move boxes towards the player. The player can move their character's hands in 4 directions to pick up boxes as they come. Boxes approach faster as the game progresses, but so does the player's payment per box. If a box falls off the end of the conveyor belt, an atomic explosion ensues, and the employee's contract is terminated.
title: It's a Living!

description:
Mine-Field is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

You have been called upon to deliver 20 messages to a secret hideout (which is an isolated house), over mine fields which become progressively harder. The player has a total of 150 seconds to deliver all messages. After each message is delivered, more mines appear on the screen. The player can move in the cardinal directions and angles, and mines disappear is the player moves an angle past them. If the player hits a mine they lose a life. Lose 3 lives or run out of time, and it's game over.
title: Mine-Field

description:
Miniature Guided Missiles is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The sky is lit up from the glaring blasts of missile fire. Sonic booms ring like tidal waves crashing over cities. The war is on, and high-tech weaponry is deployed by the enemy forces. The player stands on the battlement of their once proud fortress, and look down on their burning town. The city is being ravaged by asteroid attack and enemy missiles. Controlling a hyper-shark fighter, the player moves laterally at the bottom of the screen. The player can shoot and destroying incoming asteroids, but can only dodge missiles which track the player. The goal is to survive as long as possible, and the player starts with 3 lives.
title: Miniature Guided Missiles

description:
Mystery Caves is a 1-player puzzle game for the VIC-20.

Ahead, stands the Mystery Caves; large black pools of darkness, filled with terror, overflowing with danger and containing treasure of a lifetime. The player must enter the dreaded caves, and navigate the maze. The player can make the treasure temporarily appear, and has a limited number of chances to move through the walls. They must be a certain distance from the treasure before attempting to reveal it, and have a total of 120 time units to solve the puzzle.

There are 3 levels of difficulty, which control the number of available views and cut off distance.
title: Mystery Caves

description:
Panzer Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls the turret of a tank from a 1st person perspective, and can move left and right to fire at an enemy tank which moves to the left and right. The player receives 100 points every time they hit an enemy. The enemy tank intermittently returns fire, and if the player is hit 3 times it's game over.
title: Panzer Attack

description:
Qix is a 1-player unofficial port of Qix for the VIC-20.

The player guides a marker, initially on the edges of the screen, to divide the playing field into rectangles or other unusual shapes to claim territory. The smallest area contained by each shape is filled in when a shape is connected at two points to existing territory. While claiming territory, the player needs to watch out for enemies which follow pre-existing lines, and actively chase the player if close. A level is completed by gaining all territory on the screen, dividing the remaining areas into smaller and smaller components. The player starts with 4 lives, and it's game over when touched by an enemy 4 times.
title: Qix

description:
Rescue from Castle Dread is a text adventure for the VIC-20.

The player must rescue the beautiful Princess of Terminal and carry her home to her palace. She has been captured by the evil wizard, who holds her prisoner. The player must manage to pass bridge trolls, dwarves, witches, giant rats, and endless deserts to solve their quest.

There is a save/restore feature, and all commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Rescue from Castle Dread

description:
The Red Baron is a 1-player arcade game for VIC-20.

The player controls a World War I biplane that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen, and can fire directly forwards. Enemy biplanes and zeppelins approach from the top of the screen, and the player gains kills by shooting down the enemies, causing them to burst into flames. Anti-aircraft fire randomly bursts onto the screen, and must be avoided. Clouds can obstruct incoming enemies. It's game over if the player is hit by an enemy or fire.
title: The Red Baron

description:
Sizzle is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player tries to collect all items on a board by walking over them. They are chased by 2 characters who chase the player around the map, moving a few squares towards the player every few turns. The first time a square is covered it turns yellow, the second time it turns red. If the player steps on a red square or is caught by their opponents, they lose a life. A level is completed by collecting all items. The player starts with 3 lives, and there are 9 levels of difficulty.
title: Sizzle

description:
Scramblers is a 1-player puzzle game for the VIC-20.

The player tries to unscramble the letters to spell the name of a TV show, famous star, or US state or capital. The maximum score is 100 points, and the player can request hints including the first letters of the answer, or can also list all possible answers. Any of these activities costs points, and points are also lost for incorrect answers. The player receives 5 points for each correct answer, and the game is over when all potential points are used.
title: Scramblers

description:
Slot Machine is a 1-player memory game for the VIC-20.

The player moves their character through a field with multiple slot machines. Each slot machine is hiding a number from 1 to 7, which costs $10 to temporarily reveal. The player starts with $300, and the goal is to reveal 4 - 7 identical numbers in a row before running out of money. The difficulty level determines how many numbers are required to win.
title: Slot Machine

description:
The Sorcerer and the Princess is a text adventure for the VIC-20.

Woe has befallen the kingdom. The evil Sorcerer has stolen away with the King's favourite, and only, daughter. He has taken her through the Enchanted Woods to his dark dwellings beyond. The King has offered a large reward for her return. The player must battle the elements, the ugly and cunning minions of the Dark One, and perhaps the Sorcerer himself.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save or restore feature.
title: The Sorcerer and the Princess

description:
Space Hopper is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Lost in a space warp in the 21st century, the player is a Space Frog with an abundant will to survive, up against what seems at times to be unfair opposition. The player's only defence is their ability to run. The player's goal is to reach the end of the space warp at the top of the screen.

The player can move left, right, and forwards. They cannot move backwards as they would fall down a black hole. The player cannot make contact with the edge of the screen or the Space Mobiles which move laterally across the screen. Danger lanes are located below the two lanes that contain a single space, and if the player stays too long in this lane they are shot by lasers. The player is awarded points for moving forwards, and receives a bonus upon reaching the top of the screen, and restarts the level. A free Space Frog is awarded every 5000 points.
title: Space Hopper

description:
Sportz is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player competes in the 100m dash, long jump, high jump, hammer throw, 110m hurtles or a full pentathlon. Events involve rapidly pressing buttons to increase player speed. In jumping events, the player must hit the jump button before running across the line and scoring a foul. Players receive a score for each event.
title: Sportz

description:
Squish is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a cross that moves in the cardinal directions, and tries to crush the enemies that move about the screen. Enemies will fire at the player if a direct shot is available. Both enemies and players can move items around the screen, and the player tries to crush the enemies between walls, solid squares, or other movable pieces. If the player touches a bug or is shot they lose a life. The player starts with 3 lives. When all enemies are destroyed the player moves to a level with more starting enemies.

sample_screenshots.caption: More Enemies Appear on Higher Levels

title: Squish

description:
Swamp Monster is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player travels through a swampy forest trying to avoid a chasing monster that intermittently fires horizontally. If the player falls into a lake or is attacked or hit by the monster they lose a life. Small red squares intermittently appear on the screen, and the player must move to these before the square disappear to rescue a princess. The player has 2000 time units to rescue the princess, and scores points based upon remaining time. The player starts with 3 lives, and there are 9 levels of difficulty.
title: Swamp Monster

description:
Time Slip and Treasure Island are two text adventures sold together for the VIC-20.

In Time Slip, the player was exploring in some caves when they were surrounded by flashing colored lights, and transported back to prehistoric times. Starting beside a tall cliff, the player must avoid dangerous dinosaurs to return to the present day.

In Treasure Island, the player must avoid cannibals and other dangers to safely escape the island

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Was Eaten by a T-Rex

title: Time Slip and Treasure Island

description:
Treasure Island is a text adventure for the VIC-20.

The player must find the lost treasure of Eternia on Treasure Island. The player must first escape the dangers of Skull Island, and find a boat to sail to Treasure Island. The player must solve several puzzles during their quest.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and the player can only carry 1 item at a time. There is no save/restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Wardrobe in an Old House

title: Treasure Island

description:
UFO is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls 3 artillery bases at the bottom of the screen that try to shoot incoming enemy missiles. The player moves a targeting arrow at the bottom and right hand of the screen to aim their self-defense. The player has limited shots each round to shoot down incoming missiles, and if they run out of artillery are left vulnerable to incoming fire. Artillery is replenished at the end of each round. When all defending infrastructure is destroyed, it's game over.
title: UFO

description:
Voyager is a Star Trek variant for the VIC-20.

The player's mission is to rid the galaxy of Klingons. The player can choose from 10 galaxy sizes to hunt the enemy aliens. The player's ship is armed with short and long ranged scanners which can be used to locate vessels or nearby stars and starbases. When moving within a quadrant or warping between quadrants the player must input direction from 0 - 359 degrees. The ship has limited energy that can be used to power shields, repair damage, or fire weapons. Ships can be refueled at star bases.
title: Voyager

description:
Warrior is a 2-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Each player controls a light cycle that moves in the cardinal directions, and leaves a tail of light streaking behind them. If a light cycle hits the edge of the screen, an obstacle, or the tail of either cycle they are destroyed. There are 5 levels of difficulty, and score is kept over multiple rounds.
title: Warrior

description:
Yahtsee is a 1 - 3 player text-based implementation of the popular dice game for the VIC-20.

Players take turns rolling five dice, and each turn can choose which dice to keep. The player can reroll the remaining dice for 2 more rounds, keeping the five dice they prefer before choosing their scoring category. Scoring categories include 6 categories which include the sum of all ones to sixes. There is also 3 of a kind, 4 of a kind, full house, a 4 dice straight, a 5 dice straight, yahtzee (5 of a kind) and chance (which is the sum of all dice). A bonus score of 35 is added if the player scores 63 points or more on the sums of 1 - 6. A game is finished when all 11 scoring categories have been used.
title: Yahtsee

description:
Zaxx is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

A small spaceship moves across the screen from left to right, moving slightly lower on the screen each transit. The player can fire directly downwards, and tries to shoot enemies at the bottom of the screen. A number of alien ships appear at the center of the screen, and block player shots. The player gains 5 points for every enemy destroyed. These ships can temporarily be destroyed by shooting them. If the player runs into enemies or blocking ships, it's game over. The player starts with 99 missiles, and regains some of these for every level completed. When all missiles are used, it's game over.
title: Zaxx

description:
Bomber Word is a word game for the VIC-20.

The player has 8 guesses to determine a hidden word from the blanks displayed on the screen. Each incorrect guess causes a bomber fly across the screen and destroy one of the eight houses at the bottom. If all houses are destroyed before the word is guessed, it's game over.
title: Bomber Word

description:
D'Fuse is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small character who can move left and right, climb ladders, and jump a short distance. If the player falls even a short distance off a platform they lose a life. The player must carefully navigate vertically moving platforms. The player's goal is to collect all tools on the screen and then reach and deactivate the bomb at the top of the screen before time runs out. After a successful level, the player restarts the same challenge. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: D'Fuse

description:
Ezam is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player moves a small character through a laterally scrolling maze. The player is armed with bombs that when deployed will spread fire in all directions, so the player must quickly flee after using. Enemies appear through teleporters and roam the maze. These can be killed with bombs. The player has a limited number of bombs, but can acquire more by finding them in the maze. Arrow traps must also be avoided. The player must gather 3 treasures, one at a time, and bring them back to the starting point. They are then rewarded with the key that opens the door at the far right of the level, that allows access to the next challenge. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: Ezam

description:
Mobile Attack is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small ship that moves through horizontally and vertically aligned passageways between buildings. Green enemy ships prowl the streets, and blue enemy ships frequently warp in from the buildings. The player must avoid enemy fire while shooting and destroying all green enemy vessels. The player starts with 5 lives, and there are multiple city layouts.
title: Mobile Attack

description:
Satellite Patrol is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a spaceship positioned in the center of the screen that can scroll in 8 total directions. The ship fires directly forwards, and tries to destroy enemy UFOs and asteroids without getting hit and destroyed. Enemy UFOs launch multiple smaller ships that buzz towards the player. The player starts with 5 ships, and it's game over when all are destroyed.
title: Satellite Patrol

description:
Invasion is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player is under attack by alien vessels, which approach one at a time from the left, attempt to grab a power supply from the right of the screen, and then escape. The player must defend themselves by launching missiles from the top and bottom of the screen, one at a time, to try to destroy the alien vessel. The player receives 10 points for each vessel destroyed, and it's game over when all 4 power supplies are lost. The player receives a final rank for their defensive performance.
title: Invasion

description:
Wraithquest is a role-playing game for the VIC-20.

Welcome to the dark land of Toolin. The player's quest is to recover the four treasures of Almoron, hidden in lakes and forests of the land. The player must travel this dark land besting the monsters and evil spirits that inhabit it. These treasures must then be returned to one of the castles to gain a reward.

The player can choose from the classes: warlock, scholar, savage, warrior, or healer. The player then heads out to explore the land, consisting of forest, water, and 2 castles, in search of the 4 treasures. The player is frequently attacked by monsters during the search.

In combat the player is sometimes given an option to retreat. Each round in combat is in real time, and the player can use their sword to attack the head, body, or leg, or can use their PSI power to cast a spell on the monster.
title: Wraithquest

description:
Hopline is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player tries to move a frog from the bottom to the top of the screen across a series of black bars that move horizontally across the screen left or right. The frog can move left or right, and can jump 1 or 2 spaces forwards or backwards. If the frog hits a white space or the edge of the screen a life is lost. The player gains points each time they safely cross the screen, and starts with 3 lives.
title: Hopline

description:
The Indi 500 Race is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a race car from a third person perspective, and can steer left, right, accelerate, and decelerate. There are 4 levels of difficulty, which control the baseline speed of the approaching vehicles.
title: The Indi 500 Race

description:
The Crypt is a text adventure for the VIC-20.

The player explores the rooms of a large mansion to find the required clues to slay a vampire. Areas include an observatory, gallery, grand hall, kitchen, and more. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is a help option available. There is no save/restore option.
title: The Crypt

description:
Quast is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player can move laterally and jump. The goal is to carefully move the character from the left side of the screen to the bell on the right. They must jump over arrows that appear from the right and fireballs that appear from the left. The player receives points for each square they move and reaching the bell. After completing a level the player starts an identical new level. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Quast

description:
Buggy is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a small vehicle that moves left and right at the bottom of the screen, and must avoid fire from the alien ship above. Holes can be filled in when the player is beside them, or if the player runs over a hole they lose a life. Three lives lost, and it's game over.
title: Buggy

description:
Whirley is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player controls a helicopter that slowly descends towards the ground at a set rate, and must avoid stars in the sky. The helicopter moves left and right, and tries to land on a lorry that drives across the bottom of the screen. The player starts with 3 lives, and gains a point for each successful landing.
title: Whirley

description:
Bomb Scare is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player moves on a 21 x 21 grid, and is not allowed to move on the same position more than once. Red bombs appear on the screen, and the player has 25 seconds to reach them and defuse them. After reaching a bomb, a new bomb appears on a random free square on the screen, including areas that may be impossible to reach. Immobile dangers on the screen further increase danger. The player starts with 5 lives, gains one 1 point for each bomb defused, and loses a life if they touch a previously used square or a danger.
title: Bomb Scare

description:
Brick It is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The player moves a paddle left and right at the bottom of the screen, and tries to bounce a ball so it knocks out the blocks at the top of the screen. Each block hit rewards the player 5 points, but if they miss a ball and it falls off the bottom of the screen it's game over.
title: Brick It

description:
Chopper Run is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

A side-scrolling arcade game, the player maneuvers a helicopter up and down, and can fire straight ahead or drop bombs on the city below. The player must avoid or shoot down incoming enemy rockets. The goal is to completely flatten the city, so that the helicopter can safely land on the ground itself. If the player hits a building or a rocket it's game over.
title: Chopper Run

description:
Rocket Dock is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

A rocket launches from the launchpad at the center of the screen, and tries to dock with a ship at the top. The rocket can move laterally and accelerate, and must avoid asteroids that move horizontally across the screen. The docking ship also moves laterally across the screen. If the player hits an asteroid or misses the docking ship they lose a life. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Rocket Dock

alternate_titles.description: Titled as such solely at the original magazine article.
alternate_titles.title: Goldgrabber

description: Deep underground lies a vast labyrinth made by people long gone. They faded away, leaving behind their gold in their former domain, nowadays inhabited by denizens such as dragons, orcs, vampires and such. Your role is an adventurer attempting to explore the uncharted depths and escape with your life -and as much treasure as you can grab. This game is a quasi-RPG that involves maze exploration and turn based battles. You control a single unnamed character and at your disposal you have a generic melee attack and a generic offensive magic spell to dispatch nasties. At any given time you can invoke a statistics screen to check your strength and agility points, both of which are depleted as you move and fight your way in the levels. The maze itself spans numerous floors, connected by staircases and one-way pits. As you progress to lower depths, the game pits you against tougher enemies. The game ends if you return to the surface the same way you entered, with all the loot you managed to grab - or if you perish. Quest 26 is written in BASIC and was published as a type-in program in the British Magazine "Your Computer" in August 1983.

sample_screenshots.caption: Magic spells are powerful, but you have a finite supply and eventually will run out.
A hostile encounter! A)ttack, R)atings -actually the stats- or M)agic spell?
The dragon was defeated and left some loot.
By pressing R) you can take a peek at your stats.
At the very beginning the game asks you to type a three digit number to randomize the maze layout.

title: Quest 26

description:
VIC Lemonade is a business simulation for the VIC-20.

Strive to become the lemonade tycoon of the block while learning business economics. The player must balance the factors of price, amount, and advertising costs to out-sell the competition.
title: VIC Lemonade

description:
Gold Diggers is an arcade game for the VIC-20.

The legendary treasure of the pirate villain Bluelester has finally been found in the Dry Tortugas. Unfortunately, the gold bars are being guarded by the ferocious Red Dragon.

The player must tunnel through the Red Dragon's domain and retrieve the treasure without being caught.
title: Gold Diggers

description:
Space Quest is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

Far in the future, in a time when man's knowledge of space and time has reduced the vastness of the galaxy into a mapped series of accessible quadrants, the freedom of mankind to grow and explore is being threatened by the Microchines. Microchine fighters have recently jumped into the quadrants, and have reprogrammed several exploration ships, such that they travelled to their own doom. The player controls the ship Skye's Limited II, and must end the Microchine danger.

Played on a 10 x 10 grid, the player can hyperspace to different areas. Some of these may contain asteroid fields, and the player must dodge these from a top-down perspective by moving left and right. If the player enters a quadrant with enemy ships, they try to line up a crosshair to destroy the enemy vessels from a 1st-person perspective. The ship has limited fuel, and each jump and battle reduces this. The player refuels at fuel bases, and the player must navigate a treacherous cavern system from a top-down perspective. There are four levels of difficulty.
title: Space Quest

description:
Bug Blaster is a Centipede clone for the VIC-20.

Blast through waves of incoming bugs, while avoiding the many dangers.
title: Bug Blaster

description:
Space Conqueror is a 1-player arcade game for the VIC-20.

The deposed Emperor Zor plans diabolical revenge on Zebulon Galaxy. From an outpost in the Northern Region, he sends red ships to destroy the defenders. The player must destroy these ships and Zor's four space stations before they pulverize the galaxy. The goal is to eliminate all four stations; there are four levels of difficulty.
title: Space Conqueror

sample_screenshots.caption: Yellow things fly in your way
